loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 43 years old and lives with her husband in their own house. She has a shop where she sells essential items such as beans, milk, eggs and bread. She has had this business for 12 years, and this has provided her with sales experience that has allowed her to increase her sales. It is located in her house, and is well-known by the inhabitants of the area. She has a lot of customers, since her shop is well-stocked. 

Marissa wants to expand her business and carry out a new investment but she needs capital, and for this reason, she is asking for a loan so that she can buy the necessary items for her shop, and in this way improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy snack foods, canned goods, noodles, coffee, sugar and spices.

loans.name: Shahodat

texts.ru:
Шаходат живет в городе Канибадам, замужем и имеет двоих детей. Ей  сорок четыре года. По семейным обстоятельствам  Шаходат не смогла получить высшее  образование, так как с детства в ее семье были финансовые проблемы.   Супруг ее был вынужден уехать в РФ , так как были сложности с работой на родине.
  Шаходат занимается купле -продажей  хоз товаром. По началу ей было очень трудно так как она нуждалась в денежных средствах. В 2008 году она арендовала магазин для бизнеса и вот спустя пять лет на накопленные деньги от продажи хоз товаров она приобрела собственный магазин на местном рынке. В 2012 году по совету знакомых Шаходат обратилась в МДО «Арванд» за кредитом. На полученный кредит она  увеличила свой ассортимент и тем самым повысила свой семейный доход.   Она  очень рада, что обратилась в Арванд .  У нее  большие планы на будущее, она очень хочет, чтобы ее дети учились в высших учебных заведениях и поэтому старается  делать все, чтобы добиться своей цели. 
На полученный кредит  Шаходат  опять хочет купить хоз товары и увеличить свой ассортимент.   Она очень благодарна организации  Арванд, так как с помощью таких организаций люди, имеющие финансовые проблемы могут осуществить свои планы.
texts.en: Shahodat lives in the city Kanibadam.  She is 44 years old, married and has two children.  She was unable to receive a higher education since her family has had financial problems since she was just a child.  Shahodat's husband is a migrant worker in Russia since it's difficult to find work in Tajikistan.  She buys and sells household products.  In the beginning, it was difficult because she needed funds.  In 2008, she rented a store at a local market and 5 years later, in 2012, she bought her own store with the money she earned.  Last year, she was advised to turn to Arvand to take out a loan.  With that capital, she expanded her selection of inventory and coincidentally increased her family's income.  She is very glad that she made the decision to use Arvand.  She has big plans for the future and very much wants her children to go to college and does everything in her power to reach this goal.  With this loan, Shahodat again will buy household products to expand her inventory.  She is very grateful to Arvand since with the help of such organizations, those with financial problems can achieve their goals.

loans.use: to purchase household goods

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz vive con su esposo y su hijo en alquiler en la zona de Agua de la Vida de la ciudad de La Paz, trabaja como empleada en una institución del Estado siendo un sostén importante en la economía de su familia.

Requiere el crédito para la compra de instrumentos musicales (dos guitarras acústicas, dos zampoñas, un bombo) ya que su hijo estudia para ser profesor de música.

El sueño de Beatriz es que su hijo cumpla su meta y así poder tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Beatriz lives with her husband and her son in a rented house in the area of Agua de la Vida, La Paz. She is an employee of a State institution and her job represents an important financial support for her family. 

She's requesting a loan to buy musical instruments (two acoustic guitars, two rustic flutes and a bass drum) for his son, who is studying to become a music teacher. Beatriz's dream is for him to fulfill his goal and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy musical instruments for his son, who is studying to become a music teacher.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna es estudiante de contabilidad, vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Miraflores de la ciudad de La Paz. Trabaja como comerciante de joyas la mayor parte del día y estudia por las noches.

Reyna necesita el crédito para la compra de mercadería (anillos, aretes, brazaletes, etc.) ya que por comienzo de año, todo su presupuesto fue destinado a estudios.

El sueño de Reyna es terminar sus estudios y poder independizarse.
texts.en:
Reyna is an Accounting student and lives with her parents in the area of Miraflores, La Paz. She works selling jewelry most of the day and studies at night. 

She needs a loan to buy products (rings, earrings, bracelets, etc.) given that she spent all of her budget in tuition at the beginning of the year. 

Her dream is to finish her studies and to become independent.

loans.use: to buy rings, earrings, bracelets and other items for her jewelry sales business.

loans.name: Maxima

texts.en:
Maxima is a proud mother of four. Three of her children are now employed and her youngest child is still in high school. 

She is continuously generating income to maintain her ukay-ukay (used clothing) business and not only rely on her children's remittances. She also sells longganisa (pork sausages) for additional income. 

Maxima is now asking for a loan of PHP 40,000 to buy more used clothes, shoes, bags, and caps to sell. 

This will help maintain good profits from the business, and she will someday achieve financial stability.

loans.use: to buy more used clothes, shoes, bags, and caps to sell.

loans.name: Vitaliana

texts.en:
Vitaliana is 34 years old and married with four children who are all in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Vitaliana has a general store business in the Philippines. Vitaliana requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Vitaliana has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, Vitaliana would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Matalena

texts.en: Matalena is a 35-years-old married woman with seven children. She has a small plantation and grows banana trees and taro plants to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years. Matalena has requested a loan to buy equipment and fertilizer for the good of her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. With her profits, Matalena hopes to extend her business and save more money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, a wheel barrow, shovels, and bush knives

loans.name: Oscar Danilo

texts.es:
Oscar, 35 años de edad, originario de la comarca Las Canoas, casado padre de 3 hijos  de 15,11 y 5años  edad, él se dedica a vender piedras canteras (piedras para la construcción de casas), lleva 5 años dedicándose a este negocio. El empezó trabajando como cargador de piedras desde  muy joven a veces era chofer otras trabajaba como vendedor y cargador al mismo tiempo pero se propuso ahorrar para comprar su camión con el objetivo de independizarse y emprender su propio negocio durante 5 años ahorro hasta lograr comprar su camión usado que se lo vendió su antiguo jefe. Él viaja hasta la capital Managua a vender piedras canteras tiene dos ayudantes. Le gusta salir adelante y tratar de darle lo mejor que puede a sus hijos él tiene como proyecto poner una pulpería en su casa de habitación para que su esposa la administre y de esta manera conseguir otras formas de ingreso. Él está solicitando el crédito para comprar 2 llantas  y piedras canteras para vender. 
El crédito le permitirá mantener en buenas condiciones su camión que es su herramienta principal así también tener material para vender. En lo futuro le gustaría comprar un camión.
texts.en: Oscar is 35 years old and he is from the Las Canoas district.  He is married and the father of three children, ages 15, 11, and 5.  He is engaged in selling quarry stone (stones for home construction) and has been in this business for five years.  He began working as a stone loader at a very young age.  Sometimes, he was a driver and at other times he worked as a salesman and loader at the same time.  But he put his mind to saving to buy a truck with the goal of becoming independent and establishing his own business.  He saved for five years until he was able to buy a used truck that his old boss sold to him.  He has two helpers when he makes the trip to the capital city of Managua to sell quarry stone.  He is pleased to be getting ahead and tries to provide the best he can to his children.  One of the projects he has planned is to install a general store in his home for his wife to manage and in this way, gain another source of income.  He is requesting the loan to purchase two tires and quarry stones to sell.  The loan will permit him to maintain his truck in good condition since it is his main tool.  In addition, he will have material to sell.  In the future, he would like to purchase a truck.

loans.use: to purchase two tires and quarry stones to sell.

loans.name: Margot

texts.es:
Margot vive en alquiler con su familia en la zona de San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz, trabaja como empleada en una institución aseguradora.

Requiere el crédito para poder inscribir a su hijo a la Universidad y comprar los útiles y herramientas necesarias para cursar el primer semestre de estudios.

El sueño de Margot es preparar a su hijo para que pueda estudiar y ser profesional.
texts.en:
Margot rents a home with her family in the San Pedro area of the city of La Paz. She works as an employee at an insurance company.

She needs the loan to register her son at college and buy the school supplies and tools he will need for his first semester of studies

Margot's dream is to prepare her son so he can to go to school and have a good career.

loans.use: to pay for the cost of her son's college registration.

loans.name: Mariana

texts.es:
Mariana es soltera y vive en alquiler con su mamá y su hermano en un hogar humilde de la zona de Tembladerani en la ciudad de La Paz. Ella se dedica al comercio a través de una pequeña tienda de barrio la cual administra mientras no está estudiando.

Ella requiere el crédito para la compra de mercadería (fideo, arroz, refrescos, azúcar, leche), ya que desea expandir su negocio y así aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar su estilo de vida.

El sueño de Mariana es hacer crecer su negocio y poder conseguir un lugar propio para vivir.
texts.en:
Mariana is single.  She and her mother and her brother live in a humble, rented home in the Tembladerani area of the city of La Paz.  She runs a small neighborhood store when she is not in school.

She needs the loan to buy merchandise (noodles, rice, soft drinks, sugar, and milk).  She wishes to expand her business, increase her income, and improve her lifestyle.

Mariana’s dream is to make her business grow and to be able to get her own place to live.

loans.use: to buy noodles, rice, sugar, milk, and other products to stock her neighborhood store.

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es:
Emiliana es soltera y trabaja como secretaria en una entidad pública. Vive en casa propia en la zona de Vino Tinto de la ciudad de La Paz. Lamentablemente su casa carece de infraestructura para poder ser habitada apropiadamente.

Es por eso que solicita el crédito, Emiliana quiere construir y refaccionar su hogar para poder ser habitable y así mejorar su calidad de vida. Necesita comprar ladrillos, arena, cemento y pagar a los albañiles.

El sueño de Emiliana es mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Emiliana is single.  She works as a secretary for a public entity.  She lives in her own house in the Vino Tinto area of the city of La Paz.  Sadly, her house lacks the infrastructure to be able to live in it suitably.

That is why she is requesting the loan.  Emiliana wants to build and repair her home in order to make it livable.  This way she will improve the quality of her life.  She needs to buy bricks, sand, and cement.  She also needs to pay the bricklayers.

Emiliana’s dream is to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy bricks, sand, and cement, and to pay bricklayers to repair her house.

loans.name: Ailepata

texts.en: Ailepata is 39 years old and married with four children. She wants to start a small business making and selling rice and curry, snacks, and soft drinks in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy bags of rice, cartons of chicken, drinks, etc. In the future, Ailepata hopes to improve her business to help her kids' education and her family. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy rice, cartons of chicken, onions, salt, cooking oil, and soft drinks

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy grocery items for grocery selling business

loans.name: Telematina

texts.en: Telematina is 38 years old and married with two children. She makes and sells weaving fans, 'kava' bowls, 'tapa' cloths, carvings, 'kava' cups, and 'elei' (block printing) materials to earn a living and has been doing this for two years. Telematina has requested a loan to buy wood for carvings, 'pandanus', paints, design boards, and carving tools. She plans to use her profits to improve her business and help her kids' education. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy wood for carving, as well as design boards, paints, and 'pandanus'

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: Alejandro de 39 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de desinfectantes que el mismo prepara. Este negocio nación desde el 1999, cuando un amigo le enseñó a producirlos y desde ese mismo momento, empezó a vender. Poco a poco fue abordando a una clientela doméstica,  conformada por familiares y amigos y posteriormente abordó otros sectores ubicados alrededor de su vivienda donde los produce. En la actualidad requiere hacer compras de  insumos en un mayor volumen, para generar menores cosos de producción y ser más competitivos con sus precios y por eso acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará escencias, envases, para aumentar el volumen de su producción. Sus ventas y sus compras las realiza de contado y sus principales clientes actuales, son los comerciantes propietarios de locales y hoteles. Su meta más adelante es convertirse en mayorista  y responder a la potencialidad que le brinda el mercado, con el fin de  aumentar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Alejandro, 39, makes a living selling disinfectant that he himself makes.  He started the business in 1999 when a friend taught him to make the product and right then he began to sell it.  Little by little he began to build a domestic clientele made up of family members and friends, and later he attracted other sectors around his house where he makes the product.

Currently he needs to buy supplies in bulk to have lower production costs and be more competitive with his prices.  This is why he's requesting a Kiva loan, his first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He'll buy essences and containers to increase his production volume.

He makes his purchases and sales in cash and currently his main customers are merchants who own hotels and establishments.  His long-term goal is to become a wholesaler and respond to the potential demand of the market, with the goal of improving his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy essences and containers

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga de 41 años de edad vive en el municipio de Soledad; allí de dedica  a la venta de accesorios para celulares y ofrece servicios técnicos  de mantenimiento y reparación de estos. Su idea de negocio nació desde el año 2009, cuando su cónyuge, por trabajar como empleado en un local, le propuso iniciar ese mismo negocio y reunieron un capital para emprenderlo. Su oferta la hace de contado, trabajando de  lunes a domingos y desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. Los principales clientes son sus vecinos del barrio y de otros sectores, que poco a poco se han ido agregando a su base de clientes. Su meta es crecer y más adelante convertirse en mayorista, para darle a sus hijos oportunidades y tener un futuro de mayor bienestar. En la actualidad está aplicando aun credikiva, con el cual comprará accesorios para celulares, pues son los artículos que tienen una mayor rotación en su negocio y hacen de su credikiva una exitosa inversión.
texts.en:
Olga, 41 years old, lives in the town of Soledad. There, she sells accessories for cellular phones and offers technical maintenance and repair services. Her idea for this business was born in 2009 when her spouse, working as an employee in a store, proposed that she start the same business, and they gathered capital to launch it. 

She makes her sales in cash, working from Monday through Sunday, from 7 in the morning to 9 at night. Her main customers are her neighbors from her neighborhood and other sectors, which have, little by little, been adding to her client base. Her goal is to grow and later become a wholesaler to give her children opportunities and have future of greater prosperity.

Currently, she is applying for a Kiva loan, with which she will buy accessories for cellular phones. These are the items that have a higher turnover in her business and make her Kiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to purchase accessories for cellular phones.

loans.name: Solanye Sarita

texts.es:
Solanye es una mujer de 21 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en distrito de Parcona con sus padres y hermanos, Solanye es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar para apoyar a sus padres con los gastos de su hogar, Solanye no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas, pero le gustaría poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver películas y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Pollo al Horno para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Solanye trabaja como empleada del hogar, brindando servicios de limpieza, lavandería y otros, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su responsabilidad y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Solanye se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una cocina, la cual le servirá de mucho, ya que actualmente cuenta con una cocina a kerosene la cual presente desperfectos y es peligroso su uso, así pues Solanye seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder convertirse en una gran profesional.
texts.en:
Solanye is 21 years old and lives in the city of Ica, within the Parcona district, along with her parents and siblings. [She] is a very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic woman who puts forth all of her efforts to get ahead.

Unfortunately she was not able to study for a management career due to lack of resources and the need to go to work to help her parents, but she would have liked to do it.  She likes to watch movies in her spare time and sometimes likes to cook a delicious roasted chicken to share with her family.

On her own initiative and with much effort and dedication, Solanye works providing cleaning, washing, and other services for about ten hours a day.  She believes that things are going well for us because of the friendly treatment she gives others.

Solanye is very grateful to the Kiva investors because their help will make it possible for her to buy her stove, which will be very useful to her because she currently cooks with kerosene which is not perfect and is dangerous to use.  In this way Solanye will continue to work and make an effort to achieve her greatest dream of becoming a great professional.

loans.use: to buy a stove.

loans.name: Ruvelyn

texts.en:
Ruvelyn is 38 years old and married with three children currently going to school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Ruvelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, canned goods, etc.

Ruvelyn has been in this business for five years.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store.

In the future Ruvelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Lealofi

texts.en: Lealofi is a 49-year-old married woman with six children. She has a small plantation and grows bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. Lealofi has requested a loan to purchase equipment for her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. With her profits, Lealofi hopes to save more money to expand her business and to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use:
to buy fertilizer, a wheelbarrow, a grass cutter
and shovels

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is 33 years old. She is from the village of Guam. Jocelyn is happily married to Larry. The couple is thankful because they have been blessed with two children. To raise her family, Jocelyn engaged in the retailing business. She has been in this business for three years. She wants to continue to grow and expand her business. To make it possible, Jocelyn is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 20,000 to purchase more products to sell such as canned goods, noodles, condiments and beverages. She hopes that she can get the amount she requested to further develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase more products to sell such as canned goods, noodles, condiments and beverages

loans.name: Gracelyn

texts.en:
Gracelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling firewood in the Philippines.

Gracelyn requested a PHP 15000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. in order to buy more firewood to sell.

She has been in this business for four years.

In the future, Gracelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell.

loans.name: Penina

texts.en: Penina is a 42-year-old married woman with three children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, bananas ,taamu and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. Penina has requested a loan to buy spades, weedkillers, weed spray, fertilizers, chemicals and pairs of gloves. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. With her profits, Penina hopes to improve her business and help her kids' education.

loans.use: to buy spades, weedkiller, chemicals and gloves

loans.name: Nanis Maria

texts.es:
Nanis de 48 años vive al sur de la ciudad con su cónyuge y tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 7 y 25 años. Ella en su actividad comercial vende productos variados a crédito, mediante guías especializadas o catálogos, de los que siempre está atenta a su promoción. Desde muy joven trabajó como empleada y posteriormente cuando no conseguía empleo, su negocio se convirtió en la mejor alternativa de ingresos para ayudar a su familia y desarrollar su hogar. Su meta mas adelante es tener un local, lograr crecimiento empresarial, pero su mayor desafío es no tener suficiente capital de trabajo para lograr la meta. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, segundo financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará ropa, con ello tendrá disponibilidad en la entrega de mercancías a sus fieles clientes, especialmente porque se acerca la temporada en la que el volumen de sus ventas se incrementan; así es que Nanis necesita tener un fondo de capital, para responder a esta demanda. 
Nanis con su anterior credito a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, compró perfumería, cremas y productos capilares, que en sus catálogos llegaron con muy buenos descuentos; esto fue una gran oportunidad para aumentar sus ganancias, tener un inventario que rotó rápidamente y para poder ofrecer mejores precios a sus clientes. Hoy está apoyando cada vez más a su hijo con los gastos de la universidad. Su mensaje  es de mucho agradecimiento y le pide a Dios que los mantenga con ese buen corazón y ganas de ayudar. “
texts.en:
Nanis, age 48, lives to the south of the city with her husband.  She has two children, ages 7 and 25.  Her business activity is selling various products from specialized guides or catalogs, which she always watches for sales.  She sells on credit.

When she was very young she worked as an employee.  Later, when she could not find work, her business became the best income alternative to help her family and advance her household.  Her goal for later on is to have a place and to achieve growth in her business. 

However, her greatest challenge is not having enough working capital to achieve this goal.  That is the reason that she turns to a Kiva loan, her second loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use the loan to buy clothes, which she will have ready to deliver to her loyal customers.  The season in which the volume of sales increases is approaching.  That is why Nanis needs to have working capital to respond to this demand.

With her previous loan from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo she bought perfume, creams, and hair care products.  They came in her catalogs with very good discounts.  This was a great opportunity to increase her profits, to have inventory that turned over quickly, and to offer her customers better prices.

She is now supporting her son even more with the university expenses.  Her message is one of great gratitude.  She asks God to keep you with this good heart and desire to help.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Maria Ascención

texts.es: Maria de 69 años de edad, es una mujer casada madre de 6 hijos en edades adultas. Ella habita al sur de la ciudad, donde comercializa calzado, perfumería, ropa y productos de aseo,  desde el año 1991, cuando se sintió sin hacer nada y queriendo tener su propio dinero para soportar sus gastos, fue haciendo economía domestica de lo que su esposo le daba para el sustento de su familia y reunió su primer capital, para comprar artículos económicos y venderlos a crédito entre sus familiares, vecinos y amigos, que fueron su primer mercado real. En la actualidad vende no solo a crédito, sino también de contado, durante todos los días e inicia su actividad desde la 9 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde. Sus compras las realiza de contado en el país vecino y en almacenes ubicados en la ciudad de Barranquilla. Maria ha recibido 3 financiamientos de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con los cuales ha logrado adecuar su infraestructura con vitrinas, y surtirlas, para impactar a su clientela y despertar en ella su atención, interés deseo y acción de compra de sus productos. Su meta es hacer crecer su negocio, cada vez mas, por eso está atenta de obtener créditos, para aportarle a su capital de trabajo y aumentar sus ingresos. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará suéteres, calzado, jeans, perfumería, útiles de aseo personal, entre otros artículos de mayor rotación, que le proporcionan ingresos inmediatos, y esto es justamente lo que hace que su credikiva sea una inversión exitosa
texts.en:
Maria, 69 years old, is a married woman who is the mother of six adult children. She lives in the south of the city, where she sells footwear, perfumes, clothes, and personal cleaning products. She began in 1991, when she felt that she was not doing anything and wanted to have her own money to pay her expenses. She was managing the domestic expenses with what her husband gave her to support her family and gathered her first capital to buy inexpensive articles and sell them on credit to her family members, neighbors, and friends, who were her first true market.

Currently, she sells not only on credit, but also in cash. Every day she begins working at 9 in the morning and ends at 6 in the evening. She makes her purchases in cash in the neighboring country and in department stores situated in the city of Barranquilla.

Maria has received three financings from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she has been able to adapt her store with showcases and fill them, in order to make an impact on her customers and grab their attention, awaken their interest, desires, and inspire their purchase of her products. Her goal is to make her business grow more all the time, and because of this she is attentive to obtain loans to invest in the capital of her store and increase her income. This is the reason why she turns to a Kiva loan, by means of which she will buy sweaters, footwear, jeans, perfumes, personal cleaning products, among other articles with a greater turnover that provide her immediate income. This is precisely what makes her Kiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy sweaters, footwear, jeans, perfumes, and personal cleaning products.

loans.name: Antonina Jeronima

texts.es:
Antonina es una mujer de 28 años, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial con sus dos hijas, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a sus pequeñas, ya que Antonina es padre y madre para ellas; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Antonina no pudo culminar sus estudios secundarios y tampoco curso una carrera profesional, en sus ratos libres le gusta preparar deliciosos postres para engreír a sus pequeñas.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Antonina trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de comida, ella prepara deliciosos potajes de su región y los vende a diversos trabajadores de minas, fundos y otros, Antonina trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buena sazón y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Antonina se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea comprar una puerta de fierro, así como esteras y plásticos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para poder reforzar el techo de su vivienda y poner mayor seguridad en su hogar, así pues Antonina seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder construir su vivienda con materiales adecuados y resistentes que brinden mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia.
texts.en:
Antonina is a 28 year old woman who lives in the city of Cañete, within the Imperial district, along with her two daughters, whom she loves and are her main reason for living.  She is a very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who puts forth all her effort in getting her daughters ahead, since she is both mother and father to them.  Unfortunately she was not able to finish her secondary education or study for a professional career, because she had to go to work to help her parents due to lack of resources.  She likes to prepare delicious desserts for her little girls in her spare time.

Because of her initiative and dedication, she works in her small business, selling food, where she prepares her delicious regional desserts and sells them to various mine workers and other people.  Antonina works every day for about ten hours and believes that things are going well for her because of her good seasonings and friendly service.

Antonina is very grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to their help she will be able to make improvements to her home.  She wants to buy an iron door and mats that will be very useful for her to reenforce her roof and improve the security in her home.  Antonina will continue to work toward achieving her greatest dream of building her home with solid materials that will bring her greater security and improve her family's wellbeing

loans.use: to buy materials.

loans.name: Amigas Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Amigas, ya tienen 5 ciclos con su crédito y son gente muy pagadoras. Esta integrado por 7 mujeres trabajadoras y una de ellas es la Sra. Josefina, tiene 38 años, es casada y tiene dos hijos de 10 y 19 años. Ella se dedica a la venta de joyería y dulces; comenzó hace 4 años vendiendo poquitos dulces, le fue bien y va surtiendo cada vez más, después agrego la venta de joyería de plata y también un snak con renta de maquinitas para sus pequeños clientes. Su sueño es tener un local de venta de dulces tradicionales. Este grupo es bueno y quieren seguir como hasta ahorita en el crédito.
texts.en:
This group, Amigas, has five loan cycles already and it's made up of seven hardworking women who are very good for the money.

One of them is Josefina, 38.  She's married and has two children, ages 10 and 19.  She makes a living selling jewelry and sweets.  She began four years ago selling a few sweets.  It went well for her and she kept on stocking more all the time.  Later she added silver jewelry and a snack bar with machines for her young customers.  Her dream is to have a locale to sell traditional sweets.

This is a good group and they want to continue with their loans as they have up to now.

loans.use: to stock traditional sweets and jewelry

loans.name: Silvia De La Concepcion

texts.es:
Silvia, 52 años de edad, es una humilde ama de casa, soltera originaria de León,  madre de 2 hijos de 28 y 31 años, actualmente los dos trabajan, son independiente, ella además de realizar las labores del hogar también se dedica a la venta de comida  desde hace 6  años. Ella inicio su actividad vendiendo nacatamales, luego con el tiempo dejo de hacer esta actividad porque no le generaba  muchos ingresos, pero esto no la  detuvo a  Silvia,  ellas con sus grandes deseo de superación decide poner el  negocio de venta de comida en su casa de habitación, pues se siente muy bien porque este negocio le genera ganancias adiarías porque cuenta con clientes fijos, en su negocio, cuenta con el apoyo de 2 personas a quien le pagan mano de obra, sus productos lo comercializa en la misma zona y en los alrededores de la comunidad, aunque a ella le gustaría dar a conocer sus productos en otra zona para obtener mas ingresos.
Silvia esta solicitando el financiamiento para comprar  arroz, frijoles, pollo,  huevo, queso, plátano, aceite, carne, etc. Toda la materia prima para elaborar su deliciosa comida. Ella estima que  este crédito  será de mucha ayuda, ya que podrá invertir en su negocio ofreciendo variedad de comida, con el objetivo de ir incrementado sus venta cada día y  generando a la vez mas ganancias, sus planes futuros es llegar a poner un comedor  mas grande para tener mayor éxito en la venta de sus comidas con la esperanza de mantener el negocio y salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Silvia, 52, is a modest single woman from León who works at home.  She's single and the mother of two children, ages 28 and 31, both of whom currently work and are independent.

In addition to doing the household chores she has made a living selling food for six years.  She started her job selling Nicaraguan tamales.  In time she stopped doing that job because it didn't generate much income for her.  This didn't stop Silvia, though.  With her great desire for improvement she decided to set up a business selling food at home.  She feels good because this business generates daily profits for her from her regular customers. 

Two paid employees help her in the business.  She sells her products in her area and on the outskirts of the community, although she would like her products to be known in another area so she could earn more income.

Silvia's requesting the loan to buy rice, beans, chicken, eggs, cheese, plantains, oil, meat, etc.--all the ingredients she needs to make her delicious food.  She thinks this loan will be a big help because she'll be able to invest in her business by offering a variety of food.

Her goal is to keep on increasing her sales every day and generating more profit all the time.  Her plan for the future is to manage to set up a bigger restaurant to be more successful selling her food in the hopes of supporting the business and getting ahead with her family.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, chicken, eggs, cheese, plantains, oil, meat, etc.

loans.name: Obdulia

texts.es:
Obdulia de 41 años de edad , esta casada con Agripino y tiene 6 hijos con quienes vive en la casa construida a base de madera en la zona urbana de su localidad.Todos los días y desde muy temprano, se dirige a su campo de cultivo para  ver el crecimiento y avance de sus plantas de cacao que con mucho esmero logra cultivar desde hace 20 años. Lo reconfortante de su labor es que gracias a las cosechas que obtiene puede solventar los gastos de su familia; una de las cosas que dificultan el normal desempeño de su labor , es la  temporada de lluvia porque es donde no puede ver el avance ni mucho menos realizar los deshierbos respectivos  que aquejan su producción. Con el tiempo quiere obtener grandes producciones, cultivando mas plantas de cacao para que de esa manera llegue a tener una buena economía , pero por el momento su mayor prioridad es mantener sanas y productivas sus terrenos de cultivo.
Este viene a ser su segundo crédito con Kiva y se muestra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada esperando seguir contando con la confianza respectiva.Con los S/.3,000 nuevos soles contratara trabajadores del lugar para realizar el primer deshierbo de maleza perteneciente a la actual campaña de cacao.
texts.en:
Obdulia is 41-years-old, she is marred to Agripino, and she has 6 kids with whom she lives in a house built on a wooden base in the urban zone of her neighborhood. Starting very early everyday she goes to her field to check the growth of the crops. For the past 20 years she has been conscientious in tending to her cocoa plants.  The comforting part of her work is that she is able to help with the household expenses due to her crops. One thing that makes her work more difficult is the rainy season. She is not able to see far in advance, much less do the weeding that her production requires. 

Over time she wants to have a large production, harvesting more cocoa plants so that she can have a good income. For the moment her first priority is to maintain a healthy and productive land. 

This is her second loan from Kiva and she is grateful for the opportunity provided. She hopes to continue counting on the confidence provided. With the 3000 new soles she will hire workers in order to complete the weeding of the current cocoa harvest.

loans.use: to hire workers

loans.name: Mercedes Mafalda

texts.es:
La Señora Mercedes Mafalda  es  Madre de tres hijos y se desempeña como profesora docente de unos de los colegios de la ciudad de león desde hace mas de 5 años dando el pan del saber a sus alumnos,  ella realiza esta labor para llevar el sustento de su familia.

Doña Mercedes además de trabajar como docente vende cosméticos a sus compañeras labores y público en general, debido a este tipo de trabajo se presentó a Ceprodel a solicitar un crédito para ser  utilizado en  compra  de cosméticos tales como: perfumes, pinturas de uñas y de labios , cremas, shampoo Vanidades, etc. 

Ella realiza estas labores para tener más ingresos y lograr un mejor nivel de vida de ella y la de su familia, ya que   sueña con  la preparación de su tres hijos.
texts.en:
Mercedes Mafalda is the mother of three children. She has worked as a teacher in one of the schools in the city of León for more than five years, giving the gift of knowledge to her students. She carries out this work to provide for her family.

In addition to working as a teacher, Mercedes sells cosmetics to her coworkers and the general public. Because of this work, she approached Ceprodel to request a loan to be used to purchase cosmetics like perfumes, nail polish, creams, shampoo, compacts, etc.

Mercedes does this work in order to have more income and attain a better standard of living for herself and her family, since she dreams of educating her three children.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, nail polish, lipstick, creams, shampoos, and compacts.

loans.name: Rolando Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Rolando Alberto, ingeniero civil, trabaja como contratista de construcción, en la ciudad de Managua, tiene 10 años de dedicarse a esta actividad.
 
 Solicita un préstamo para invertir en compra de materiales de construcción para finalizar un trabajo de un puente peatonal. El ha realizado varios proyectos de construcción y de esta manera ha mejorado su vivienda esto le ha permitido llevar el sustento a su hogar y tener  una  condición mejor de vida y la de su familia.

Agradece  a  Ceprodel y Kiva, por la oportunidad y la confianza depositada en el, por lo que este crédito lo invertirá en su vivienda   de forma que esto le permitirá ir mejorando su condición de vida y la de su familia al mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en: Rolando Alberto is a civil engineer. He has worked for 10 years as a construction contractor in the city of Managua. He is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of construction materials to complete a pedestrian bridge. He has completed various construction project and through his work he has been able to improve his life, sustain his household, and have a better condition for his life and that of his family. He is grateful to Ceprodel and Kiva for the opportunity and the confidence demonstrated to him. He will use this loan to invest in his housing and this will allow him to improve the condition of himself and his family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is 36 years old. He is a hard-working man with a great desire to learn. He is married and has two children who he loves very much; they are both in school. 

Benjamin owns a business in his hometown of Luanshya, where he lives with his family. His business deals in mobile money transfers. This means that people go to Benjamin's shop to receive and send money to their loved ones. 

He has applied for a loan to enable him serve customers who want to send and receive large amounts of money from his shop. Right now, Benjamin says he is not able to serve customers who want to transact large amounts because he does not have enough working capital to do so.

This is Benjamin's first loan and he is grateful for the opportunity to finally grow his business. He dreams of owning a pool of businesses and employing a lot of young people so that he can contribute to the economy.

loans.use: to gain working capital to serve customers who want to send and receive large amounts of money.

loans.name: Olita

texts.en:
Olita is a 28-year-old married woman with 3 children. She would like to start growing banana trees to earn a living. 

Olita has requested a loan to buy equipment (such as fertilizer, bush knives, and a wheelbarrow) and banana trees for her business. She has been a member of SPBD for 2 years. Olita will spend her profits to pay her children's school fees and save some money for the future of her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, bush knives, and a wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Azhar

texts.en:
Azhar is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo. The picture was taken inside his store.

Azhar is a 20-year-old married woman. Her husband has owned a grocery store for four years. This store is the only sorce of income for the family. He sells different types of groceries. It has been a profitable project, but not enough to cover the costs.

Azhar is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her husband to cover the costs of purchasing needed stock of basic groceries that customers often request such as rice, sugar, and milk. It will also be used to make improvements to the store's condition, such as installing additional shelves and painting. This will increase sales and increase Azhar's husband's income.

loans.use: to buy more stock of basic groceries for her husband's store.

loans.name: Rita Da

texts.en:
Rita is taking a loan of $1000 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) and she is married. She has a shop to generate income for her family. 

She has been thinking about how to run a big business, but she does not have enough working capital. She felt better when she applied for her first loan. With it, she will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as second-hand clothes, second-hand shoes, and second-hand bags. 

She is happy that TRM offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes, shoes, and handbags.

loans.name: Marta Elizabet

texts.es:
Martha, de 46 años de edad, viuda, madre de tres hijos de 18, 25 y 16 años de edad todos están estudiando en la universidad, ella es habitante de Teustepe municipio de Boaco. Ella  se dedica a vender ropa, zapatos y cosméticos. Ella trabajaba como asistente de su esposo quien se dedicaba hacer trabajos de mecánica dental pero al morir el, ella se hizo cargo del negocio ella tuvo que vender el carro que tenía y con el ingreso que le genero la venta logro poner su mini tienda de ropa y zapatos. Actualmente atiende el negocio de mecánica dental y su mini tienda que le ayudan a pagar los estudios universitarios de sus hijos y a pagar los gastos del hogar.
Ella requirió el financiamiento para comprar ropa interior, jeans, faldas, blusas, sandalias, shorts, camisetas y variedad en cosméticos  para vender y surtir su mini tienda, ofrecer más variedad de mercadería y mejorar las ventas y cancelar su crédito a tiempo. Una de sus metas es lograr que sus hijos tengan una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Martha is 46 years old. She is a widow and the mother of three children who are 18, 25 and 16 years old. All of them are studying at universities. She lives in the Teustepe neighborhood in Boaco. She works selling clothes, shoes and cosmetics. She worked as an assistant to her husband who worked as a manufacturer of dental prosthetics, but when he died she had to take over the business. She had to sell the car that she had and with the earnings from the sale she was able to create her little clothing and shoe store. Today she attends to the dental prosthetic business and her small store. These businesses help her to pay for the university studies of her children and to pay for the expenses of her home.

She is requesting this financing to buy underwear, jeans, skirts, blouses, sandals, shorts, shirts and a variety of cosmetics to sell and to stock her little store. By offering more diverse merchandise and improving her sales she will repay her loan on time. One of her goals is to have her children achieve professional careers.

loans.use: to buy underwear, jeans, skirts, blouses, sandals, shorts, shirts and a variety of cosmetics.

loans.name: Amor

texts.en:
Amor is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a entertainment (videoke) rental business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years. Amor earns more income from motorcycle transport and a general store.

She is borrowing 21000 PHP through NWTF to purchase an additional unit and spare parts for the maintenance of her entertainment (videoke) rental business.

Amor has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional unit and spare parts for the maintenance of her business.

loans.name: Ines Del  Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Ines del Carmen, es muy trabajadora, y emprendedora,  labora diario desde las seis de la mañana hasta las nueve de la noche, los siete días de la semana en su pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación, su esposo le ayuda en el negocio.

 Solicita un préstamo a ceprodel  para invertir en capital de trabajo, para la  compra de granos básicos, lácteos, perecederos y cosméticos.

 Esto con el propósito de tener mayor variedad de productos y ofrecer a sus clientes más artículos. Con el propósito captar más compradores. 

Agradece  a  ceprodel y Kiva, por la oportunidad y la confianza depositada en ella, por lo que este crédito lo invertirá en su negocio  de forma que esto le permitirá llevar el sustento a su hogar  e ir mejorando su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Ines del Carmen is a hard worker and an entrepreneur. She works every day from 6 in the morning until 9 at night, seven days a week in her store located in her home. Her husband helps her with the business. 

She seeks a loan from Ceprodel to invest in working capital, and to buy basic grains, dairy, perishables and cosmetics. Her purpose for doing this is to have a greater variety of products and to offer her customers more items, with the goal of getting more buyers.She is grateful to Ceprodel and Kiva for this opportunity and for the confidence they have in her. She will invest this loan in her business which will allow her to bring more money home and to improve the condition of her life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, dairy, perishable items, and clothing for women.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
Sofía tiene 60 años de edad , es madre solteras ya que tiene dos hijas con quienes vive en una casa construida a base de adobe.Sofia se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles y verduras.Sus inicios anteceden al deseo de dejar  las actividades agropecuarias que desempeñaba desde joven logrando cumplir su objetivo con capital que acumuló con el apoyo de su ex esposo.Es así como habilitando el primer piso de su vivienda y con apoyo de su familia se inicio de a pocos logrando con el tiempo ampliarlo hasta convertirlo en un buen sustento para su economía familiar.
En los productos que ofrece podemos hallar diversas clase de víveres considerados primera necesidad así como verduras frescas que son traídos por comerciantes desde la sierra de su región y diversos productos de mayor demanda entre su distinguida clientela quienes son sus vecinos y amigos del barrio.Tiene como prioridad la construcción de su vivienda a base de material noble paralelo a la ampliación de su negocio y otra de sus prioridades es brindarles a sus hijas una educación superior que les permita ganarse de la vida de una mejor manera.Con los 2,000 nuevos soles otorgados espera mantener abastecido su negocio con la compra de arroz, azúcar y conservas al por mayor para mejorar sus ganancias , asimismo parte del dinero lo usará para la compra de golosinas y verduras.
texts.en:
Sofia is 60-years-old. She is a single mother and has children that live with her. They live in a house constructed from adobe. Sofia works selling food products and vegetables. She had the desire to leave her agricultural activities that she used to do since she was young.  She was able to complete her objective with capital that she accumulated from her ex-husband. Renovating the first floor of her house she started her small business and with the help of her family she was able to grow and convert it into a business that provided a good source of income. Amongst the products that she offers there are several kinds of grocery products of basic necessity. She also sells produce brought from distributors from the fields near mountains in her area. She sells basic products in high demand to her highly esteemed cliente that are her friends and neighbors in her neighborhood. 

Her priority is to expand her business and home through construction consisting of strong materials.  Another one of her priorities is to provide a better education for her daughters that allow them to earn a living in a better way. With the 2000 soles loan she wants to supply her business with the purchase of wholesale rice, sugar, and preserves to increase her profits. She will also use part of the money to purchase candy and vegetables

loans.use: to purchase products such as rice, sugar. and preservatives among other items

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es: Marisol compró mercancía y ahora los inventarios surten su tienda y tiene muchas mas ventas, por la variedad que ofrece. El bienestar de su familia ha aumentado y esto es por la inversión de  su credikiva, a quien da muchos agradecimientos por que ha apoyado a su negocio. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo financiamiento, por este fondo, mediante el cual comprará los víveres que mas rotan en su negocio como aceite, arroz, azucar productos lacteos y  con ello hará una inversión en mayor volumen, para obtener mejores precios y ser mucho más competitiva en el mercado. Esto es justamente lo que hace que su credikiva se convierta en una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Marisol purchased merchandise; now her store is stocked with inventory and she is selling much more because of the variety that she is offering. The wellbeing of her family has increased, and that is because of her Kiva loan, for which she gives many thanks for supporting her business. 

Marisol is currently requesting a new Kiva loan with which she will purchase the food items that sell the most quickly in her store, such as oil, rice, sugar, and dairy products. With this loan, she will purchase in greater volume in order to get better prices and be more competitive in the market. This is exactly what makes her Kiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to purchase the groceries that sell quickly, like oil, rice, sugar, and dairy products.

loans.name: Orlando Jose

texts.es:
Orlando, 35 años de edad, 2 hijos de 9 y 5 años de edad, de oficio agricultor, se dedica a la siembra de frijol y crianza de ganado, él es originario de la comarca  El Zapote en las afueras de Teustepe.  
El inicio a trabajar desde los 8 años de edad  ayudando a sus padres quienes sembraban frijoles, maíz y crianza de ganado poco a poco fue adquiriendo experiencia convirtiéndose en su actividad diaria. Al casarse  se independizo y comenzó a sembrar por sus propios medios se especializo en siembras de frijoles y crianza de ganado. 
El está necesitando el crédito para comprar alimento para ganado y pagar mano de obra para siembra de frijol. Uno de sus planes futuros es comprar tierras para ampliar sus áreas de siembra y mejorar la crianza de ganado. Su meta es lograr darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Orlando is 35 years old and has two children, ages 9 and 5. A farmer, he grows beans and raises cattle. He is from the El Zapote area on the outskirts of Teustepe. 

He started work when he was 8, helping his parents, who were growing beans and corn and raising cattle. Little by little he began to acquire experience and this became his daily livelihood. When he got married he began farming independently and specialized in growing beans and raising cattle. 

He needs the loan to buy cattle feed and pay for labor for his bean crop. One of his future plans is to buy land so that he can expand his farming area and improve his cattle-raising. His goal is to succeed in giving his children a good education.

loans.use: To buy cattle feed and pay for labor for his bean crop.

loans.name: Gilma Yamileth

texts.es:
Gilma es una mujer con 39 años de edad luchadora, emprendedora y agradecida con DIOS, con muchos deseos de superarse y de salir adelante casada y madre de 2 hijos los cuales son menores de edad y estudian en la escuela en diferentes grados de educación primaria. Ella tiene un grado de educación no completado cursado hasta el 4 grado y no pudo continuar por la falta de apoyo económico ya que sus padres son de bajos recursos y no pudieron apoyarla. Desde su niñez se ha dedicado al cultivo de café actividad practicada por su familia hasta hoy en día siendo este el único sustento ya que fueron sus padres los que le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra hace más de 20 años y en la actualidad sigue practicando. La tierra que ella trabaja fue una herencia que le dejo su padre para que trabajara y generara ingresos para su hogar la cual esta ubicada a 2 kilómetros de distancia de su casa de habitación a la cual se trasladan a pie diariamente.  

Actualmente solicita ayuda para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos para darle mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café esto para que sea una cosecha sana y provechosa para poder generar ingresos, obtener ganancias y poder seguir invirtiendo en la misma.

Su sueño es poder con el tiempo cultivar y extender mas su cultivo de café, darle la oportunidad a sus hijos para que puedan educarse a nivel universitario aprendiendo una carrera que les ayude a superase y a crecer como personas en un ambiente al que ellos puedan adaptarse con toda facilidad.
texts.en:
Gilma, 39 years old, is a determined, enterprising woman who is thankful to God. She has a great desire to improve and to move forward. She is a married mother of two dependent children. They both study in primary school. Gilma completed school through 4th grade but then couldn't continue due to the lack of financial help. Her parents did not make much income and were unable to help her. Since she was a young girl, Gilma has worked by cultivating coffee, which her family still does today. Her parents taught her how to work the land over 20 years ago. This work continues to be her parents' only form of income. The land that Gilma uses was inherited from her father so she could work and earn income for her household. The land is two kilometers away from her home so she walks there every day.

Currently, she is requesting help to buy fertilizer to perform maintenance on her coffee plants so that there will be a healthy and profitable harvest. This will allow her to earn income, make a profit, and continue investing in her crop.

Her dream is to expand her coffee crop over time, giving her children the opportunity to get a university education and prepare for a professional career. This will help them to succeed and grow as individuals in an environment where they can easily adapt.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to perform maintenance on her coffee plants

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy jewelry.

loans.name: Judith Vanessa

texts.es:
Judith, una humilde joven de 24 años de edad, con deseo de superación, originaria de León, soltera, madre de 1 hijo,  de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de nacatamales, de la que es propietaria hace más de 5 años, con nivel académico universitario de la carrera de Turismo, debido  a sus condiciones económica no logro finalizar su carrera.
Inicio su actividad laboral hace 5 años, con ayuda de su mama vendiendo leña, ella  necesitaba un medio del cual subsistir y poder ser independiente generando ingresos por si misma, fue asi que se decidió a poner su propio negocio de venta de nacatamales. Sus comienzos fueron muy difícil  porque empezó con  un  barril y un perol  y cuatros piedras que forman su humilde fuego,  en donde cocina sus  deliciosos nacatamales, fue asi que ella empezó su difícil tarea de vender nacatamales  con muy pocos recursos.
Actualmente  ella  junto a su mama han logrado mantener el negocio estable, vende de forma ambulante y en su casa. Sus expectativas es que su negocio crezca, de esta manera obtener mas clientes.
Esta requiriendo el financiamiento para comprar leña, carne, aceite, maíz, pasa, cebolla., etc.
texts.en:
Judith is a modest young woman of 24, who has the desire to succeed. She is from León, single, and the mother of a son. She has a small business selling nacatamales (Nicaraguan stuffed tamales), of which she has been the proprietor for more than five years. She has university-level academic studies in tourism, but due to her financial circumstances, she did not manage to finish her degree.

She started her business five years ago, selling firewood with her mother's help. She needed a way to support herself and be independent by generating income on her own. This was how she decided to set up her own business selling nacatamales.  It was very difficult in the beginning, because she started with a barrel, a cauldron, and four stones that form the humble fire where she cooks her delicious nacatamales. That was how she began her difficult work of selling nacatamales with very little resources.

Now, she and her mother have succeeded in keeping the business stable. She sells as a street vendor and from her home.

Her hope is that her business grows, and to get more customers this way. She needs the loan to buy firewood, meat, cooking oil, corn, onions, etc.

loans.use: To buy firewood, meat, cooking oil, corn, onions, etc.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina has two children and describes herself as a good person. She operates a mobile phone sales (M-pesa) business in a busy area and also earns extra income by selling clothes. This is her fifth loan with SMEP DTM, and the previous loan amounted to Kes 40,000 which she repaid successfully. Regina plans to add float (inventory) with this loan and hopes to start many more businesses in future. She sees herself having more clothes shops in five years time. Inflation is one of the challenges that faces her business.

loans.use: to add inventory to her mobile phone business

loans.name: Larry

texts.en: Larry is 34 years old and married to Jocelyn. In addition to an agricultural business, he has been also involved in a retailing business for over five years. Larry dreams to lift his family from poverty -- this is why he works hard at his businesses. To this end, he has requested a loan of PHP 20,000, which he will use to acquire goods to sell at his store, including beverages, condiments, noodles and assorted breads. He hopes to grow his business and to secure a good living for his family.

loans.use: to acquire goods to sell at his store, including beverages, condiments, noodles and assorted breads

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is a 32-year-old, married woman, who has one child. She has a small plantation and grows cabbages, green onions, cucumbers, pumpkins, and tomatoes, to earn a living. She has been doing this for one year.

Daisy has requested a loan, which she will use to buy tools and supplies to use in vegetable farming, including chemicals, weed killer, hose, gloves, bush knives, and wheel barrow. She became a member of SPBD in 2013. With her profits, Daisy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and supplies to use in farming, including chemicals, weed killer, hose, gloves, bush knives, wheel barrow

loans.name: Carlos Javier

texts.es: Carlos  de 19 años de edad,  tiene una pequeña tienda de refrescos, bebidas, mecatos y también vende pescado y otras carnes. Carlos en su negocio familiar tiene experiencia desde muy pequeño, cuando su padre quedó desempleado y decidió generar ingresos independientes, por eso al recibió su liquidación la invirtió en la compra de congeladores y equipos, con los que inició su negocio que poco a poco surtió. Carlos comparte la atención de su negocio con su madre de lunes a domingo y desde las 4 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche. Sus ventas así como sus compras, las realiza de contado en la comunidad que habita alrededor de su barrio. Su meta mas adelante es remodelar su negocio y mantenerlo parlantemente surtido, para continuar estudiando y “ser alguien en la vida” como él mismo dice. En la actualidad requiere aplicarle capital de trabajo a su negocio y esta es la razón para acceder a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará tubérculos, víveres, enlatados y refrescos. Con ello mantendrá un inventario de productos que mas rotan y su clientela siempre encontrará lo que buscas y esta es justamente la razón de éxito de la inversión de su credikiva.
texts.en:
Carlos is 19 years old. He has a small shop selling sodas, drinks, pastries, and also fish and meats. 

Carlos has experience in his family business since he was very small. When his father lost his job, he decided to go work for himself. When he received his severance pay, he invested it in the purchase of freezers and equipment with which he started his business, stocking it little by little. Carlos shares responsibility for manning the shop with his mother from Monday to Sunday from 4:00 in the morning until 8:00 at night. Their sales, as well as their purchases, are done in cash in the community around their neighborhood. 

Carlos's goal for the future is to remodel his business and keep it stocked so that he can continue his education and "be someone in life," as he himself says. He currently needs to put working capital into his business, and that is the reason for taking out a Kiva loan. He will use his first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy tubers, groceries, canned goods, and soft drinks. He will maintain his inventory of the products that sell the most quickly, and his customers will always find what they are looking for. This is precisely the reason for the success of his Kiva loan investment.

loans.use: to buy tubers, groceries, canned goods, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita is 63 years old, married, and has four children. She is in an agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. She has been doing this work for five years.

She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. She plans to use the loan to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs.

Jovita has previously borrowed and repaid 14 loans from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc., to sustain her business activity. She would like to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for the pigs

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is a 39-year-old, married woman from Carlos P. Garcia, Ubay Bohol. She has five children. The oldest is 16, while the youngest is 8 years old. Mary Jane is engaged in farming. She has been farming rice for more than 10 years. In addition to farming, Mary Jane engages in seaweed farming. She grows cultured seaweed.

She requested a loan of PHP 10,000. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides for the rice, and to buy guso (seaweed) for culture. Mary Jane would like to expand her business, to support her family and at the same time send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides, and to buy guso (seaweed) to culture

loans.name: Lila

texts.en:
Lila is a 31-year-old, married woman, who has two children. She has a small plantation and grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years.

Lila has requested a loan to purchase some new land for her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. With her profits, Lila hopes to save more money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy some new land for farming

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 51 years old, married, and has two children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 25 years.

She has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy more grocery items to resell at her store, like canned goods, soap, noodles, and spices.

Cristina would like to save money, to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to resell at her store, like canned goods, soap, noodles, and spices.

loans.name: Los Lirios Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LOS LIRIOS”  iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Enola es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa por mayor, venta de dulces y refrescos, costura, venta de comida (pensión) venta de camas y edredones, venta de papa y chuño.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Enola es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida (pensión); da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace veintisiete año, ya que contaba con un capital básico sus padres le aconsejaron la apertura de este negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz, fideo, verduras) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en la ciudad de Oruro. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y los ahorros.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Los Lirios” is starting its fourth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata Community Center. This group consists of nine members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Enola as its president. The members of this Communal Bank engage in various businesses such as selling clothing in bulk, selling candy and soft drinks, sewing, selling food at a diner, selling beds and bedspreads, and selling regular and freeze-dried potatoes.

This loan will benefit small businesswomen such as Sra. Enola. She says that she joined Pro Mujer two years ago after receiving an invitation from a friend who is also a member of the organization. Enola currently has a business of selling food (at a diner). She has become very knowledgeable about this business since starting it 27 years ago. Enola received start-up capital from her parents since they advised her to open a business.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying rice, noodles, and vegetables. She acquires her supplies at the fairs in the city of El Alto and later prepares her dishes to sell in the city of Oruro. Working in this manner enables her to generate income. Enola is in a common-law relationship and has one child.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Enola said that she enjoys the topics about health and savings.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles, and vegetables.

loans.name: Florencio

texts.es:
Don Florencio es de la comunidad Las Quebradas casado, su esposa le tuvo 4 hijos los cuales ya están casado  tiene varios nietos. Él se dedica a cultivar maíz y frijol desde  hace 33 años ya que él dice que desde los 12 años de edad ya trabajaba en la siembra de maíz y frijol al lado de su papa pero  a los 16 años  se casó empezó a realizar su propia huerta de maíz y frijol cuyos gastos los cubría con dinero que ganaba como trabajador jornalero o mozo por día.

Don Florencio dice que gracias al esfuerzo de su trabajo   que ha hecho ha ido mejorando, también cría cerdos y gallina que vienen a ser otros ingresos para su casa. Para realizar sus huertas de maíz y frijol lo realiza con ayuda de mozos a los que les paga por cada día que le ayudan en su huerta también dice que cuando cultiva el maíz y el frijol lo lleva a venderlo al mercado de Managua ya que allá se lo pagan muy bien.
Hoy esta necesitando este crédito para  comprar  insumos, abonos, fertilizantes, semilla y pago de mano de obra para  la siembra del frijol 
Don Florencio dice que con los ingresos de la cosecha cancelara este crédito  y el dinero que le sobre mejorar un poco su casa.
texts.en:
Florencio is from the community of Las Quebradas. He is married and he and his wife have four children. They are already married and he has several grandchildren. He grows corn and beans and he has done so for 33 years. When he was twelve he was already working planting corn and beans with his father. When he was 16 he started growing his own corn and bean fields. He would pay for the expenses with the money he earned as a day laborer.   

Florencio says that thanks to his hard work he has improved things. He also raises pigs and chicken that bring in other income for the home. He uses laborers for his corn and bean field that he pays every day. When he grows the corn and beans he takes them to sell in the market of Managua, since they pay him well there.  

Today he needs this loan to buy materials such as fertilizer and seeds as well as to pay to plant the beans. Florencio says that with the harvest he will pay off this loan and with the leftover money he will improve his home a little.

loans.use: to buy materials such as fertilizer and seeds as well as to pay for labor to plant beans.

loans.name: Peniel Group

texts.es: Grupo está formado por tres socias emprendedoras de éxito una de ellas es Reyna mujer casada, de 46 años de edad y con dos hijos. Desde hace dos años tiene una pulpería en su domicilio, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de granos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, carne de res, carne de pollo, sal, jabón de baños, jabón de lavar, huevos, pan, leche en bolsa, pamper, medicamentos populares etc. Silvia tiene 40 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de pan y Kenia tiene 22 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de ropa y pan.
texts.en:
This group consists of three members who are successful entrepreneurs. One of them is Reyna, a 46-year-old woman who is married and has two children. For the past two years, she has managed a general store in her home. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of basic staples such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, beef, chicken, salt, eggs, bread, and milk in bags. She will also buy bath soap, laundry soap, diapers, popular medicines, and other items.

Silvia is 40 years old and has a business of selling bread. Kenia is 22 years old and has a business of selling clothes and bread.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, beef, chicken, salt, eggs, bread, milk, bath soap, laundry soap, diapers, popular medicines, and other items.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria de 31 años de edad , esta casada con Anatolio y tiene 3 hijos con quienes reside en una vivienda construida a base de adobe .Victoria se dedica a la producción de cacao orgánico.Desempeña esta labor por sus padres, puesto que desde niña apoyo en labores menores  aprendiendo de a pocos los conocimientos necesarios para la siembra de cacao.Inicialmente recibió por herencia unas parcelas por parte de sus progenitores en reconocimiento al apoyo brindado y para sustento de su joven familia junto a Anatolio logrando con el tiempo adquirir un terreno adicional con el objetivo de incrementar sus ganancias.Como todo inicio en cuanto a producción cacaotera le fue necesario contar con capital de trabajo para la contrata de trabajadores del lugar , pero al ser insuficiente el dinero optó junto a  su pareja a duplicar sus horas de trabajo en las labores de mantenimiento como son la extracción de maleza, deschuponado entre otros.
Una de las complicaciones que afectan el normal desempeño de su labor es el transporte de los sacos con los granos secos de cacao hacia la ciudad para su venta final, puesto que el acceso consta de una vía algo descuidada y el precio por el servicio es algo que afecta su utilidad.Desea a largo plazo adquirir un terreno agrícola adicional para iniciarse en la producción de barbasco por ser también un producto rentable y con una calidad optima gracias al tipo de suelos propios de zona.
Con los 2,000 nuevos soles otorgados comprará sacos de abono orgánico para optimizar su producción y contratar a jornaleros para la cosecha que será efectiva dentro de unas semanas.
texts.en:
Victory is 31 years old, is married to Anatolio and has 3 children with who lives in a dwelling built on the basis of mud. Victory makes a living growing organic cacao. She is in the business because of her parents, since she was a child, she helped her parents with small jobs, which gave her the necessary knowledge to plant cocoa.

Initially she inherited plots on the part of her parents in recognition of the support and to help her support her young family and Anatolio. With time, they acquired an additional plot with the aim of increasing their profits. Like all cocoa fields as soon as you start the cocoa production requires to have working capital to the subcontract workers. But due to the insufficient funds they chose to duplicate their hours of work in the maintenance work such as the removal of weeds, removing suckers, among others.

One of the complications that affect the normal performance of their work is the transport of the sacks with the dried beans of cocoa to the city and its final sale, since the access to the city is through a road somewhat neglected and the price for the service is something that affects the profits.

In the future, they would like to buy an additional plot land to get started in the production of barbasco, the name of several plants that contain poisonous chemical compounds that have been used for fishing by Indigenous populations of the Americas, because is a profitable product, which grows well thanks the optimal quality to the type of soil.
 
With the 2.000 new soles granted she will buy bags of compost to optimize her production and hire day laborers for the harvest that will start within a few weeks.

loans.use: buy bags of compost to optimize her production and hire day laborers for the harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy basic groceries.

loans.name: Concepcion De Jesus

texts.es:
Don Concepción es de la comarca La Concha en las afueras de Teustepe, casado de 4 hijos que tuvo con su esposa solo uno tiene a cargo de 12 años de edad. Él se dedica a sembrar maíz frijol y trigo también obtiene sus ingresos del alquiler de potrero para ganado.  Inicio a trabajar en la agricultura desde los 15 años lo cual lo hacía como peón y dinero que ganaba iba ahorrando y así compro sus tierritas y sus vaquitas que posee. 


Don Concepción todos sus trabajos de siembra  de maíz, frijol y el trigo lo realiza solo él y algunas veces  le ayuda un hijo o paga un mozo su cosecha la vende en la misma comarca.  Hoy don Concepción necesita este crédito para pagar unos mozos para limpiar los potreros y comprar piedra cantera cemento, arena para hacer un brocal a un pozo  por lo cual el crédito  le servirá porque así ya no tendrá que ir muy largo a traer el agua para tomar y aguar del ganado. Uno de sus planes futuros es  que con la ganancias quizás  con la ganancia que obtenga comprar una bomba de mecate para sacar el agua del pozo.
texts.en:
Concepción is from the region La Concha outside of Teustepe, married with 4 children that he had with his wife. He only has one under his care, a child of 12 years. He works sewing corn, beans, and wheat. He also obtains income by renting a cattle pasture. He started working in agriculture when he was 15 years old. He was a farmhand then, and he saved the money he earned, and in that way he purchased his small plots of land and the cows that he possesses. 

For all of Concepción's work sewing corn, beans, and wheat, he does it on his own. Sometimes one of his children helps him, or he pays for a helper. He sells his harvest in the same region. Today Concepción needs this loan in order to pay for helpers to clean the pastures and buy quarry stones, cement, and sand to make a parapet. The loan will help him because he will no longer have to go very far to bring water for drinking and giving to his cattle.
