texts.en: Emilia is 63 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and daughter in the city of San Pedro Sula, Cortes. Emilia has been providing a tailoring service in the community for four years. She makes dance costumes, veils and curtains for homes. She is well known in the community for her excellant work. The loan she is requesting is her third and is for 10,000 lempiras, which she will use to buy fabrics, thread and lace and all the materials necessary for her sewing workshop. Having fabrics on hand, the customers make more orders. Her goal is to grow her business. She plans to buy more machinery for making clothes and to improve her home.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread and lace to make clothing for sale.

loans.name: Getsemani Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Martha de 43 años de edad, soltera y con dos hijos, tiene 8 años de ser clientes de la institución su negocio es la venta de calzado de diferentes estilos y formas este lo invertirá en la compra de zapatos gamuza artesanal, zapatos cerrados de gamuza, zapatos de cuero sintético etc. Dominga tiene 48 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de comida en su domicilio y María tiene 70 años y tiene una pulpería en su domicilio.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three enterprising members, one of whom is Martha, 43.  She's single and has two children.  She has been a client of the institution for eight years.  Her business is selling different styles of footwear.

She'll invest the loan in buying designer suede shoes, shoes of synthetic leather, etc.

Dominga, 48, sells food at home and María, 70, has a grocery store in her home.

loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: Zenzontle Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado tres  socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Milagro, casada, con 49 años de edad, con dos hijos y desde hace 21 años su negocio es la fábrica y venta de artesanía en hamacas de diferentes tamaños y formas, de ser cliente de la institución de ser cliente tiene 7 años de la institución, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como manila, argolla, varillas, pelotas etc. Alma tiene 41 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de pan,  y Elba tiene 49 años de edad y su negocio es de una pulpería en su domicilio.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three enterprising members, one of whom is Milagro, 49.  She's married and has two children.  For 21 years her business has been making and selling hammocks in different sizes and styles.  She has been a client of the institution for seven years.

She'll invest the loan in buying raw materials such as netted cord, hoops, roller bearings, ball bearings, etc.

Alma, 41, sells bread and Elba, 49, has a grocery store in her home.

loans.use: to buy materials to make hammocks

loans.name: Rin's Group

texts.en:
A widow living in a rural village in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Rin is 53 years old and has four children. Rin has worked to feed her family by growing cassava for seven years. She earns about 4000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Rin’s group consists of three members who are all female. She has been with VisionFund for three cycles and fully paid back the previous loans. Those loans helped her to support her business. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, Rin is going to use her portion of the loan to plow the cassava field and pay labor fees. She hopes to increase her crop yield in order to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To plow her cassava field and pay labor fees

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita is a 41-year-old vegetable farmer from the town of Jagna, Bohol. She is married and has four children. Vegetable farming is the main source of their living. She works with her husband in their farm, and they grow various kinds of vegetables like beans, eggplant, squash, and onions, among others.

She has plans of expanding her farm, but lacks the financial resources to do so. Therefore, she is asking for a loan worth PHP 6,000, which she will use to buy seedlings, fertilizer, pesticides, and nylon for trellises. Lucita is optimistic that she can improve her business through hard work and perseverance.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer, pesticides and nylon for trellises

loans.name: Pheap's Group

texts.en:
Pheap, 49, lives in a rural area located in Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district. She has five children, in total. One of them is staying with the family and still in school. Pheap and her husband are farmers, who have been growing cassava and rubber trees for twenty years to make a living. They can earn about 70,000 KHR each. 

Pheap’s group is comprised of three members who have been with VisionFund for one previous loan cycle. Pheap completely paid back the loan, which helped her improve her livelihood. Now she is leading her group to ask for a new loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. Pheap hopes this loan will enable her to grow her cassava and rubber healthily and also hopes to increase her crop yield, to improve her family’s living standard.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
Mariamu is grateful for the progress that her business has witnessed over the last few months. Her business is on the rise but she currently has a limited stock and is intending to add stock. She is therefore asking for a loan of 32,050 Kenya shillings to purchase additional stock of retail products e.g sugar, salt flour etc.

She looks forward to increased income which will enable her to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of retail products e.g sugar, salt flour etc.

loans.name: Egga

texts.en:
Egga is from Kisauni, Mombasa, Kenya. She is the single mother of three children and has been the owner of a beauty salon for more than five years. 

She is a hardworking and enterprising person who has the vision to move forward. Through her daily efforts, she has been able to accomplish this. Her goal is to continue growing and helping her children.

Egga is requesting this loan so that she can buy supplies for her beauty salon such as dyes, crèmes, gels, shampoo, rinses, and other items. This will allow her to provide her customers with excellent and high-quality service.

loans.use: buy supplies for her beauty salon such as dyes, crèmes, gels, shampoo, rinses, and other items.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is a widow with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past year, she has operated a beauty salon business. Her potential customers are town dwellers and neighbors. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her family basic needs. 

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to pay school fees for her children. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Abahuje Group

texts.en: Alphonsine is 30 years old. She is married with two children aged between four and five. Alphonsine is a group leader of Abahuje meaning “we are together” and the group members do different types of business. Some own retail and/or general stores. Alphonsine, as the president of the group, sells food. She wants to upgrade her business with the loan by adding more food in the store such as rice, sugar, beans as well salt and soaps for sale. With the profits from the business, she will be able to increase her savings and provide food for her family. Alphonsine is pictured raising her hand to so that she may be identified within the group as a leader.

loans.use: To buy more food such as rice, beans and other items to sell

loans.name: Sidra

texts.en:
Sidra is a 25 year old housewife. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan along her husband and two children. Both of her children are studying in school. Her husband has been successfully operating a tailoring business for three years.

Sidra has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan. The main purpose of the loan is so that her husband can expand his business. There are currently two workers in her husband’s tailoring business. He wants to hire two more workers so that his production capacity will increase. For that purpose he requires two more new sewing machines and this loan would be used to purchase those new sewing machines.

Sidra is very hopeful that after getting this loan, her husband’s business would flourish. She is currently living in a rented house and desires to have her own house. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase new sewing machines for her husband's tailoring business

loans.name: Raul

texts.es: El Sr. Raul tiene 35 años y se dedica a la actividad de la pesca  el vive en una isla del lago titicaca, centro turístico del departamento de La Paz donde ofrecen al público  artesanías  de totoras y en lana, la mayoría de los habitantes de esta isla se dedican a la pesca y el turismo, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Raul va a usar este préstamo para la compra de redes para usar en la pesca, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es aumentar la pesca e incrementar su capital  de trabajo, el Sr. Raul enfrenta retos en su negocio que son tener una mejor producción y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir mejorando en su trabajo ya que este es su único ingreso para mantener a su familia, el Sr. Raul es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en: Raul is 35 years old and is a fisherman. He lives on an island in lake Titicaca, a tourist center in the department of La Paz where handicrafts made of cattails and wool are offered to the public. The majority of the island's inhabitants are engaged in fishing or tourism. This loan is his first loan cycle with the institution. Raul is going to use the loan to buy nets to use for fishing. His reason for requesting the loan is to increase his catch and increase his working capital. Raul faces challenges in his business like increasing production and is going to use the profits in continuing to improve in his work, since this is his only source of income for supporting his family. Raul is a hard-working person. He feels happy for the opportunities provided him.

loans.use: to buy nets to use for fishing.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years. She earns more income from raising livestock and selling bananas.

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her pump boat. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan, to further build her business.

Virginia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to school, in the future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her pump boat

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a merchant, who makes a living by fishing, and by buying and selling fish. She has been dedicated to this activity for more than five years, so she already has some good experience. Mariam has her own boat, nets and fishing equipment, which helps her work without depending on anyone. She is known as a person with a strong desire to move up in life and help her family.

She is requesting the loan to purchase fish, so that she will have more fish in stock. Demand is high, and she wants to be able to satisfy her customers. Mariam is grateful for the help she is receiving from Kiva partner, Yehu Microfinance, because it will be a big help.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Omar Aquilino

texts.es: El señor Omar, hombre trabajador, desde muy joven se dedica a trabajar la tierra, habita en el municipio de San Ignacio,  junto as u espasa quien le apoya en todo ya que para ellos lo primordial es su hogar, actualmente el señor Omar necesita darle Mantenimiento a sus cultivos de Piña ya que quere obtener mejores Productos, con este credito comprara los insumos necesarios para un optimo y mejorado mantenimiento, comprara. Fertilizantes, Completo, Urea, Triple etc. Agradea a Afodenic y Fondos Kiva por el apoyo brindado
texts.en:
Omar is a hardworking man who has made a living working the land since he was very young.  He lives in the town of San Ignacio with his wife, who supports him in everything because the most important thing for them is their household.

Currently Omar needs to keep his pineapple plants in good condition because he wants to get a better crop.  With this loan he'll buy the necessary supplies for optimal and improved maintenance: fertilizer, urea, etc.

He's grateful to AFODENIC and Kiva for the support offered.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Magereza Group

texts.en:
Amina, who is in her late twenties, is married and has one son. He is still going to school.  Amina has been running two businesses, selling charcoal and selling tap water, for two years.  She works from 6.00 am to 9.00 pm daily, and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  Amina has been selling charcoal, selling tap water, and now she will use this loan to start a grocery business. Her dream is to one day be able to have a good business.

Amina will share this loan with her loan group, Magereza, with 12 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to start a grocery business

loans.name: Zaven

texts.en:
Zaven is 51 years old and lives in Vanadzor city with his wife and only son. He hasn't any profession and graduated only from secondary school, but as he confessed, he has regrets about that. Now he works as a driver in one of the enterprises in Vanadzor city. He works very hard, day and night, to meet his family's needs. In this activity, he has been engaged more than 15 years. 

His son now studies in Armenian State University of Economics in the Department of Marketing and Business Organization. Zaven is now seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to pay his son’s tuition fee. He dreams about his son becoming a good specialist.

loans.use: To pay his son’s tuition fee.

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en:
Tabu lives in Kisauni, Mombasa. She has a very good work project in which she buys and sells chickens. She sells them to restaurants, diners and other entities; thanks to the quality of her product, she is making headway.

Tabu struggles to get ahead and help her family through her work. Her goal is to own a shop one day, and be able to attend to customers there.

She is requesting a loan to buy chickens to keep up her supply and stay in business.

loans.use: to buy chickens to keep up her supply and stay in business.

loans.name: Yoshimar Jeanneth

texts.es: Yoshimar  es una joven de 26 años, es mamá de una niña de  3 años y aunque el papá de su hija le ayuda con algunos gastos de la niña, ella es la que se encarga de la crianza de la misma. Se dedica a vender cosméticos por catalogo a familiares, amistades, tiendas y oficinas. Vive en casa de sus papas,  los cuales le ayudan con el cuidado de la niña cuando ella tiene que salir a hacer sus ventas y cobranzas, estas ventas  le generan el ingreso con el que ella y su hija pueden vivir con una economía casi estable. El papá de la  niña no vive con ella, ya que tiene otra pareja, sin embargo le da un monto de dinero mensual para que pueda suplir de alguna manera su ausencia. Este monto de dinero no alcanza para el total de gastos que se tiene con la niña, es por esta razón que Yoshimar quiere incrementar sus ventas colocando en la puerta del garaje de la casa de sus papas un mostrador donde pueda exponer sus cosméticos de forma diaria. El crédito será destinado a la compra de este mostrador con el cual podrá generar mayores ingresos y además estabilidad en su negocio, de esta manera mejorara su calidad de vida de ella y de su hija.
texts.en:
Yoshimar is a young woman who is 26 years of age. She is the mother of a three-year-old daughter. The father of her daughter helps with some of the child’s expenses, but she is in charge of raising her. Yoshimar sells cosmetics through catalogs to her relatives, friends, as well as to stores and offices. She lives at the house of her parents, who help care for her daughter when she is out making sales or collecting payments. Her sales generate income by which she and her daughter can live in an almost financially stable situation.

The father of her daughter does not live with her, but she already has another partner. He gives her a monthly amount that somewhat helps to compensate for the absence of the child’s father. However, this amount does not cover all of her daughter’s expenses. For this reason, Yoshimar wants to increase her sales by setting up shop in the garage of her parents’ house. She will install a counter where she can display her cosmetics on a daily basis.

The loan will be used to buy a display counter so that she can generate more income and create more stability for her business. As a result, Yoshimar can improve the quality of life for herself and her daughter.

loans.use: to buy a display counter for her business.

loans.name: Nary's Group

texts.en:
Nary and her husband are farmers who grow rice and cassava in the area to make a living. She and her husband have been in this business for twenty-five years, and they can earn about 40,000 KHR per day, but Nary can manage to save about 15,000 KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses.  

This is the second microloan for Nary with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She completely paid back the past loan, which has helped her to relieve her family’s burden and improve their livelihood. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. 

Nary, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to get a high crop yield from her rice and cassava planting, so as to sell them for a good price.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Saha

texts.en:
Saha is a married woman and lives at her own home. She is engaged in sales in her cosmetics shop. She has her own premises and has a good amount of customers, and thus she has a good monthly income.

Saha is a hardworking person. She hopes to get ahead, and her wish is to enlarge her business and therefore be able to meet more customers’ needs.

The purpose of the loan is to buy more merchandise and meet the needs of her clients. Saha wants to increase her daily sales and gain customer loyalty.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise and meet the needs of her clients.

loans.name: Gaspher

texts.en:
Gaspher is a resident of Malindi, Kenya. He is a mason. He has been working in this the trade for the past twenty years. He is a married father of two school-going children. Owing to an increased need for money / finances, and the unreliability of income from the masonry business, Gaspher has decided to open a retail shop.

He is therefore asking for a loan of 21,050 Kenyan shillings (KES). He will use the loan to buy retail stock, for example, sugar and cooking oil. He hopes to meet all the needs of his family and especially, the education.

loans.use: To buy retail stock, like sugar, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Emigdia

texts.en:
Emigdia is a 48-year-old, married woman. She has eight children, and she is from Jagna, Bohol. Emigdia is engaged in a retailing business, selling goods like rice, canned goods, noodles, snack foods and others. This is her source of income.

Emigdia needs a loan for the expansion of her business. She is asking for a loan to buy additional stock to sell, like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, sugar, vinegar and seasonings, soap and toiletries. She hopes to earn a higher income from the business, so that she can help her husband in providing for the needs of the family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell, like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, sugar, vinegar and seasonings, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Mafia

texts.en:
Mafia is 22 years old and a responsible mother of three children. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, along with her husband, in a rented house. Her husband has been running a garment shop for three years, and this is the only source of income for her family. Her household expenses are very large compared to the business income, because of which she is facing a lot of financial problems in life.

She has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the loan amount her husband would buy a variety of new dresses, shirts, jeans, and suits, to attract more customers. His sales would be increased in this way, and his monthly income and savings would also be increased. With the profit amount Mafia would purchase her own house. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for helping her.

loans.use: to provide her husband with the means to increase his shop's inventory with new clothing, in greater variety

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a very hardworking and enterprising woman. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. She has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family thanks to her hard work.

She is asking for a loan of 40,000 KES to buy ingredients such as meat, milk, eggs and cheese that will help her to invest back into her business and boost her standards of living.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as meat, milk, eggs and cheese.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: La Sra. Patricia  tiene 39 años tiene tres hijos que son de las edades de 8, 5 y 19 años, se dedica  a la venta de variedad de artículos, le va muy bien con esta actividad, este préstamo es el primero que tiene dentro de la institución, La Sra. Patricia  vive en la localidad de Tiquipaya donde escasea los servicios básicos y también el agua la mayor parte del tiempo se compra agua de las cisternas que ofrecen agua por cada zona a un precio módico, por este motivo el solicito este préstamo para la construcción de un baño con  un tanque de agua para poder tener reserva de agua ya que una de las principales acciones para la construcción de un Tanque de agua es para almacenar y distribuir el agua, construcción de cañerías que lleva el agua hasta las distintas dependencia como el baño, ducha y cocina y esto es de mucha utilidad ya que las cisternas van una vez a la semana y muchas veces su familia se queda sin agua y este liquido elemento es imprescindible en cada hogar y con la construcción de este baño  la Sra. Patricia  mejorara de gran manera su calidad de vida, por este motivo se siente agradecida por esta oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en: Patricia is 39 years old. She has three children who are 8, 5 and 19 years old. She sells a variety of products. This business is going well for her. This loan is her first with the institution. Patricia lives in the locality of Tiquipaya where basic services and water are scarce. The majority of the time, water is bought from the water wagons that offer water in each area for a modest price. Therefore, she is requesting this loan to construct a bathroom with a water tank, in order to be able to have a water reserve, since one of the principal reasons for the construction of a water tank is to store and distribute the water along with the construction of water pipes that lead to the bathroom, shower and kitchen. This is of great utility, since the water wagons come by once a week and her family is often without water and this basic element is essential in every home. With the construction of this bath, Patricia will greatly improve their quality of life, which is why she is grateful for this opportunity provided to her.

loans.use: to buy an eco-friendly bathroom.

loans.name: Danixa Alexandra

texts.es:
La Sra. Danixa Vive en Orquídeas (Guayaquil), ella tiene  48 años de edad. Ella empezó con su negocio porque queria independizarce y ya no trabajar en una empresa, sino ser ella una microempresaria. Por eso comenzo a comprar utiles de oficina para vender en un local, poco a poco empezo a tener ingresos para tener su papeleria. 

En la actualidad tiene una papeleria surtida, unas cabinas telefonicas y tambien vende cosmeticos.No esta casada pero tienen un hijo menor de edad. 

Ella usara el préstamo para comprar implementos para papeleria, telefonos y cosmeticos y asi realizar sus manualidades. Ella desea para  el futuro poder comprarse una casa, ver crecer a su hijo, y seguir realizando su actividad.
texts.en:
Sra. Danixa is 48 years old and lives in Orquídeas (Guayaquil). She started her business because she wanted to be independent and not have to work for a company. In other words, she wanted to become a micro-entrepreneur. Danixa started out buying office supplies that she could sell at a storefront. As she gradually earned a profit, she was able to open a stationery shop.

At the moment, she has a stationery shop that is stocked and a few phone booths. She also sells cosmetics. Danixa is not married, but she has a young child.

She will use this loan to buy inventory such as stationery, telephones, and cosmetics. Danixa will also make handicrafts. In the future she wants to buy a house, see her child grow up, and continue with her business.

loans.use: to buy stationery, telephones, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Judalyn

texts.en:
Judalyn is 57years old and a resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is a mother and is married to Hugo, a watch technician. Together with her husband they manages their own household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Judalyn operates a watch-repair shop. Her husband is the main technician while she handles finances, accounts, inventories and promotion of their business. They offer repair and check-up of watches. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP in service fees every day. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 13, 000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts of watches. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Judalyn hopes to have another shop soon. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for watch batteries, bracelets and other materials needed in repairing a watch.

loans.name: Sreyneang's Group

texts.en:
Sreyneang, 34, lives with her three children in a village of Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district, Cambodia. She still has two children to take care of and they are still in school, while the other one helps the family’s business. To make a living, she has been working as a garment worker for 14 years. To increase her income, she also sells grocery items in her village. She is able to earn about 20,000 KHR each day after expenses.  

Sreyneang has just joined with VisionFund this cycle while the other member has been with VisionFund for one cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy more grocery items to sell. With this loan, Sreyneang hopes to increase her family’s income to make their lives better.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to sell.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 48 years old and married with two children. With two children currently in school, Lolita works very hard to provide for them.

Lolita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional goods like sugar, bread, coffee, noodles, candies and other groceries to sell in her general store.

Lolita has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, bread, coffee, noodles, candies and other groceries. 

In the future, Lolita would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods like sugar, bread, coffee, noodles, candies and other groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy edible items for selling.

loans.name: Raheela

texts.en:
Raheela is 43 years old and hardworking and diligent woman. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan along with her husband and five children. Her husband is a janitor by profession and he has a very low monthly income. Because of this they are facing a lot of financial problems.

Raheela is a very responsible and skilled woman. She is using her tailoring skills to generate an alternative source of income for her family. She is very experienced in stitching clothes and dresses. She has been doing this work from 25 years. Her clients are very happy and well satisfied with her work. 

She has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan to expand her business. She wants to open a tailoring center in her house. She would purchase two new sewing machines so that her production would increase. Her daughter also helps her in sewing clothes. She would also purchase some threads and clothes. She would pay her installments with the profit amount and pay some household expenses. She is very hopeful that the loan will help her family.

loans.use: purchase two new sewing machines to stitch more clothes.

loans.name: Adeline

texts.en: Adeline is a vegetable farmer from Bohol, Philippines. She is a married woman and a mother of two children ages nine and seven. Adeline is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. Adeline is hopeful that through this loan their farming business will boom and generate more revenue necessary for their needs and for their children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Khmanh's Group

texts.en:
Khmanh is 35 years old, and she lives with her husband and five daughters in a rural village of the Tbaung Khmum district. Rice farming and cassava growing are the main sources of her family’s income. She has been in this business for 13 years. The current business earns her family the daily income of about 18,000 KHR, and she is able to save 8,000 KHR each day. 

This is the third loan for Khmanh with VisionFund. She fully repaid the past loan. She is now leading her group of four, to apply for a new loan. As the leader, she will use her portion of the loan funds to buy fertilizer for her farmland and to pay for having her field plowed. She hopes to get a high yield from her farming business, by using the fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland and to have her field plowed

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Khatija

texts.en:
Khatija is 50 years old and a responsible and independent woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband, three daughters and two sons. Her husband is working in a wood shop. He has a very low salary and it is very difficult for them to manage the household expenses. Consequently, they are facing many problems in life.

Since 2003 Khatija has been running a small general store, to generate a second source of income for her family. She has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner, BRAC Pakistan, to expand her business. She wants to buy a variety of goods to resell, like milk, sugar, rice, soap, creams, and washing powder, and she wants to introduce some new items for her general store. She believes that these purchases will help her to fulfill the demands of the customers and to increase her savings. She would reinvest part of the profit into the general store, and use another part of it to pay her household expenses, including the education of her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their support.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her general store, like milk, sugar, etc., including some new items to offer to her customers

loans.name: Luis Alfonso

texts.es:
Luis Alfonso, labora desde hace 38 años en el sector del calzado y desde hace ocho años decidió montar su propio negocio en su vivienda, dedicado a al reparación de zapatos. Labora diariamente en conjunto con un familiar. Actividad que se ha convertido en la fuente de ingresos para su familia y le ha permitido garantizarles educación a sus dos hijos. 
Se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos como tintas, sintéticos, hilos, pega y mejoras locativas para la proyección de una mejor imagen.
Sueña con diseñar y producir calzado a gran escala pero es conciente que no cuenta el dinero necesario, por lo cual comenzará a ahorrar para hacer realidad su deseo.
texts.en:
Luis Alfonso has worked in the shoe business for 38 years. Eight years ago, he decided to set up his own shoe repair shop at home. He works every day with the help of a relative. Luis Alfonso has now made this business a source of income for his family, which allows him to pay for the education of his two children.

He is requesting a loan so that he can buy supplies such as dyes, synthetics, thread, and glue. Luis Alfonso will also pay for structural improvements so that his shop will have a better appearance. He dreams of designing and producing shoes on a large scale, but he is aware that he does not have the necessary funds. For this reason, he will start saving so that he can make this dream a reality.

loans.use: to buy dyes, synthetics, thread, glue and to pay for structural improvements to his shop.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Angélica de 34 años de edad esta casada con Lucio y tiene dos hijos con quienes vive en una casa construida  abase de adobe .Posee unos terrenos agrícolas las cuales dedica integramente a la producción de cacao orgánico, café y achiote.Realiza sus labores en unos terrenos que adquirió desde muy joven junto a su esposo donde convoca a familiares en calidad de trabajadores y realiza labores con el fin de obtener una calidad óptima para recuperar el capital invertido.
Su principal inconveniente inicial fue el de no contar con capital suficiente para la siembra de cacao en el área total de sus terrenos, motivo por el cual su crecimiento económico fue de a pocos con el paso de los años.
Desea con el tiempo adquirir un terreno adicional e iniciarse en la producción de barbasco puesto que la calidad de tierras que poseen sus terrenos garantiza una buena producción de estos productos.Este viene a ser su primer préstamo otorgado por Kiva y  agradece la confianza brindada y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.Requiere contar con S/.3,000 nuevos soles para contratar a trabajadores del lugar .
texts.en:
Angélica, 34 years old, is married to Lucio and has two children with whom she lives in a house built with a base of adobe. She owns some farming land entirely dedicated to the growing of organic cocoa, coffee, and achiote. On the land that she and her husband acquired when very young, relatives get together as good workers in order to obtain excellent quality to recover the capital invested. 

Her main disadvantage at the beginning was not having enough capital to plant cocoa on all the land, which is why her financial growth was so small as years went by.

She wants over time to buy additional land and begin to grow muellin since the quality of land she has guarantees a good harvest of this product. This becomes her first loan granted through Kiva and she appreciates the confidence offered and she is committed to making her payments on time.

She is asking for 3,000 soles to hire workers at the site.

loans.use: to hire workers for her farmland

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia lives in Kisauni. She is married and has three children. She is the owner of a well-stocked general store which she has had for over two years. It is worth noting that she works with her whole family and it is going very well. Her husband is a driver and he contributes to the family's basic needs. Thanks to this business and the work of the entire family they have been able to grow considerably. They want to be able to expand their shop until they have a large supermarket where they might offer a greater variety and comfort to their customers.

Virginia is seeking this loan for the purchase of drinks, bakery items, vegetables, fruits, meat and other products in order to keep providing a good variety to her customers since that is what draws them the most.

loans.use: purchase drinks, bakery items, vegetables, fruits, meat and other products.

loans.name: Kutakurana Group

texts.en: This is 47 year old Elizabeth from Murehwa, a village 75 km northeast from the capital city Harare. She is married with five children, three attending school. Elizabeth runs a retail business selling groceries. The business has been in operation for two years. She says the main challenges faced are stiff competition from other traders. Elizabeth has requested for a loan of $300 to increase her stocks. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her improve the family's general welfare. In the future, Elizabeth plans to operate a large supermarket.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Curlest

texts.en:
Curlest is a resident of Malindi, Kenya. He is single and runs a retail shop which has been in operation for the last three years. Besides this, he is also a dairy farmer. He was introduced to Milango by his friends and is asking for a loan of 41,850 KES to purchase additional stock of retail items like sugar, flour, cooking fat, rice etc.

He intends to save the additional income from this venture and use it to install a larger shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy retail items like sugar, flour, cooking fat, rice etc.

loans.name: Sikuku

texts.en:
Sikuku, thanks to the previous loan, has been able to stock up her business and offer better attention and variety to her customers. She says that the help that Kiva and Yehu Microfinance have given her has been very useful, not only to her but also to her children.

She asks for a new loan to be able to again stock up her business with all kinds of products, like drinks, vegetables, meat and more, and thus continue offering her customers a good variety of products.

loans.use: to buy drinks, vegetables, meat and more.

loans.name: Sothy's Group

texts.en:
Sothy, 58, is married with six children. She resides in a rural village of the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Chnang province. To support the family, she and her husband have been farming rice and planting vegetables for 39 years. Together, they can earn about KHR 25,000 per day and can save about KHR 10,000 each day for the future needs. 

Sothy’s group consists of three members who are all female and Sothy has been with VisionFund for one cycle. Sothy completely paid back the loans and successfully used the loans to better support her family. She and her group members are applying for a loan. 

As the leader, Sothy will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor fees. She hopes to make more rice to increase her family’s income and have a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Valeriana

texts.en: Valeria, a farmer from Bohol, Philippines, is a married woman and a mother of three children. She has been engaged in the farming business for more than 20 years now together with her husband. Farming is their main source of income. Valeria wants to improve their farm but lacks the financial resources to do so. She joined CEVI to gain access to the loan services offered by the organization to small entrepreneurs like her. She is asking for a loan to buy new pesticide spray, fertilizer and seedlings. In the future, Valeria wants to make their farming business a success so that it will generate more income for the family.

loans.use: to buy new pesticide spray, fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en:
Rodrigo is a 61 year old married man from Ubay, Bohol. He has 10 children.The youngest child is 13 while the oldest is 26 and not yet married. Others are already married. 

Rodrigo is into fishing. He catches and sells fish at the market. He has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy fishing net, nylon, and floaters to increase his catch and to be be able to increase sales. In the future,  Rodrigo would like to expand his business to support his family and to improve his livelihood.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, nylon and floaters

loans.name: Justina

texts.en: Justina is engaged in vegetable farming. She is married and has three grown children. She is asking for a loan to buy a new pesticide sprayer, fertilizer and seedlings. She believes that through this loan, she can improve her farm and its harvest. Furthermore, she can generate more income necessary for her family’s needs and consumption.

loans.use: to buy a new pesticide sprayer, fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Sinat's Group

texts.en:
Sinat, 34, is married with two children and resides in a rural village located in Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district, in Cambodia. All of her children are still in school. For the last fourteen years, she has been farming rice as the primary source of her family’s income. Sometimes her husband works for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 15,000 KHR per day and enables her to save about 5,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. 

Sinat’s group consists of two members who live in the same village, and they both have been with VisionFund for one cycle. The previous loan from VisionFund helped Sinat better support her family. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Sinat will use her portion to spend on labor fees for plowing the field. She hopes to increase her crop yield so as to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To pay for labor fees for plowing the field

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Sreyem's Group

texts.en:
Sreyem is 22 years old and married with one daughter who is still young. She lives in a rural village in Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district. She earns a living through farming rice and planting cassava. Her family earn about KHR 22,000 per day from the current business and can save about KHR 10,000 each day for future needs.

This is Sreyem’s group loan with Kiva partner VisionFund; Sreyem has been a member of VisionFund for one cycle. She successfully used her previous loan to better her living condition. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Sreyem will use her portion to pay for labor fees for plowing the field. She hopes to make more rice and cassava so as to sell it for a good price and make a better living.

loans.use: To pay for labor fees for plowing the field

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy grocery items for grocery selling business.

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
This is Araceli, 53, a resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is married to Frank, a driver, and is a mother to her children. Araceli operates a computer rental shop. She and her husband manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

In the Philippines, very few people own their own computers. Thus, there is a need for them, especially for students who need to do their research and papers. She rents computers by the hour and offers printing and typing services. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000. She will be utilizing the loan to buy new computer units, spare parts, and accessories needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Araceli hopes that her business will continue to grow and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and were she also draws strength and inspiration from the word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Maria Graciela

texts.es: La Sra. Graciela tiene 52 años y tiene  un hijo que tiene la  edad de 15 años, que se encuentra en edad escolar, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de variedad de repostería en panadería, ella tiene un puesto fijo  que se encuentra en la zona de Pampahasi,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Graciela va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de insumos como harina azúcar y levadura para la elaboración de empanadas y galletas,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital, la Sra. Graciela enfrenta retos en su negocio que son de mejorar su calidad de vida y  va a utilizar los beneficios para incrementar su producción, su deseo es poder tener una cafetería donde pueda ofrecer también sus deliciosas masitas a toda su clientela.
texts.en: Graciela, 52 years old, has a 15-year-old son who is in school. She works by making and selling a variety of pastries at a bakery. Graciela has a permanent job in the Pampahasi area. This loan is her first cycle with this institution, which she will use to buy supplies such as flour, sugar, and yeast to make empanadas and biscuits. She is requesting this loan due to a lack of capital. Graciela faces challenges in her business, which will improve her quality of life. She will use the profits to increase her production. She wants to be able to have a cafe where she can serve her delicious pastries to her customers.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, and other items for her business

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es: El Sr. Cesar sigue con la misma actividad de la carpintería, cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de madera por mayor, en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de herramienta para su trabajo como también madera para la fabricación de puertas ya que tiene pedidos en esta época ya que tiene mucha demanda de este producto.
texts.en:
Cesar continues with the same business activity, carpentry.  He says that the previous loan went well for him because he used it to buy wood in bulk.

This time he is requesting the loan to buy tools for his work.  He will also buy wood to make doors because he has orders at this time of the year.  He has a lot of demand for this product.

loans.use: to buy tools and wood.

loans.name: Loyda Eulises

texts.es:
La señora Eulises tiene su profesión es banca y finanza  se graduó en este ramo de la finanza pero por es cases de empleo no ha podido trabaja en su profesión.

Es casada su esposo trabaja como conductor de equipo pesado.

Con mucho esfuerzo y empeño han venido ahorrando y sintieron la necesidad de establecer este negocio en su casa de habitación, y solicitaron un financiamiento  para invertirlo en su negocio.

Ahorra necesita otro crédito para invertirlo comprar más medicina, en la  que ha tenido demanda.
texts.en:
Eulises is trained in banking and finance and graduated in the field of finance, but due to a lack of work, she has not been able to work at her profession.  She is married and her husband works as a heavy machinery operator.

With a lot of effort and hard work, she had been saving and felt the need to start this business in her home, and requested a loan to invest in her business.  Now, she is requesting another loan to purchase more medicine that is in demand.

loans.use: to purchase pharmaceutical products: syrup, pills for pain, infection, and pressure, ointments, and injections.

loans.name: Eknar

texts.es: Eknar de 24 años de edad es soltero y vive con sus padres .Se dedica al transporte de pasajeros inter distritales en su localidad pero tambien a las labores agrícolas consistentes en la producción de cacao y café orgánico.Día a día recorre diversas arterias de su zona transportando pasajeros con quienes muchas veces entabla amistades y hacen de su trabajo muy reconfortante.En ocasiones la lluvia es su principal inconveniente pues las vías por donde circula no son asfaltadas haciendo de su labor algo complicada.Con el paso de los años espera seguir trabajando con la motivación que lo caracteriza para cumplir sus objetivos los cuales parten desde adquirir su propio vehículo así como un terreno agrícola para dedicarlo al alquiler y obtener mejores ingresos.Este es su primer crédito con Kiva y se siente muy agradecido por la oportunidad que le brindan ya que le permite crecer económicamente.Con los 1,500 nuevos soles contratará trabajadores del lugar para la cosecha de cacao orgánico esperando recuperar el capital invertido desde hace 8 meses.
texts.en:
Eknar is 24 years old, single and lives with his parents. He makes a living from transporting passengers between districts in his area, but also from consistent agricultural work in the production of organic cacao and coffee. On a day to day basis he travels a number of the main routes in his area, transporting passengers he often becomes friendly with and who make his work very heartwarming.

At times, the rain is his primary inconvenience as the roads he circles are not paved, making his work a bit complicated. As the years pass, he hopes to keep working with his characteristic motivation to achieve his goals, starting with acquiring his own vehicle as well as agricultural land he can rent out and earn more income.

This is his first loan with Kiva and he feels very grateful for the opportunity provided as it allows him to grow financially. With the 1,500 Peruvian nuevos soles he will hire workers from the area to harvest organic cacao, hoping to recuperate the capital invested 8 months ago.

loans.use: to hire workers from the area

loans.name: Amalia Ivoon

texts.es:
Amalia es una señora, profesional pero inmersa en la actividad comercial, como legado de su mama, que todavía existe.
 esta señora durante 6 años  dirige el negocio de comedor, después que su mama lo iniciara desde hace varios años atrás, esta recién casada. y como una señora visionaria visito a ceprodel para solicitar financiamiento que utilizaría en la compra de perlin, zinc, hierro, cemento, arena y mano de obra, para agrandar el área del comedor  y cubrir la demanda existente, brindándoles las condiciones necesarias a su clientela y de esa manera aumentar el nivel de las ventas y tener mejores condiciones en su desarrollo familiar.
texts.en: Amalia, recently married, is a professional woman who is immersed in business, following the footsteps of her mom (who is still alive). For six years, Amalia has managed a restaurant after her mom started it several years earlier. As a visionary woman, she visited Ceprodel to request financing, which she will use to buy rafters, zinc, iron, cement, sand, and to pay for labor costs. This will allow her to expand her restaurant and meet the current demand by providing her customers with the better conditions. This will increase her level of sales and result in better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy rafters, zinc, iron, cement, sand, and to pay for labor costs

loans.name: Giovanny Cesar

texts.es:
Giovanny es un joven de 23 años que vive con su familia.
Giovanny estudia traducción e interpretación en una universidad local. El ha elegido esta carrera porque considera que es muy importante debido a la globalización del mercado ya que muchas empresas requieren profesionales de ese rubro. Giovanny  ha empezado a estudiar hace 6 años y solo le falta un ciclo que consta de 04 meses para terminar sus estudios, está muy feliz por los logros que está alcanzando y próximamente desea empezar una nueva carrera.  El préstamo le servirá para pagar los gastos de su bachillerato para culminar su carrera con exito, su mayor sueño en la vida es tener su propia empresa.
Giovanny está muy emocionado por saber que personas de todo el mundo le van a apoyar en sus estudios, principalmente sin conocerlo.
texts.en:
Giovanny is a 23-year-old young man who lives with his family.

Giovanny studies translation and interpretation at a local university. He has chosen this career because he thinks it is very important due to the globalization of the market, as many businesses require professionals of this nature. Giovanny began his studies 6 years ago and only has one semester to go, just 4 months left to finish his studies. He is very happy with his achievements and wants to start a new career soon. The loan will serve to pay his university expenses so he can finish his degree successfully. His greatest dream in life is to have his own business.

Giovanny is very excited to know that people all over the world are going to support him in his studies, especially because they don't know him.

loans.use: to pay his university expenses

loans.name: Tol

texts.en:
Tol, 34, is married with one son, who is in school. She lives in a wooden house with her family in a rural village of the Sa Ang district. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice. Having been in this business for 11 years, she manages to earn about $5 (US) per day and can save about $1.50 each day for her future needs. 

Tol has been with VisionFund for six cycles. She has completely paid back the past loans, which she used successfully to better support her living expenses and pay for her son’s education. 

She is now applying for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides and rice seeds for her farmland and she will use a portion for labour fees. She hopes to increase her crop yields and earn more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticides and rice seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Bertha María

texts.es:
Doña Bertha María vive en un populoso barrio de la capital de Managua departamento de Nicaragua, es una persona con trabajo estable, desempeñándose como operador central telefónica desde hace veinte y ocho años, su estado civil es madre soltera con tres hijos a su cargo con edad escolar.

Se presento a CEPRODEL  para solicitar  crédito para compra de materiales de construcción  tales como bloque, hierro, cinc, para anexo de un cuarto y darle a sus hijos mejor condición. 

Con este financiamiento ampliara su casa ya que es pequeña.
texts.en:
Bertha María lives in a populated neighborhood in the capital of Managua, a department of Nicaragua. She is a person with a stable job, working as a call center operator for the last twenty-eight years. She is a single mother with three school-aged children in her care.

She went to CEPRODEL to ask for a loan to buy construction materials like blocks, iron and zinc to add a room on and give her children better living conditions. With this loan, she will expand her house, as it is small.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Aiah David's Group

texts.en:
Meet teachers of a vocational institute in the city of Koidu, in eastern Sierra Leone. This group of hard-working and dedicated teachers has come to Salone Microfinance Trust, a Kiva partner based in Makeni, in northern Sierra Leone, to request a loan of 8,000,000 Sierra Leonean leone for the entire team. 

With the help of this loan, these men will be able to solve their immediate and most pressing financial challenges. At the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. Their institution’s bursar is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf.

On the left in the photo is Sahr, the team’s featured leader. Born in Gandorhun, in eastern Sierra Leone, the 45-year-old is married to a teacher, and the couple has three children. Sahr has been a school teacher for 18 years. He has requested this loan to buy building materials for the construction of a dwelling house.

loans.use: to buy building materials for the construction of a dwelling house

loans.name: Artem

texts.en:
Artem, 42, lives in Ijevan City with his wife and two school-aged children. He has been engaged in trading activities since graduating from secondary school. Since 1997, he has run a fruit and vegetable trading business, which brings him sufficient profit to provide for his family's needs.
 
Artem’s wife helps him in this activity. Artem is very pleased and says that this business has enabled him to buy furniture and a car.

Now he seeks a loan to buy an assortment of fruit and vegetables for resale in his rented stall in Ijevan market. He will use the anticipated profits to repair his house.

loans.use: To buy an assortment of fruit and vegetables for resale in his rented stall

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es: La señora Marisol es una mujer visionaria y esforzada que siempre está enfocada al mejoramiento del nivel de vida, trabaja en un centro de salud donde habita, desempeñándose en el area administrativa con 25 años de laborar, es soltera con 3 personas a su cargo , esta señora actualmente presenta una necesidad de mejorar su vivienda, por eso visito  ceprodel para solicitar financiamiento para utilizarlo en la compra de materiales de construcción como: Perlin 3 x 1 ½, Zinc 28 x 12, Cemento, Bloques y Mano de Obra para mejorar el techo, piso y pared de su vivienda y de esa manera crear  mejores condiciones para  su familia.
texts.en: Marisol is a strong, visionary woman who is always focused on improving her quality of life.  She has worked in administration for 25 years at the health center where she lives.  She is single with three dependents.  She currently needs to make improvements to her home, which is why she went to CEPRODEL to ask for a loan to buy construction materials, such as 3 x 1 1/2 purlins, 28 x 12 sheets of zinc, cement, blocks, and labor to work on the roof, floor, and wall of her home and create better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to pay for 3 x 1 1/2 purlins, 28 x 12 sheets of zinc, cement, blocks, and labor

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
La señora Ana María,  es una persona  trabajadora, teniendo como actividad venta de comida su especialidad sopa, ubicada en su casa de habitación en la capital. A tiende su negocio junto a su esposo.

 Solicita el  préstamo a ceprodel para invertir en mejora de su negocio, reparación y pintura del local y  Esto con el propósito de arreglar su negocio.  El crédito anterior lo utilizo para comprar más insumos para su negocio.

Se siente agradecida con ceprodel y Kiva, por la oportunidad y la confianza depositada en ella, por medio de los préstamos ha incrementado su negocio y le ha permitido mejorar su vivienda y tener  una  condición mejor de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Ana María is a hardworking woman who makes a living selling food she prepares in her home, located in the capital city. Her specialty is soup. She works alongside her husband to maintain this business.

Ana María is requesting this loan from Ceprodel so that she may invest it to improve her business. She plans to do some repairs and painting to the building. 

Ana María used her previous loan to buy ingredients for her business. She is very grateful for the Kiva and Ceprodel for the opportunity this loan presents her and for the trust they have put in her. With the help of these loans, she has been able to improve her home and the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to improve her business by painting and doing some repairs.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: La señora Elizabeth tiene 35 años es casada tiene dos hijos de las edades de 5 y 14 años, que se encuentran estudiando,  ella se dedica  a la venta de comida ella vende pollo frito tiene su pensión  que se encuentra en la localidad de El Torno,  La señora Elizabeth es una persona muy trabajadora  que con dedicación poco a poco va adquiriendo estabilidad y solvencia y también popularidad por que es muy conocida por sus clientes ya que La señora Elizabeth les atiende muy amablemente,  con el dinero del crédito comprara un horno eléctrico para la elaboración de sus comidas, la cliente cuenta que con mucho esfuerzo se puede crecer más y así seguir haciéndose de patrimonio para el bienestar de su familia y también personal se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Elizabeth is 35 years old, married, and has two children who are 5 and 14 years old and who are in school.  She sells fried chicken for a living from her at-home restaurant in El Torno.  Elizabeth is a very hardworking person who through determination is little by little gaining stability and solvency and even popularity because she is very well-known to her customers for giving very good customer service.  With the money from the loan she will buy an electric oven to make her food.  She tells us that with a lot of work she can grow more and keep accruing wealth for her family's and her own well-being.  She is happy with the institution and it thankful for the help it has given her.

loans.use: to buy an electric oven

loans.name: Binti

texts.en: Binti is a single mother with two children. They help her in the grocery store. Binti gained experience in commerce through her previous job as a salesperson at a private business. With the help of a loan, she invested. She currently has a well-stocked small grocery store. The items she sells the most are basic food items. She is requesting this loan to buy merchandise, such as flour, sugar, cooking oil, chicken, beef, drinks and dairy products.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, such as flour, sugar, cooking oil, chicken, beef, drinks and dairy products, for her grocery store.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en: Zainab is 48 years old, a hard-working and diligent woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her son and a daughter. Her husband is deceased, and her son has been engaged in the marble business for four years. Zainab has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan. The main purpose of loan is to permit her son to expand his business. He would purchase a large quantity, and new designs, of marble from other cities and then sell it at a profit. With the profits, Zainab wants to save money for the marriage of her daughter. This loan could fulfill her dreams, and she has great hopes for this loan.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity and variety of marble for her son's business.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: This is Emma. She is in her late forties and is from Tombo, in western rural Freetown. She is married to a fisherman and has five children between the ages of 3 and 15. Emma runs a food stand in her neighborhood; she sells biscuits, milk, soap, cigarettes and sugar. She has been running this business since 2008. She works at the business every day from morning to night. She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation. Emma has applied for a loan in order to purchase a variety of foodstuffs, such as milk, soap, cigarettes and sugar. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and renovate the roof of her house. In the future, she plans to open a big shop. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of foodstuffs, such as milk, soap, cigarettes and sugar, for her food stall.

loans.name: Adam

texts.en: Adam is 26 years old and lives in the town of Mityana in the Mubende region of Uganda. He is married and has one child. For the past year, Adam has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells soap, sugar, milk and bread. To help expand his business, Adam has applied for a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more items, such as rice, maize flour and soda, to sell, and it will help Adam to generate greater profits and enable him to sell more goods, due to his increased stock. His profits will increase, and he will pay his medical bills. Adam hopes that, in the future, he will be able to expand his shop into a mini supermarket. Adam is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs such as Adam, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but who have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more items, such as rice, maize flour and soda, to sell.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en: Mwaka is a married woman. She has four children, three of whom attend school. Mwaka owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are for food and school fees. Mwaka operates a business selling firewood, selling from her home to her neighbours and to passersby. She faces stiff competition from other firewood-seller businesses. With the KES 30,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of firewood and charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans and boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of firewood and charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Hazem

texts.en:
Hazem is from Iraq. He is 37 years old, married and has three children. Hazem is the sole provider in the family.

Hazem owns a small shop and specializes in selling car accessories such as speakers, radios and amplifiers. After working with one of his relatives in this field and gaining sufficient experience, Hazem decided to open a similar business of his own in another area. In 2011, Hazem successfully established his business, and now he has hired an employee.

Hazem is requesting a loan of 2,400 USD. He will use this loan to renovate his shop by installing new shelves and an external ceiling. He believes that with the improvements enabled by this loan, he will be able to attract more customers and grow his business. By his income, Hazem will be able to cover all of his family’s needs.

loans.use: to renovate his shop by installing new shelves and an external ceiling

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is a hardworking and diligent 40-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan along with her husband and five children. Her husband is a government employee but his income is insufficient to meet the household expenses. All of her children are studying in government schools. 

Zahida is an efficient beautician by profession. Since 2010, she has operated her own beauty salon. Currently the stock of beauty supplies of the salon is almost depleted, therefore Zahida wants to purchase cosmetic products to continue her business. For that purpose she has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase beauty products like facial creams, lipsticks, scrubs, makeup kits, hair colors and some other varieties of products. She would also like to buy some new chairs for her salon. 

With the resulting profit, she will pay the installments of the loan and school fees for her children. She dreams to live a happy, healthy and peaceful life with her family. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their support.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetic products for her beauty parlor

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is married and she has one child who attends school.

Gloria has been working as a street vendor selling clothes and shoes for women, men, and children since 2009. She has an established clientele.

Gloria is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of jeans, other clothes for men and women, and uniforms for elementary and high school students. Since a new school term is approaching, she wants to continue making good sales.

loans.use: to purchase inventory of jeans, clothes for men and women, and uniforms for elementary and high school students.

loans.name: Sandra Patricia

texts.es: Sandra, tiene 44 años de edad, tiene dos hijos y vive en una colonia que pertenece al municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Ella lleva tres años de dedicarse a la elaboración de bisutería como aretes, cadenas, anillos, pulseras de piedras y también vende cosméticos. Las ventas las realiza de manera ambulante y en su casa. Ha decidido por solicitar un segundo préstamo por 5,000 Lempiras con el cual va comprar materiales para elaborar bisutería como ser piedras, hilos, broches y otros y va comprar lociones para vender. Ella quiere mantener surtido su negocio para mejorar las ventas. su plan es mejorar la situación económica familiar.
texts.en:
Sandra is 44 years old. She has two children and lives in a community in the municipality of Choloma, Cortes. Sandra has been making and selling jewelry for three years. She makes earrings, chains, rings, bracelets with stones, as well as sells cosmetics. She sells her merchandise door to door and from her home. 

Sandra decided to request a second loan of 5,000 Honduran Lempiras so that she will be able to buy supplies for her jewelry-making such as stones, threads, clasps, and others. She also plans to buy lotions to sell. Sandra hopes to keep her business stocked in order to increase her sales. She plans to help her family financially.

loans.use: to buy materials such as stones, threads, clasps, and others for making jewelry as well as to buy lotions to sell.

loans.name: Janet Jhovana

texts.es:
Janet es una mujer de 27 años, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con su esposo y sus dos pequeños hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que junto con su esposo dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Janet no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar música y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Lomo Saltado para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Janet trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes y bebidas, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por la variedad de productos y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Janet se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de andamios y bebidas, como refresco, agua mineral y otros, de esta manera Janet podrá exhibir mejor sus productos y tendrá mejor abastecido su negocio, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener una vivienda adecuada y segura, que brinde mayor bienestar para su familia.
texts.en:
Janet is a 27-year-old woman who lives in the city of Nazca with her husband and their two small children. She loves her family very much and they are her biggest motivation in live. Janet is a very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who, alongside her husband, dedicates herself completely to helping her family get ahead. Unfortunately, due to scarce economic resources, Janet had to begin working at an early age and was not able to study a professional career as she would have liked to do.

In her free time, she enjoys listening to music. On special occasions, she cooks the delicious Lomo Saltado (sautéed beef tips) to share with her family. 

By her own initiative and with much determination and dedication, Janet runs her own small grocery store. She works 10-hour days each day and believes that her success so far is due to the variety of products she offers and the kind way she treats her customers. 

Janet is very grateful to Kiva lenders because this loan will help her to buy more shelving and soft drinks such as juice, water, and others. This will help Janet to display her products better and keep her store stocked. Janet plans to continue working hard to achieve her dream of owning an adequate and safe house that will keep improve her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy shelving and soft drinks.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: El Sr. Francisco tiene 53 años, casado con dos hijos mayores de 18 años,  el se dedica  a la confección de prendas de vestir desde hace ya varios años el confecciona ropa quirófano, batas para doctores,  su taller se encuentra en su mismo domicilio que es en la en la zona de Vino Tinto. este préstamo es su  primera secuencia dentro de la institución, El Sr. Francisco va a utilizar este préstamo para la  compra de telas para la confección de prendas de vestir por mayor, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es para incremento de capital de inversión ya que el tiene contratos con hospitales a los que entrega el producto terminado,  como también entrega a distintas ferias donde venden ropa,  El Sr. Francisco enfrenta retos en su negocio que son aumentar sus ingresos y va a utilizar los beneficios invirtiendo en la compra de materiales para la confección de prendas de buena calidad y así tener más pedidos de clientes, El Sr. Francisco es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Francisco is 53 years old.  He is married with two children who are over 18.  He sews garments for a living and for years has been making surgical scrubs and doctors coats.  His workshop is in his home, which is in the Vino Tinto neighborhood.  This loan will be his first cycle with the institution.  Francisco will use this loan to buy bulk fabric to make clothing.  He is asking for this loan to increase his investment capital as he has contracts with hospitals where he delivers his finished product.  He also supplies different fairs where clothing is sold.  Francisco faces challenges in his business, such as increasing his profit, and he is going to use his earnings to invest in high quality sewing materials so he will get more orders from his customers.  Francisco is a very hardworking person.  He is happy with the institution and thankful for the help he has received.

loans.use: to buy fabric in bulk

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: El Sr. Luis, tiene 34 años vive con su pareja con la que tienen  tres hijos de las edades de 1, 9 y 15 años, todos se encuentran estudiando, El Sr. Luis  se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería, hace más de 11 años, ellos viven en la comunidad de cañaveral  Distante a 40 km. del Torno,  donde tienen su parcela donde siembran sandia, maíz, cítricos y yuca, el crédito que han solicitado es para la siembra de sorgo y los gastos que implica el preparado de la tierra, este sorgo lo venden como forraje para alimento del ganado Todo lo que ellos siembran lo venden directo del productor al consumidor en el mercado de la zona, se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Luis is 34 years old.  He lives with his partner, with whom he has three children who are 1, 9, and 15 years old and who are all in school.  Luis has been working in farming and livestock for over 11 years.  They live in the community of Cañaveral, 40km from El Torno, where their plot of land is and where they grown watermelons, citrus, and yucca.  The loan they have requested is to plant sorghum and for the cost of preparing the land.  They sell the sorghum as feed for livestock.  They sell everything they grow directly from grower to consumer at the local market.  He is happy with the institution and thankful for the help he has received.

loans.use: to plant sorghum

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
Jose es un hombre de 21 años, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial con su esposa y su pequeño hijo, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven Jose no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Mecánica Automotriz, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Jose trabaja como operario en una empresa agrícola de su ciudad, el trabaja desempeñando labores de campo y puede hacerlo todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas, adicionalmente Jose tiene un pequeño negocio de crianza y venta de cuyes,  el se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Jose se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mayor variedad de cuyes, así como materiales de construcción (alambres, madera, malla metálica y otros) los cuales le servirán de mucho, ya que desea construir un corral adecuado para sus animales, de esta manera Jose seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder estudiar una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Jose is a 21-year-old man who lives in the city of Cañete, in the district of Imperial, along with his wife and their young son. Jose's son is his biggest motivation in life. Jose is a very kind, hardworking, and enthusiastic person. He and his wife dedicate themselves completely to helping their family get ahead. Unfortunately, due to scarce economic resources, he had to begin working at an early age and was not able to study Auto Mechanics like he hoped to. 

In his free time, Jose likes to play soccer with his friends and, on special occasions, he cooks the delicious Carapulcra con Sopa Seca (a traditional Peruvian dish) to share with his family. 

By his own initiative and with much dedication and determination, Jose works in an agricultural business in his city. He works 10-hour days in the fields and also runs his own small business raising and selling guinea pigs. He enjoys this work and believes he has been successful because of his work ethic and the kind way he treats others. 

Jose is very grateful to Kiva lenders because this loan will help him to buy a variety of guinea pigs, as well as building materials (cables, wood, hammer, and others) he needs to build a pen for his animals. In this way, Jose will continue working hard to achieve his dream of one day studying a professional career.

loans.use: to build a pen and buy guinea pigs.

loans.name: Fidel Mario
