texts.es: El Sr. Fidel  tiene 51 años, casado tiene un hijo que tienen la edad de 15 años,  el se dedica  a la elaboración y  venta de queso y leche ya que tiene ganado vacuno, el vive en la localidad de Cohana, la gente de la población se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  El Sr. Fidel  utilizara  este préstamo para la compra  de una vaca lechera y quiere aprovechar esta oportunidad,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es no tiene dinero  para la compra ya que esto le beneficiara de gran manera  ya que  proporcionara  buena cantidad de leche y así de esta manera producir más quesos y leche y mejorar sus ingresos económicos, El Sr. Fidel  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son el forraje que debe comprar cada cierto tiempo, y  utilizara los beneficios mejorar su ganado y su deseo es poder elaborar quesos por mayor y ofrecer a los distintos mercados de la ciudad de La Paz.
texts.en:
Fidel is 51 years old. He married with one 15-year-old son. He makes a living from the production and sale of cheese and milk since he has cattle. He lives in the locality of Cohana. The people of Cohana make a living from agriculture and farming. 

This loan is his first cycle with the institution. Fidel will use this loan to purchase a dairy cow and he wants to make the most of this opportunity. The reason he is requesting this loan is because he has no money to make the purchase. The loan will benefit him greatly since the new dairy cow will give him a great quantity of milk, thereby allowing him to produce more cheese and milk and improve his income. 

Fidel faces challenges in his business, such as having to buy fodder every so often, and he will use the profits to improve his herd. His wish is to be able to make cheeses wholesale and offer them to different markets in the city of La Paz.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to prepare the land for his new corn crop

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es: La Sra. Josefa tiene 57 años, casada tiene un  hijo que se encuentra en edad escolar, ella se dedica a la venta de polleras y enaguas  para la mujeres de polleras, tiene su puesto de venta  en la zona de  Alto Lima, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Josefa va a usar este préstamo para la compra de polleras por mayor  para surtir su mercadería, ya que por esta fechas tiene mucha venta también entrega pedidos a los distintos mercados de la ciudad de El Alto,  La Sra. Josefa enfrenta retos en su negocio que son surtir su mercadería y va a utilizar los beneficios e seguir comprando por mercadería por mayor para surtir su negocio.
texts.en: Josefa is 57 years old, married, and has one school-age child.  She sells skirts and underskirts for women.  She has a stall in the Alto Lima area.  This loan is her first cycle with the institution.  Josefa is going to use her loan to buy skirts in bulk to increase her stock, as her sales are very good this time of year.  She also fills orders with different markets in the city of El Alto.  Josefa faces challenges in her business, such as stocking up on merchandise, and she will use her earnings to keep buying merchandise in bulk to stock her business.

loans.use: to buy skirts in bulk

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis  tiene 55 años es casado, tiene 1 hija, es de la ciudad  de Paraguarí,  allí el, su hija y su esposa Irene viven desde hace muchos años.
Luis tiene una despensa bien surtida, con el obtienen muy buen ingreso mensual aparte de que ya cuenta con una clientela formada, siempre trata de ser una persona amable con sus clientes, y es por eso que le va muy bien, ya que sabe que la clave es ser servicial con las demás personas.
Pretende utilizar el crédito para la compra de bebidas, productos de limpieza, artículos comestibles, ya que de esta manera podrá aumentar y obtener un mayor ingreso y también seguir dando una buena variedad a sus clientes, de la misma forma que lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Luis is 55 years old, married, and has one daughter. He is from the city of Paraguarí. Luis, his daughter, and his wife Irene have lived there for many years.

He has a well-stocked food pantry that generates a good monthly income. Luis also has an established clientele and always tries to treat each of his customers in a friendly manner. For this reason, he has done very well. He knows that the key is being helpful to others.

Luis intends to use the loan to buy beverages, cleaning products, and food products. This will allow him to grow and generate more income. He also wants to continue offering a good variety to his customers in the same manner as he has done before.

loans.use: to buy beverages, cleaning products, and food products.

loans.name: Geraldine Fiorella

texts.es:
Geraldine es una mujer de 21 años, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con su pareja, a quien ama y con quien desea en poco tiempo tener su familia, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por  falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar, Geraldine no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver películas y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pato para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Geraldine trabaja como operaria en una empresa pesquera de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de  8 horas y puede realizar labores de recojo, lavado, empaque de pescados, ella cree que le va bien por su responsabilidad y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Geraldine se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su habitación, ya que actualmente vive en casa de los padres de su pareja y su habitación se encuentra actualmente deteriorada y necesita reforzarla con materiales adecuado y resistentes, de esta manera Geraldine y su familia podrán contar con mayor seguridad y bienestar, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su propia casa.
texts.en:
Geraldine is a 21-year-old woman who lives in the city of Chincha with her husband, whom she loves and with whom she hopes to soon start a family. Geraldine is a kind, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who strives to get ahead. Unfortunately, due to financial hardship, Geraldine had to begin working at a young age and was not able to study Business Administration like she had hoped to. 

In her free time, she likes to watch movies and, on special occasions, she cooks the delicious Arroz con Pato (a Peruvian dish with duck and rice) to share with her family. 

By her own initiative and with much determination and dedication, Geraldine works at a fishing company in her city. She works eight-hour days, every day, doing jobs such as gathering, cleaning, and packing fish. She believes that she has been successful because she is very responsible and is friendly to everyone around her. 

Geraldine is very grateful to Kiva lenders because this loan will help her to improve her home. Currently, she lives in her in-laws' house and her room is deteriorating and in need of repairs. She needs to buy better materials to do the repairs so that her family will be safer and healthier. Geraldine plans to continue working hard to achieve her dream of one day owning her own house.

loans.use: to improve her home.

loans.name: Jose Nelson

texts.es:
José, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol. Él está acompañado, tiene tres  hijos de edades 1, 6 y 10 años; ya posee 20 años de dedicarse a la actividad y esto lo aprendió con sus padres, lo realiza de 6:00 am a 3:00 pm, dependiendo de la temporada.
El préstamo que solicita lo necesitara para comprar abono, herbicidas, insecticidas y plaguicidas para el cultivo de maíz y frijol. Esta inversión le permitirá adquirir todos los insumos agrícolas necesarios de una sola vez y con las ganancias ayudar a su familia.
Su objetivo es ayudar a sus hijos en los estudios y que no falte la alimentación para el hogar.
texts.en:
José grows corn and beans.  He has a spouse and three children, ages one, six, and ten.  He has been working at this business activity for 20 years.  He leaned it from his parents.  He works from 6:00 a.m. until 3:00 p.m., depending upon the season.

He needs the loan he is requesting to buy manure, herbicides, insecticides, and pesticides for his corn and bean crops.  This investment will allow him to get all of the needed agricultural supplies at the same time.  He will help his family with the profits.

His objective is to help his children with their education and to make sure there is food in the home.

loans.use: to buy manure, herbicides, insecticides, and pesticides.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 24-year-old youth client from Iraq. He is married and has 2 children.

Ali is a grocer. He sells soft drinks, juices, detergents, and dairy products. In 2011, when there was no grocery store in the neighborhood, Ali took the opportunity to open one. He gained a good reputation thanks to his good thinking in providing the basic needs for the neighborhood. Ali has gained good experience in this field.

Ali is requesting a youth loan of 2,400 USD to pay the annual rent of his grocery store and to renovate it. He is aiming to grow his business more and increase his revenues, so he will be able to take care of his family’s needs.

loans.use: to renovate and pay the annual rent of his grocery store.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is a 49-year-old married woman from Ubay, Bohol. She has 3 children. The youngest child is 6 while the oldest child is 21. She is into farming. She grows rice. She has been growing rice 20 years. 

Sabina's income is meager enough to meet the family's expenses, so she requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers, pesticides, and rice seedlings to increase the volume of harvest as well as increase sales. 

In the future, Sabina would like to invest in another business to support her family and to be able to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and rice seedlings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cooking utensils and food stock for her cafe business.

loans.name: Jabu

texts.en:
Jabu is a merchant. She makes a living selling mainly fruits and vegetables. She has done this work for more than 3 years, and she has a place in a popular market in Kisauni where she sells fresh products to her customers every day.

She's a very hardworking person who makes an effort every day, from very early in the morning, because she begins her work day very early.

She's requesting this loan to be able to buy fruits and vegetables so she can continue working and giving her customers good products.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables so she can continue working and giving her customers good products.

loans.name: María Angélica

texts.es:
María de 43 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda en su municipio, actividad que según ella le deja buenas ganancias y le permite sostener su hogar. La idea surgió gracias a su hermana quien la motivó. Sus principales clientes son las personas del campo, por lo cual María solo abre los fines de semana. En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de mercancía, ya que esta inversión le permitirá mejorar su condición económica e incrementar su volumen de ventas. 
A futuro la señora María desea tener su propia vivienda para garantizarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María is 43 years old and sells secondhand clothing in her town. According to María, her business generates good income and allows her to sustain her household. She came up with this idea thanks to her sister who encouraged her. Her main customers are farm workers since María is only open on the weekends.

At the moment, she is requesting a loan to buy merchandise. This investment will allow her to improve her financial condition and increase her sales volume. In the future, Sra. María wants to have her own house so that she can guarantee that her family has a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es: Don Santiago, tiene 41 años de edad, casado, tiene 3 hijos,  vive con su familia en San Juan Pueblo. El establecio un negocio de pulperia en este negocio vende granos básicos, huevos, lácteos, harina, embutidos,  condimentos, productos de limpieza, pastas, refrescos, etc. el negocio tiene ocho años de funcionar y tiene buena clientela. El está solicitando un préstamo por 25,000 Lempiras para surtir más el negocio de productos alimenticios,como granos basicos, productos de limpieza, carnes, lacteos, embutidos etc.  con el fin de aumentar las ventas. Su meta es seguir creciendo y llegar a graduar sus hijos y ayudar a su familia económicamente.
texts.en:
Don Santiago is 41 years old, married, and has three children. He lives with his family in San Juan Pueblo.

Santiago established a grocery business where he sells basic grains, eggs, dairy products, flour, cured meats, condiments, cleaning products, pastas, soft drinks, and other items. His business has been in operation for eight years and has a good clientele.

Santiago is requesting a loan of 25,000 HNL so that he can restock his store with more products such as basic grains, cleaning products, meats, dairy products, cured meats, and other items so that he can increase his sales. His goals are to keep growing, see his children graduate, and help his family financially.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, cleaning products, meats, dairy products, cured meats, and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a bathroom

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: El señor Victor,  tiene 46  años de edad, vive en condiciones desfavorables ya que la producción agrícola en la zona no tiene riego, por tanto la producción es únicamente dependiente de las precipitaciones pluviales de la época;   tiene seis  hijos dependientes que asisten a la escuela de Mizque, por lo general los niños deben caminar para llegar a su escuela y en algunas ocasiones en vehículos que transitan por casualidad esas rutas.  Su esposa es la señora Juana, tiene 46 años, Juana colabora en la producción agrícola y el manejo del ganado vacuno. Debido a  las riadas ocasionadas por las tormentas en la segunda semana de febrero, los cultivos de Victor fueron afectados en gran parte, ya que perdió el 50% de su producción de arveja y papa, afectando una disminución de ingresos económicos por venta de estos productos. Por todo lo anteriormente mencionado la estabilidad económica de Victor  sufrió un desequilibrio, afectando directamente en la adquisición de los materiales escolares e insumos requeridos para la construcción de vivienda y  de la canasta familiar para la alimentación de su familia. Para enmendar lo mencionado anteriormente ha recurrido al crédito para comprar  semillas de (zanahoria, cebolla), agroquímicos y abono orgánico; de esta manera tendrá mejores ingresos que le ayuden a mejorar su calidad de vida y estabilizar las necesidades económicas de su familia y retomar el camino de la prosperidad.
texts.en:
Sr. Victor, age 46, lives in conditions that are unfavorable for farming since his area has no irrigation. Therefore, his crops are dependent only on the seasonal rainfall. He has six dependent children who attend school in Mizque. In general, the children must walk to school, but on some occasions they will catch a ride on vehicles that are traveling in the same direction. His wife is Sra. Juana, age 46. She helps with the farm production and with taking care of the cattle.

Due to floods that resulted from the storms during the second week of February, Victor’s crops were negatively impacted. He lost half of his pea and potato crops, resulting in less income from the sale of these products. This direct hit to his finances affected his ability to buy school supplies, construction materials for his home, and food so that his family could eat. To rectify this problem, Victor is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds (onions and carrots), agrochemicals, and organic fertilizer. This will enable him to generate more income that will improve his quality of life and stabilize his family’s finances. As a result, they can resume their path to prosperity.

loans.use: to buy seeds (onions and carrots), agrochemicals, and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Jacqueline Alexandra

texts.es:
La Señora Jacqueline vive en Guayaquil (orquídeas), tiene 42 años de edad. Empezó cuando se quedo sin trabajo, y decidió poner una recicladora, porque vio que no mucha gente reciclaba Y por donde ella vive no hay muchos lugares para reciclar y fue asi que puso su propio negocio.

Ella actualmente es recicladora y realiza su trabajo sola, ella pesa los productos reciclables que le llegan, trabaja desde la mañana hasta la noche. Las dificultades que ella tiene en su trabajo es la enfermedad de sus hijos. Ella no está casada  y tiene 3 hijos, uno mayor de edad y los otros estudian en escuela fiscales.

Ella usara el préstamo para comprar fundas, cartones para reclicar las botellas. Sus sueños para el futuro son de hacer su casa de cemento, que sus hijos sigan estudiando, y seguir con su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Jacqueline is 42 years old and lives in Guayaquil (Orquídeas). She started her business after she lost her job. Jacqueline decided to open a recycling center because she saw that not many people recycle. In the area where she lives, there are not many places that recycle, which influenced her to open her own business.

Jacqueline currently manages her recycling center by herself. She weighs the recyclable products that come in, which keeps her busy from morning to night. The difficulties she faces in her business include having to take care of her children when they are sick. Jacqueline is not married and has three children, one grown child and two others who attend state schools.

She will use this loan to buy bags and cardboard that she can use for recycling bottles. Her dreams for the future include building a cement house, seeing her children continue their studies, and continuing to operate her business.

loans.use: to buy bags and cardboard.

loans.name: Farhat

texts.en:
Farhat is a 32-year-old hard working housewife. She is living in Punjab, Pakistan with her husband, three daughters and one son. Her husband has been driving a taxi for eight years and this is the only source of income for her family. 
Right now there is a lot of repairing and tuning work required in the engine of the taxi.  Because of that, it’s almost impossible for him to get earnings . Farhat has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner, BRAC Pakistan, to pay for repairing the engine of her husband's taxi so that he can drive it properly. With the profit, her husband would buy one more taxi in the future.  Farhat wishes to provide a quality education for her children, and she prays for the good health of her family and for the growth of her husband's business. She is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: To meet the amount for taxi repairing

loans.name: Shani

texts.en: Shani is a hardworking woman who intends to prosper in her business.  She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water and she would like to apply for a loan of kshs 40,000.  She wants to buy more stock of household consumables such as wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar. The more items displayed at the store, the better.  More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy more stock of household consumables such as wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar

loans.name: Marcelo Francisco

texts.es:
El Sr. Marcelo vive en La Libertad, el tiene 42 años de edad.  Su historia empieza cuando él decide  vender sal en el sector para tener ingresos para poder pagar los gastos del hogar y como le fue bien con las ventas empezó a ampliar más sus recorridos por el sector, vendiendo sal en fundas. 

El realiza su trabajo junto a su esposa, todos los días de la semana. La única dificultad que se presenta en su negocio es el transporte, se le hace muy pesado la movilización de su mercadería y también la distancia que hay que caminar, es muy cansado para los dos. El está casado, su esposa también vende sal. El tiene hijos pero todos ya son mayores. 

El usara el préstamo para comprar quintales de sal y poder vender a mas clientes. Sus sueños para el futuro son de poder tener su propia microempresa de sal..
texts.en:
Sr. Marcelo is 42 years old and lives in La Libertad. His story begins when he decided to sell salt in his neighborhood as a way of generating income for the household expenses. He did very well with his sales, so he expanded to other parts of the area, selling bags of salt.

Marcelo and his wife work together every day of the week. The only difficulty he faces in his business is the lack of transportation. The merchandise is very heavy. Since they must travel by foot, Marcelo and his wife are usually very tired. He is married and his wife also sells salt. They have children, but all of them are grown.

Marcelo will use this loan to buy salt by the quintal (1 quintal = 100 kg) so that he can sell to more customers. His dreams for the future include having his own salt micro-enterprise.

loans.use: to buy salt in bulk.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Meet 31-year-old Hawa from western rural Tombo in Sierra Leone. She is married with three children between the ages of 1 year and 15 years. Two of her children are currently attending school. In 2003, Hawa established her clothing business. She began her business because she wants to support herself and move forward with her family. She works at the business 11 hours per day, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is that transportation is very difficult.

Hawa requires a loan in order to buy more clothing material for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and renovate her house. In the future, Hawa plans to open a clothing shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more clothing material for resale.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a married woman with five children, three of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a cereal selling business for the past two years, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces major challenges of high cost of transportation and stiff competition.

With the 50,000 KES loan she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and rice for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and rice for resale.

loans.name: Jaseb

texts.en:
Jaseb is a 48-year-old Iraqi client who is married and has 2 children. Jaseb and one of his children provide the income of the family together.

Jaseb owns a small grocery store selling drinks, snacks, detergents, and dairy products. He has been in this field for more than 10 years, but established his own business in his neighborhood in 2008. Jaseb gained good experience in this field and, since he is the only grocer in the area, his fame grew fast in the surroundings.

Jaseb is requesting a loan of $2,400 to buy two new refrigerators and a motor generator. He aims to grow his business and increase his profits so he may be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy two new refrigerators and a motor generator.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is an Iraqi youth client who is single and lives with his family consisting of 5 members. Ali and his brother are the only providers in the family.

Ali is 18 years old and he is a grocer. He sells all the daily necessities of a family such as juices, soft drinks, snacks, detergents, perfumes, and dairy products. 

In 2010, Ali’s father helped him to establish this business and after seeing Ali’s potential, he let Ali run the shop all by himself. Ali has gained a good reputation in his surroundings thanks to his management ability since his young age.

Ali is requesting a youth loan of 1,800 USD. He will use this loan to install a display window and an external ceiling. Ali aims to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to take care of his parents and provide for all of their needs.

loans.use: to install a display window and an external ceiling in his shop.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is married with two children, and all of her children go to school. She doesn’t financially support additional family members. 

Josephine has a business selling used clothes, and she has been in this business for three years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. This business is her only income-generating activity.   

Josephine sells the used clothes door-to-door seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and the ever-increasing prices of used clothes. She aspires to establish a permanent business premises and to become a wholesaler. She also aspires to build her own house.  She resides in a rented house ,and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees, rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a hard working and determined man. He will use this loan to pay tuition for his two sons, one at university and the other at a technical institution. 

The previous loans helped him pay for tuition for his children through secondary school up to this level. He is so thankful to UGAFODE for supporting him in changing the status of his family by having educated children. He also thanks Kiva lenders for partnering with him.

loans.use: to pay tuition for his two sons.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia is 38 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest free-port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is married with three children between the ages of 4 months and 15 years old. They attend school and live at home. 

She has been selling rice, oil, onions, peanuts, and others items for the past two years. She started this business with money given to her by her husband, and she learned this business from her husband. Her favorite part about her business is that it gives her more profit. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, onions, peanuts, and others items for her business.

In the near future, she wants to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, onions, peanuts, and others items for her business.

loans.name: Maria Raquel

texts.es:
María, solicita un nuevo préstamo para estar preparado para la temporada de invierno para así comprar insumos agrícolas   y mejorar la vivienda. Este le permitirá adquirir abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, plaguicidas, semilla, preparar la tierra, entre otros gastos. 
El crédito anterior le permitió cultivar las manzanas de tierra que deseaba y logro cancelar el alquiler del terreno. Las circunstancias familiares se mantienen, los ingresos han mejorado; su deseo es seguir trabajando en el cultivo para mejorar la vivienda, sacar a sus hijos adelante y después  poseer otro tipo de negocio.
texts.en:
María is requesting a new loan in order to prepare for the winter season by purchasing agricultural supplies and improving her house.  This will allow her to get manure, herbicides, insecticides, pesticides, and seeds.  It will allow her to prepare the land and pay for other expenses.

The previous loan allowed her to cultivate the land that she wanted to, and she managed to pay the rent for the land.  Her family circumstances have remained constant, and the income has improved.

Her wish is to continue working with the crops in order to improve her home, to get her children ahead, and to later have another type of business.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and to improve her house.

loans.name: Alvaro

texts.es:
Alvaro, solicita un nuevo préstamo porque necesita invertir en la producción de granos básicos. Este le permitirá comprar abono y semilla de maíz.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a aumentar la producción, incrementaron los ingresos, estos los invirtió en los gastos del hogar. Las circunstancias familiares han mejorado, asimismo las condiciones económicas.
texts.en:
Alvaro is requesting a new loan because he needs to invest in his production of basic grains. He will be able to buy compost and corn seeds.

His previous loan helped with increasing his production and his earnings. The profits were invested in his household expenses. His family’s circumstances have improved, as well as their financial condition.

loans.use: to buy compost and corn seeds.

loans.name: Dora Alicia

texts.es: Doña Dora se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 20 años siembra frijol y maiz ella comercializa sus cultivos en los mercados de su lugar de residencia y con las ventas que realiza logra solventar los gastos que tiene en su hogar, es una mujer responsable, honesta y trabajadora vive con su esposo y sus 5 hijos. Ella esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar insumos para su cosecha ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para cubrir esos gastos y asi tener mejores ingresos y tener un mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
Dora has been farming fro 20 years. She plants beans and corn to sell in local markets. Her sales cover the household expenses. She is responsible, honest, and hardworking. She lives with her husband and five children.

She has applied for a loan to buy supplies for the harvest because her earnings will not cover these expenses. She will then have more income and greater financial stability.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies (seed, fertilizer, etc)

loans.name: Sitha's Group

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in the Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district, Sitha is 23 years old and married with two children who are still small. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice and growing cassava. They have engaged in this business for three years, and together they can earn about KHR 18,000 per day from the current business and can save about KHR 7,000 each day for future needs. 

This is the second loan for Sitha with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, while the other member is just with VisionFund this cycle. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Sitha wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor to plow the field. She hopes to earn more income from her current business so as to extend her farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Paula

texts.en:
This is Paula. She previously received an 11,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 11,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Paula hopes that her business will be bigger and more profitable. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is household consumables.

For the past one year, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en: Josphat is grateful and happy about the progress his business is witnessing. He invested the previous loan fully and was able to raise an income sufficient to complete the loan repayment and meet other family needs. He is now applying for a loan of 31,450 Kenyan shillings to buy a video camera, films and picture frames. He is also getting some income from part-time employment in a tailoring business and working as a mason too. He looks forward to raising more money to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy a video camera.

loans.name: Aydee

texts.es: La Sra. Aydee tiene 49 años y tiene  tres hijos que tienen las  edades de 15, 13 y 9 años, que se encuentra en edad escolar, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de variedad de repostería en panadería, ella tiene su tienda  que se encuentra en la zona de Santiago de la ciudad de El Alto,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Aydee va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de insumos como harina azúcar y levadura para la elaboración de galletas, empanadas y tortas,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital de trabajo, La Sra. Aydee enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia que existe en la zona como también la  de mejorar su calidad de vida y  va a utilizar los beneficios para incrementar su producción, se siente feliz por esta oportunidad que le b rindan en la otorgación del crédito ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse.
texts.en:
Aydee is 49-years-old and has three children that are 15, 13, and 9 years old. Her children are of school age. Aydee works in the creation and sale of a variety of pastries in a bakery.  She has her store in the zone of Santiago in the city of El Alto. 

This loan is her first with this institution. Aydee will use this loan to purchase supplies such as flour, sugar, and yeast to make cookies empanadas, and cakes. The reason she is requesting this loan is because she is lacking capital for her work. Aydee encounters obstacles such as competition in her neighborhood and the desire to improve her quality of life. She will use her profits to increase her production. She is happy for the opportunity that is provided to her with the loan since it is the only way she can support herself.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to create pastries

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es: Doña Juana es una mujer muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarles lo mejor a su hijo y su familia. Actualmente vive junto a su esposo, su hijo y un nieto, es muy trabajadora, siempre lo ha realizado con alegría y entusiasmo, se dedica a ser agricultora siembra todos loa años los principales granos básicos de la zona como lo son, maíz y frijol desde hace 30 años. Juana desea incrementar sus ventas por eso solicita un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así ella seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Juana is very responsible when it comes to her household commitments. She has always tried to offer her son and family the best. She lives with her husband, son, and grandson. She happily and eagerly works hard. Each of the past 30 years, she has planted basic local grain crops like corn and beans.
 
Juana wants to increase sales and has applied for a loan to buy seed, manure, fertilizer, pesticide, and more. She hopes to obtain this loan because she does not have any other cash income. This way, she will continue to support her household without a problem.

loans.use: to buy planting supplies.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: Daniel de 50 años de edad es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarle lo mejor a su hijo. vive en casa propia con su hijo de 17 años, Don Daniel se dedica a ser agricultor siembra maíz y frijol desde hace 20 años, el desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso a solicitado un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, entre otras cosas, para seguir llevando el pan de cada dia a su hogar.
texts.en: Daniel, 50, is a man who very responsible with his household obligations, because he has always been known for providing the best for his son.  He lives in his own home with his 17 year-old son.   Daniel is a farmer who has been cultivating corn and beans for 20 years.  He wants to increase his sales, and so to do this he is requesting a loan that will allow him to buy seeds, fertilizers, and other supplies.  This way, he can continue to bring daily sustenance to his household.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies: seeds, organic and chemical fertilizers, etc.

loans.name: Fidelina

texts.es: Doña Fidelina de 49 años de edad es madre soltera vive con sus 2 hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de aluminio como ollas, vasos, tenedores, sartenes entre otras cosas, también vende producto de limpieza, tiene 14 años con el negocio y ha adquirido mucha experiencia en la venta que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, ella vende en una zona muy transitada por las personas,tiene mucha clientela por la calidad del producto que comercializa es una mujer muy trabajadora quiere realizar una nueva inversión por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar productos de aluminio y productos de limpieza, para poder seguirle dando lo mejor a sus hijos y solventar los gastos que se le presentan.
texts.en: Fidelina, 49, is a single mother who lives with her 2 children.  She has a business selling aluminum products such as: pots, cups, forks, frying pans, and other items.  She also sells cleaning products.  She's had this business for 14 years, over which time she has acquired a lot of sales experience which enables her to obtain the best earnings.  She sells in a neighborhood where there are many passers-by, and she has a lot of customers because of the quality products that she sells.   Fidelina is a very hardworking woman who wants to make a new investment in her business.  This is why she is requesting a loan to buy aluminum products and cleaning products.  This way, she will be able to continue to give the best to her children and cover her expenses.

loans.use: to buy aluminum products such as pots and pans

loans.name: Carlos Alfredo

texts.es: Don Carlos de 47 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 20 años siembra maiz y maicillo con las ventas que realiza de sus cosechas logra solventar los gastos que tiene en su hogar, es un hombre responsable, honesto y trabajador vive con su esposa quien vende verdura en el mercado cerca de su lugar de residencia y sus 4 hijos quienes estudian actualmente. El esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar insumos para su cosecha y poder pager el alquiler de la parcela donde siembra sus cultivos ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para cubrir esos gastos y asi tener mejores ingresos y tener un mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
Carlos, 47, has been farming for 20 years. He plants corn and sorghum, and sales from the harvest cover his household expenses. He is responsible, honest, and hardworking. He lives with his wife, who sells vegetables in a nearby market. His four children are students.

He has applied for a loan to buy supplies for the harvest and to pay the rent on the land he plants. His earnings do not cover these expenses, and this way he will have more income and greater financial stability.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and to rent land.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is single and lives with her mother. Charity is a young entrepreneur who started working at a very young age with her mother in a small cafeteria they have nearby. Since she is the oldest sister, she had to help with the upkeep of the house along with her mother. With a lot of effort, she studied hairdressing and manicure and received the best grades. She performs her services in-home, offering her customers comfort and professionalism at a good price. She reports that it is going well with her established clientele because they are all very busy people who don't have time to wait for hours in beauty salons.

She is requesting a loan, which she wants to invest in buying a professional hair dryer and a hair straightener, which will help her a lot in her work. She very much appreciates the assistance that she is receiving, since it will be a great help.

loans.use: to buy a professional hair dryer and a hair straightener.

loans.name: Priscille's Group

texts.en:
“Mugambimwiza” is a word meaning “good plan” in English. Led by Donatha, the group sells different items and they are very dedicated members because all of them see and have a hope for better future business.  

Donatha is 23 years old. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for five years. She has requested a loan to buy more rice and cassava for sale. She is planning to use the profits for providing food for the family and making more savings. 

In the picture, Donatha is putting up her hand so that she becomes identifiable from other group members as the group leader.

loans.use: to buy more rice and cassava to sell.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy was born in 1978. She has two daughters and a son. They are really young – age 5, 3 and really little. Her husband is a worker. His income is about 6,000,000 dong (VND). Thuy does carpentry to earn a living. Her income is about 5,000,000 VND. Her family’s total earnings are about 11,000,000 VND per month.

Thuy has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2009. In the last cycle she borrowed 8,288,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,080,000 VND to buy wood for her carpentry workshop. She always wants to enlarge her workshop and raise her children up well.

loans.use: to buy wood for her carpentry workshop.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for her sewing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make some repairs to her salon: finish the walls and waterproof the roof

loans.name: Maria Josefina

texts.es: María, solicita un nuevo préstamo para seguir invirtiendo en el negocio de flores artificiales. Este le permitirá comprar flores, listones, pega, entre otros productos, con esto obtener ingresos para brindarle ayuda a su familia y asimismo adquirir cinco quintales de maíz para el sustento diario, ya que con el crédito anterior no logro adquirir utilidades y por ello no han cambiado las condiciones económicas ni las circunstancias familiares.
texts.en: María has applied for a new loan to continue investing in her artificial flower business. She will buy flowers, slats, glue, and other items so that she can earn income to support her family. She will also buy five sacks of corn to make food, since she was unable to generate profits or improve her family's financial situation and circumstances with the prior loan.

loans.use: to buy flowers, slats, glue, and other items.

loans.name: Jeimy Cristina

texts.es: En este momento vive junto a su familia padres, y hermanos los cuales se apoyan mutuamente para confrontar cualquier problema hace  1 año se graduó de bachiller y está dispuesta a estudiar para salir adelante por su hijo y su futuro. Su hijo ya va a cumplir 2 años y quiere poder cumplir todos sus sueños, al igual que con su familia. Ella inicia su programa de enfermería como ayuda en su futuro de carrera profesional, logrando así abrir muchas puertas en diferentes compañías y empresas de la salud.  Esta carrera de enfermería me agrada ya que es la manera de ayudar y colaborar a mucha gente que puede necesitar de ella, brindando apoyo en momentos de dificultades, con los pacientes y familiares.
texts.en:
At the moment, the borrower is living with her family, which includes her parents and siblings. They support one another whenever they confront any problem. She graduated from high school last year and is willing to study so that she can help her child move forward and provide for their future. Her child will turn two years old and she wants to fulfill all of their dreams, as well as those of her family.

The borrower started the nursing program because a professional degree will be helpful in the future. This will open doors to different companies and businesses in the health care field. She is grateful to have the chance to pursue a nursing degree because it will enable her to help and work with many people who need her. She will be able to provide support to patients and their family members during difficult moments.

loans.use: to finish her nursing degree program.

loans.name: Nhoeb's Group

texts.en: A 47 year old mother of three schoolchildren, Nhoeb is an inhabitant from Takeo province’s Samrong district. She deals with the financial burden of the family's daily food consumption via weaving silk and farming rice, which is the business that she has been with for 30 years. She earns about 18,500 KHR per day. Nhoeb is not a first time borrower with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner). She has improved her lifestyle effectively from past loans which she has completely repaid back. Now, in the group of three, she is the leader. The total requesting loan amount is 2,400,000 KHR, of which 700,000 KHR is Nhoeb's loan portion. For Nhoeb, she will use her loan portion to build a proper latrine for her household. She highly hopes that she can maintain a good health practice for her family, especially her kids.

loans.use: To build a proper latrine.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a married woman with seven children, and she lives in Kisauni. She has a fish business. She has been buying and selling fish for over ten years. She says that with great effort her business is growing, and she is equipping it little by little. She hopes to be able to have a great place of business. That way she will be able to also have better conditions for her customers.

She requested the loan to buy a freezer and a cooler. They will be extremely useful in transporting and conserving her product. She always wants to be able to give her customers fresh good quality products.

loans.use: to buy a freezer and a cooler.

loans.name: Severina

texts.en: Severina is a 52 year old married woman from Ubay, Bohol. She has four children. The oldest child is 22 while the youngest is 17. She owns and operates a retail store in her community. She sells commodities like canned goods, noodles, condiments, soaps, beverages and soft drinks. She has been operating a retail store business for almost three years. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy more merchandise to sell like eggs, cooking oil, sugar, coffee and toiletries. Severina hopes that she will be successful in her business and will be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell eggs, cooking oil, sugar, coffee and toiletries.

loans.name: Harrison

texts.en: Harrison is grateful for the great financial boost he has received through Milango as a first loan. He added it to his savings and purchased a second hand motorcycle. The demand for such a means of transport is still quite high and he is therefore applying for a second loan of 31,450 Kenya shillings to add and purchase a second motor cycle. He intends to save the additional income for future investments.

loans.use: To purchase another motorcycle.

loans.name: Ny's Group

texts.en:
Ny resides in Takeo Province, where silk weaving is the most popular business. She is 59 years old, married, and blessed with two children. She does silk weaving as her main source of income and rice farming for supplementary income. She has been involved in silk weaving for 30 years, earning about 8,000 Cambodian riels (KHR).

Ny has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before.  She now leads a group of three to apply for a latrine-construction loan. Ny will spend her entire portion, 600,000 KHR--the same amount as her co-borrowers--to build a decent latrine for her family. She hopes to have a proper latrine for her kids to prevent illness related to lack of hygienic practices.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Yan's Group

texts.en:
Yan, an inhabitant of Kror Kor district in Pursat Province, is 47 years old and a widow. To tackle the family’s hardship, she grows rice and sells Khmer noodles. Having been in this business for ages, she is able to earn up to 13,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) per day. Yan is a two-cycle client of VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has completely repaid her past loan, which helped her to set aside some money to start up a new business.

The total amount of the group's loan is 3,100,000 KHR.  As the group leader, Yan will use her portion to buy more ingredients including flour and rice for her Khmer noodle-selling business. She strongly believes that she can make more income and maintain her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy ingredients including flour and rice for her Khmer noodle-selling business

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is from Kisauni and operates a small hair salon. She wants to remodel her salon in order to offer her clients a more comfortable environment and generate more income to help support her family. She is requesting this loan to help grow her business.

Mariam is a very hardworking person with a persistent spirit and attitude. She has a lot of experience in her field and knows what she is doing. Her goal is to have a large beauty salon one day and to be widely known for her talent. She is grateful for this opportunity and believes that the support will be a great help to her.

loans.use: to remodel her beauty salon.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy was born in 1955. She has an adult son and daughter. Her husband is a carpenter. His income is 5,000,000 VND. Thuy also does carpentry to earn a living. She makes 4,000,000 VND a month from her job. Her family’s total earnings are about 30,000,000 VND per month.
She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2009. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 8,288,000 VND and repaid on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,080,000 VND to buy wood for her carpentry workshop. She has always wanted to save more money for her family.

loans.use: to buy wood for her carpentry workshop.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is 26 years old; she and her fiancé live in Congo Town in Montserrado County, which has the largest Freeport and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. Her fiancé is a security personnel and they have three children between the ages of 4 and 10 years old. Only two of her children attend school and they all live at home. 

Since 2010, Marie has been selling biscuits, candy, bread, etc. to her community. Sometimes she has less customers, but most of the time she makes a lot of money. She is requesting a loan to purchase more biscuits, candy, bread, etc. for her business. In the future she plans to send her children to school until they finish college.

loans.use: to purchase more biscuits, candy, bread, etc. for her business

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is from Kisauni. She has her own house and lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

She's a very hardworking, responsible, and honest woman. She started working in a retail shop as a shop attendant. Her dream has always been to have her own business and work independently to generate more income to improve her family's quality of life.

As time went by she began to sell household consumables in her own store and throughout the area. She acquired a lot of customers, expanded her store, started a well-stocked grocery store, and expanded her clientele and daily sales.

Halima is requesting this loan to be able to stock her store with necessity items such as noodles, rice, vegetables, meat, and other supplies, because this will help her continue with her sales.

loans.use: to stock her store with necessity items, such as noodles, rice, vegetables, meat, and other supplies

loans.name: Johnbull's Group

texts.en:
These are the members of a secondary school in Koidu. They want a loan of 6,600,000 SLL to help them meet their immediate needs. Some of the members want the loan in order to invest in business, some to pay their childrens' school fees, others to pay for school-related charges, and others would like to invest the loan in a house building project.

Yillah is a teacher at the school and is also the featured leader of this group. Yillah wants this loan in order to pay the school fees for his children. Yillah is a 55-year-old man, born in Tombodu, Eastern Sierra Leone. He is married to a teacher and they have four children who are attending secondary school. Yillah has been a professional teacher for 28 years now.

loans.use: to pay the school fees for his children

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 34 years old and lives in Congo Town in Montserrado County, which has the largest Freeport and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. 

She is married and her husband is a businessman. They have three children between seven to twenty years old, all of whom live at home and attend school. For the past four years, Veronica has been selling palm oil and she started this business with money given to her by her husband. The business helps her save more money. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil for her business. Her future plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy sanitary items for selling

loans.name: Sang's Group

texts.en:
Sang, age 53 and married, is a silk weaver living in Takeo Province. Besides her handicraft business, she also helps her husband  to grow rice on two hectares during her spare time. Her current business earns her about 17,600 riels (KHR) per day. 

This is the fourth cycle for Sang with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). From the past loan, which she has fully paid back, she feels so empowered to relieve her family's hardships and strengthen both her businesses in a gradual manner. Now she has formed a group of two to apply for a new loan. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to build a decent latrine for her household. She hopes to own a proper latrine to improve sanitation practice for her family.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine

loans.name: Jane Francis

texts.en:
Jane Francis is 50 years old and lives in the town of Buwama, Uganda. She has eight children, whose ages range from 11 to 32, as well as four grandchildren. Jane Francis is a widow and three of her children still live at home under her care. 

In addition to being a Solar Sister entrepreneur, Jane Francis works as a farmer to earn a living. She raises pigs and cows and grows maize, cassava, beans, bananas, and sweet potatoes. Solar Sisters are female entrepreneurs who sell solar-powered lanterns and phone charging to their communities. With this Kiva loan, Jane Francis will purchase more solar inventory that she will then resell to her community. 

Jane Francis loves being a Solar Sister because it helps her earn additional income to supplement her children's school fees. Her biggest motivations in selling solar lanterns are her own personal development and earning extra income. Jane Francis's biggest dream for the future is to build another home for her family.

loans.use: to purchase solar-powered lanterns to sell in her community

loans.name: Maria Jose Lina

texts.es: Doña Maria tiene 49 años de edad, casada, tiene 4 hijos y vive en Santa Cruz de Yojoa.  Hace 10 año que doña Maria ha puesto su propio negocio de venta de mercadería, vende ropa, zapatos, sandalias,etc. Este negocio lo tiene en su casa y tambien hace sus ventas de manera ambulante ya tiene sus clientes fijos y le va muy bien con las ventas.Ella es cliente consecutiva de Odef.  Con el préstamo que solicita por 10,500 lempiras va comprar mercadería como sandalias, y ropa nueva para surtir el negocio, ya que teniendo su inventario con variedad de productos va incrementar las ventas. Su plan es que el negocio crezca y se mantenga activo porque es una fuente de ingresos de la familia.
texts.en:
Doña Maria is 49 years old, married, and has four children. She lives in Santa Cruz de Yojoa. For the past 10 years, Doña Maria has managed her own business of selling merchandise such as clothing, shoes, sandals, and other items. The business is in her home, but she also conducts sales as a traveling vendor. She has established customers and is doing very well with her sales.

Maria is a repeat client of ODEF. She is requesting a loan of 10,500 HNL so that she can buy merchandise, such as sandals and new clothing to restock her business. Having a variety of products in her inventory will increase her sales. Her plan is to grow her business and keep it active because it is the source of income for her family.

loans.use: to buy new clothing and sandals.

loans.name: Andrea Del Pilar

texts.es:
Su nombre es Andrea del Pilar. Es hija de una pareja emprendedora, feliz y con mucha fe en Dios. Andrea  es la segunda hija de este feliz matrimonio tuvo una infancia feliz y destaco en el colegio.
Esta pareja lleva 24 años juntos, eso ha demostrado que el amor lo puede todo, ella a sus dieciocho años valora mucho a sus padres, el esfuerzo y la moral que le han inculcado, a demás del buen ejemplo.

Hace dos años termino su bachillerato, se graduó con honores y cree que fue una muy buena experiencia, tiene recuerdos muy gratos de cada una de sus amigas, es una persona que ha dejado huella en la vida de muchas personas, ya que su carisma y don de gentes ha generado una empatía frente a sus docentes.
Después de terminar el colegio no tenían los recursos para la universidad, pero su mama con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación logro brindarle unos niveles de ingles los cuales ella desarrollo con éxito.     
Después de ello tomo la decisión de empezar a trabajar por temporadas decembrinas, le fue muy bien pero por cuestiones que no cabe mencionar se quedo sin empleo, pero por apoyo de su familia decide iniciar su vida estudiantes nuevamente. Al ver la situación que se encuentra pasando, ya que su papa hace 19 años desarrollo la enfermedad de la diabetes la cual ha creado degeneramiento en su organismo y debido a eso perdió la vista, con esto desarrollo también daños en sus riñones provocando un habito de diálisis cada tres días, desde entonces su mama se hizo cargo de la casa, ella de ahí en adelante se convierte en la fuente de ingresos de su familia. 
Andrea anhela terminar todos sus estudios, es consciente que los va a realizar con la ayuda de Dios, sabe que a largo plazo desarrollara su sueño de ser odontóloga, pero por ahora va a realizarse como Técnica en Cocina en la institución. 
Sueña con preparar algo delicioso y especial para alguien famoso o alguien muy especial para ella.
Espera tomar las clases y terminaras para poder aprender y salir adelante y  ser un apoyo para su familia.
texts.en:
Her name is Andrea del Pilar. She is the daughter of an entrepreneurial couple, she is happy, and with much faith in God. Andrea is the second daughter from this happy marriage. She had a happy childhood and did very well in high school. This couple has been together for 24 years, and this has shown that love will always triumph. At 18 years old, she values her parents very much, and also the hard work and morals they have taught her, and also the good example they have provided. 

Two years ago she finished her high school degree. She graduated with honors and it was a very good experience. She has wonderful memories of each of her friends. She has left her mark on the lives of many people. Her charisma and the fact she is a good person have made an impression on her teachers. 

After finishing high school, she didn’t have the resources to attend university. However, her mother, through a lot of hard work and dedication, was able to provide her with a few English classes, which she was very successful in. After that, she made the decision to start working during the December holidays. Things went very well for her, but for reasons that are not relevant here, she became unemployed. With the support of her family, she has decided to become a student again. She took a look at the situation in which she finds herself. Nineteen years ago, her father developed diabetes, which has caused degeneration of his body, and because of this he lost his sight. He has also developed damage to his kidneys, such that he has to go for dialysis every three days. From that time, her mother took charge of the household and became the source of income for the family. 

Andrea wants very much to finish her studies. She is aware that she will be able to do this, with God’s help. She is sure that over the long run, she will achieve her goal of becoming an orthodontist, but for now she will study Cooking Teqnique in the institution. 

She dreams of preparing something delicious and special for someone famous or someone that is very special for her. She hopes to take the classes and finish them so she can get ahead and help support her family.

loans.use: to finish her studies in Cooking.

loans.name: Silvia Yanira

texts.es:
Silvia,  solicita un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de invertir en la producción de granos básicos. Este le ayudara para comprar abono, insecticidas, herbicidas, plaguicidas y pago de mano de obra para realizar la siembra de maíz y frijol.
El crédito anterior le permitió aumentar los ingresos, incrementar la producción del cultivo; las utilidades que obtiene las utiliza para los gastos del hogar para así sacar adelante a su familia.   Las condiciones económicas crecieron gracias a la inversión que llevo a cabo con el crédito otorgado de Kiva.
texts.en:
Silvia is requesting a new loan because she needs to invest in the production of basic staples. This will help her buy compost, insecticides, herbicides, pesticides, as well as pay for labor in order to plant corn and beans.

Her previous loan enabled her to increase her earnings and expand the production of her crops. The profits she earned were used for the household expenses, which allowed her family to get ahead. Her financial condition improved thanks to the investment of the loan granted by Kiva.

loans.use: to buy compost, insecticides, herbicides, pesticides, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Jura

texts.ru: Джура добросовестный и честный человек. Всю свою жизнь он прожил в своей родине, на юге солнечного Таджикистана. Он с детства помогал родителям по скотоводству и поэтому имеет большой опыт. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 9 детей. Более 20 лет он занимается скотоводством. Он имеет большое домохозяйство, так как обеспечение 9 детей требует много благ. Он самый честный и трудолюбивый бизнесмен на местном рынке. Он продает свой скот мясникам и другим людям. Благодаря, упорному труду он имеет своих постоянных клиентов. Джура планирует развивать бизнес дальше и поэтому он обратился за займом для покупки скота. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 1100 долларов США. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Jura is a conscientious and honest person. He has lived his whole life in the place of his birth: the south of sunny Tajikistan. He helped his parents raise animals since childhood, so he has extensive experience. He is married and is raising 9 children. He has been raising livestock for over 20 years. He has a large homestead, since raising 9 children requires a lot of resources. He is the most honest and hardworking business man at the local market. He sells his animals to butchers and others. Thanks to his tireless work he has his own loyal customers. Jura is planning to further develop his business, so he is asking for a loan in order to buy animals. He is asking for a 1100 USD loan. He appreciates your kindness.

loans.use: Buy cattle to increase his working capital

loans.name: Nigina

texts.ru: Нигина трудолюбивая и умная женщина. Ей 29 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 1 ребенка. Ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации и отправляет деньги. Нигина тоже сама зарабатывает, так как более 6 лет она занимается услугой портнихи. Она шьет у себя дома женские, детские национальные платья. Также она шьет занавески по заказу для домов и офисов. Она старается удовлетворить своих клиентов высококачественной пошивом одежды и занавески. Отправленные деньги мужа не хватает для обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами и поэтому она должна расширить свой бизнес и получать больше дохода. Она нуждается в новой швейной машинки, а также ткани для шитья больше национальных платьев. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки швейной машинки и ткани. Она обещает, как честный человек погасить займ во время. Нигина ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Nigina is a hard working and intelligent woman. She is 29 years old, married, and has a child. Her husband is a migrant worker in Russia who sends money home. Nigina also works, as she has been a dressmaker for over six years. She works out of her home, sewing traditional dresses for women and children. She also sews curtains to order for houses and offices. She tries to please her clients with high quality tailoring of the clothes and curtains she makes. The money her husband sends is not enough to provide the family with everything it needs, so Nigina needs to expand her business and earn a higher income. She needs a new sewing machine, and also fabric for making more of the traditional dresses. She is asking for a 5000 TJS loan to buy a sewing machine and fabric. She promises that as an honest person, she will repay the loan on time. She appreciates your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and fabric for sewing traditional dresses

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is married and has no children. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past six months, he has operated a poultry selling business. He sells to his neighbors and passersby. His major challenge is the high cost of transportation to his place of operation.

With the KSHS 15,000, he wants to purchase chicks and chicken feed. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business and improve his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Abla

texts.en: Abla is 48 years old and lives in Montserrado County This county has the largest free port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is married with three children between 20 to 29 years old, only one of whom is in school and living at home.  For the past three years, she has been selling charcoal. She started this business with money that she landed from her mother. Her favorite part about her business is that she makes more profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. In the near future, she wants to build her house and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Ortikjon

texts.ru: Ортикчон трудолюбивая и добросовестная женщина. Семья у нее дружная, поэтому все проблемы, которые возникают в семье, легко решаются. Ортикчон замужем и имеет 4 детей. Муж Ортикчона учитель и работает в средней школе села. Дети взрослые и имеют своих дел, то есть они помогают Ортикчон введение бизнеса. Самый младший сын учится в университете. Ортикчон и ее дети более 10 лет занимаются скотоводством и выращиванием сельхоз культуры, как кукуруз, хлопок и другие зерновые культуры. Несколько лет назад 2 ее сыновей женились и после свадьбы они остались без скота, так как они продали всех для проведения свадебного торжества. Было очень трудно жить без молока, кефира и масло. Но дружная семья справилась с трудностью с помощи кредита. В этом году они купили еще 2 га земли. Теперь они имеют 6 га земли. Ортикчон и ее дети хотят сделать посев на 6 га земли. Ортикчон запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки семена и минерального удобрения. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Ortikjon is a hardworking and conscientious woman. Her family is amicable so all the problems that come up in the family are easy to solve. Ortikjon is married and has four children. Her husband is a teacher at the town's middle school. Her children are grown, have their own work and help Ortikjon run the business. The youngest son teaches at the university. Ortikjon and her children have been raising animals and raising crops such as corn, barley, and other grains, for over 10 years. A few years ago two of her sons married, and after the weddings they were left without animals since they sold everything to pay for the wedding festivities. It was very hard to live without milk, kefir, and butter. But the family addressed the hardship with the help of a loan. This year they bought two more hectares of land, and now own a total of six hectares. Ortikjon and her children want to plant on all six hectares. She is asking for a 5000 TJS loan for the purchase of seeds and fertilizer. She appreciates your kindness.

loans.use: buy seeds and fertilizer for growing crops

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru: Зулфия добрая и трудолюбивая женщина. Ей 45 лет. Она замужем, но не имеет детей. Ее муж бизнес мен, а сама Зулфия работает учительницей в средней школе. Она преподает младшим классам. Зулфия очень хороший педагог и знает свое дело на отлично. Зулфия дополнительно занимается услугой портнихи. Она очень упорно трудится и старается, чтобы ее клиентки были довольные. Уже несколько лет, как Зулфия и ее муж начали стройку нового дома, так как их дом очень старый и не имеет нормального условия. В этом году они хотят сделать крышу, но не имеют денег. Зулфия запрашивает займ на сумму 10000 сомони для покупки шифера и древесина. Она ждет вашу доброту. Этот займ поможет Зулфие достроить дом и таким образом улучшить условию проживания.
texts.en: Zulfiya is a good and hardworking woman. She is 45 years old, married, and does not have children. Her husband is a businessman, and Zulfiya herself teaches the youngest grade at a middle school. Zulfiya is a very good teacher and is skilled at her work. She is also a dressmaker. She works tirelessly and always seeks her clients' satisfaction. A few years ago Zulfiya and her husband began building a new house since their home is very old and does not meet standard conditions. This year they want to do the roof, but don't have enough money. Zulfiya is asking for a loan of 10000 TJS to buy slate and wood. She appreciates your kindness. This loan will help Zulfiya finish the house and in doing so, improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy slate and wood for making roof of new house

loans.name: Turdy

texts.ru: Турди прекрасная женщина, любимая мать 4 детей и мудрая бабушка 12 внуков. Она замужем за хорошего человека, который работает в цементном заводе. Турди более 19 лет работает в  государственной организации бухгалтером. Она профессионал своего дела. Дети Турди взрослые. Двое его сыновей находятся в России. Они работают разнорабочими. Турди хочет помочь внуку, так как ее внук имеет маленький доход и не может сыграть своего свадебного торжества. Сын Турди не отправляет нормальные деньги, чтобы они сыграли его свадьбу. Турди запрашивает займ на сумму 4500 сомони для проведения свадебного торжества любимого внука. Турди и ее внук ждут вашу доброту.
texts.en: Turdy is a wonderful woman: the loving mother of four children and wise grandmother of 12 grandchildren. She is married to a good man who works in a cement factory. Turdy has worked as an accountant for a government agency for over 19 years. She is a professional in her field. Turdy's children are grown. Two of her sons are in Russia, where they are unskilled laborers. Turdy wants to help one of her grandchildren, who has a low income and cannot afford his wedding celebration. Turdy's son is not sending enough money to fund the wedding. Turdy is asking for a 4500 TJS loan to pay for the wedding of her beloved grandson. Turdy and her grandson appreciate your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for the wedding festivities for her beloved grandchild

loans.name: Reuben

texts.en:
Reuben is a married man who has not been blessed with children. He lives in a house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and rental bills.

Reuben has been operating a charcoal selling business, selling from home to his neighbors and villagers. His greatest monthly challenge is the high cost of transportation. With a loan of KSHS 25,000, he wants to purchase charcoal for resale.  He dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale

loans.name: Alfreda

texts.en: Alfreda is 29 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest free port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is single with two children who are 3 and 10 years old. They attend school and live at home. She has been selling palm oil for the past three years. She says that her main challenge is the transportation cost. She started this business with money given to her by her father and she learned this business from her friends. Her favorite part about her business is that it gives her money and what make her proud is that it enables her to take care of her children. She is requesting this loan to purchase more palm oil to enlarge her business. She plans to build a house for children in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil to sell

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a business lady living in Malindi, Kenya. She is a widowed mother of three school-going children. She runs a mobile money transfer system, which has a great customer base in the country.

She was introduced to Milango by her friends and is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to add till money through the increased float. She believes the family will enjoy an improved health status and education from the increased income.

loans.use: To add to the money on hand needed to process money transfers

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista is 40 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is widowed and has five children who are all currently in school. For the past five years, Teopista has been working hard to manage her small business selling clothes.

To help expand her business, Teopista has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes to sell and will help Teopista to generate greater profits and improve her family's standard of living. Teopista hopes that in the future, she will be able to start up a wholesale shop. 

Teopista is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Teopista who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.


"

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abbas is from Iraq. He is 46 years old, married, and has 3 children. Abbas and one of his children provide the family income together.

Abbas works hard in his blacksmith’s shop to provide for his children’s school fees. He specializes in making doors, windows, and fences. He has good experience in what he practices. He has been in this field for over 10 years, but in 2011, he established his own business. Thanks to the good variety of his services, Abbas gained an excellent reputation and now he has a hired employee.

Abbas is requesting a loan of 2,400 USD to pay the annual rent of his blacksmith shop. Abbas aims to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his children a good education and a decent life.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his blacksmith shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soap, sugar, salt, and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Josiah

texts.en:
Josiah lives in the Mombasa area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is single and owns a retail shop, a business which he has been running for four years. In this business, he sells retail stock, e.g., rice, sugar, flour, and cooking oil.
 
He learned about Milango through friends who invited him to the group, and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenge is the high cost of products. 

Josiah is applying for a loan of 73,050 Kenyan shillings to buy retail stock like sugar, flour, etc. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to improve his living standard.

loans.use: to buy retail stock like sugar, flour, etc.

loans.name: Malek

texts.en:
Malek is an Iraqi youth client who is 27 years old, married and has a child. 

Malek is a farmer. He works hard to provide his family’s income and his wife takes care of their child. Since his childhood, Malek has been helping his father to milk cows and make dairy products. He gained good experience in this field. In 2008, Malek completely took over his father’s business and started to grow fast. He gained an excellent reputation in the surrounding area thanks to the quality of the products that he offers.

Malek is requesting a youth loan of $2,400 to buy two new cows in order to increase his productions and his profits. Malek aims to grow his business even more so that he will be able to educate his child and take care of his parents as well.

loans.use: to buy two new cows

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is 36 years old, married with two children and living in Kasese, Uganda. For four years now, he has been running an advertising firm and the business has been very lucrative. Like most businessmen, he has challenges of high rental and license fees. His dreams are to have branches in other districts. Robert intends to use the loan to buy office equipment.

loans.use: to buy office equipment

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya. She is a charcoal seller and has been doing this business for four years. Salome is a married mother of two school-going children. She was introduced to Milango by her friends and is asking for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to purchase a new stock of charcoal and packaging bags for sale. She will pay for her children’s school fees from the extra income.
