Despite the challenge of high cost of transportation, Salome believes the business has a future and besides getting the income to educate her children, she looks forward to owning a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a new stock of charcoal and packaging bags to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 46 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest free port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is married with three children between 14 and 25 years old who attend school and live at home. She has been selling rice, oil, onions, peanuts, and butter for the past 10 years. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and she learned this business from her husband. Her favorite part about her business is that it gives her more profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, onions, peanuts, and butter for her business. In the future, she wants to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, onions, peanuts, and butter for her business

loans.name: Abdusattor

texts.ru: Абдусаттор житель города Душанбе - столицы Таджикистана. Ему 29 лет. Он женат и имеет двоих детей. Абдусаттор занимается бизнесом. Он в автоцентре города арендует маслобойню и занимается там производством масел на продажу. Он в этой области уже два года. Его маслобойня предоставляет услуги 24 часа в сутки. У Абдусаттора два рабочих, которые работают там посменно. Абдусаттор берет кредит для закупа сырья для производства масла на продажу. В дальнейшем за счет прибыли Абдусаттор планирует открыть еще одну мааслобойню для производства масел и расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Abdusattor lives in the city of Dushanbe - Tajikistan's capital. He is 29 years old, married, and has two children. Abdusattor is an entrepreneur: he rents a small oil extraction shop in the city centre, where he produces vegetable oils for sale. He has been engaged in this for the past two years. Abdusattor's oil production operates 24 hrs a day with the help of two employees who work in shifts.

Abdusattor is taking this loan to purchase raw ingredients for oil extraction. In the future, he plans to use his profits to open another oil extraction shop, thereby expanding his business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for extraction of vegetable oil

loans.name: Abduqakhor

texts.ru: Абдукахору 53 года. У него жена и трое детей. Он проживает в районе Рудаки. Его жена работает швеей, а один сын находится на заработках в загранице. У Абдукахора среднее техническое образование. Вот уже 20 лет как он работает сварщиком. Он занимается производством железных дверей и решеток. Абдукахор является мастером своего дела, так как у него большой опыт в этой области. Кредит берет для приобретения металлического материала для производства железных дверей и решеток. В будущем Абдукахор планирует открыть свой собственный цех по производству железных дверей и решеток.
texts.en:
Abduqakhor is 53 years old. He lives with his wife and three children in the Rudaki region. Abduqakhor's wife works as a seamstress, while one of his sons is working abroad. Abduqakhor has vocational secondary education. For the past 20 years, he has been working as a welder, manufacturing iron gates and fences. Thanks to his extensive experience, Abduqakhor is a master of his craft. 

Abduqakhor is taking this loan to purchase metal stock for making gates and fences. In the future, he plans to open his own workshop for manufacturing such products.

loans.use: to purchase stock material for making iron gates and fences

loans.name: Eshonqul

texts.ru: Эшонкул житель района Шахритус, расположенный в юго-западной части Хатлонской области Таджикистана. Ему 50 лет. Он женат и отец двух сыновей и троих дочерей. Его сыновья уехали на заработки в Россию. Он живет с женой, тремя дочерьми, невесткой и внуками. Эшонкул уже три года занимается животноводством, а именно купле-продажей крупнорогатого скота. Он закупает коров и телят со скотного рынка района Шахритус, откармливает их в течение 30-35 дней и затем перепродает с наценкой. Кредит берет для купли и продажи крупнорогатого скота с целью расширения бизнеса.
texts.en:
Eshonqul lives in the Shahrituz region, which is located in the south-western part of the Khalton province of Tajikistan. He is 50 years old, married, and is a father of two sons and three daughters. Eshonqul's sons have left to find work in Russia, and he currently lives with his wife, three daughters, a daughter-in-law, and grandchildren.

Eshonqul has been an animal farmer for the past three years, buying and reselling cattle. He purchases cows and calves at the Shahrituz regional livestock market, fattens them for 30-35 days, and then resells them with a markup. Eshonqul is taking this loan to purchase additional cattle in order to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle for fattening and resale

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has three children. He owns a retail shop, a business which he has been running for six years. In this business, he sells retail stock such as rice, sugar, flour, cooking oil, etc. 

He learned about Milango through friends who invited him to the group and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenge is the high cost of products. 

Patrick is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to buy retail stock such as rice, sugar, flour, cooking oil, etc. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To buy retail stock such as rice, sugar, flour, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 22-year-old Iraqi youth client, who is married and has a child. Ahmad is the only provider in his family.

Ahmad is a grocer. He sells canned foods, juices, soft drinks, dairy products, detergents, shampoos and tissue paper. He established his business in 2011. He has gained good experience in this field and is well-known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Ahmad is requesting a youth loan of 2,400 USD to pay the annual rent of his grocery store. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to educate his child and pay his school fees.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his grocery store.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth lives in the Likoni area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is a single mother of two children, both of whom are in school. 

She owns a retail shop and sells foodstuffs, household goods etc.

She learnt about Milango through friends who invited her to the group and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. 

Her main challenge is price instability. 

Ruth is applying for a loan of 107,250 Kenyan shillings to buy retail stock, e.g. maize, beans, rice and cooking fat. 

The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve the living standards of her family and pay school fees for her children. She aspires to open a mini wholesale business.

loans.use: To buy retail stock, e.g. maize, beans, rice and cooking fat.

loans.name: Kazungu

texts.en:
Kazungu is a married man with three children, all of whom attend school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past two years, he has operated a charcoal selling business, selling as retail to his neighbours and passersby. He faces the major challenge of the high cost of transportation in his business. 

Kazungu dreams of becoming a wholesale supplier of charcoal in the future and with the loan of KES 25,000, he will buy seven sacks of charcoal to boost his business and meet the needs of his customers.

loans.use: to buy seven sacks of charcoal to boost his business

loans.name: Jean Nepo

texts.en: Jean Nepo is a 41-year-old man from Rulindo District in the Northern Province of Rwanda. He is seeking a loan of $50 to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just $0.20. Jean Nepo started selling lights in September 2012, and he has sold 40 lights to date, providing clean energy to 200 people. He is also a shopkeeper and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself, his wife Dative, and their four children.

loans.use: to pay for 10 low cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis lives in the Kongowea area of Coast province, Kenya. He is single businessman and owns a tailoring shop.
He learned about Milango through a friend who invited him to the group, and he joined with an aim of accessing credit to improve on his business operations. His main challenges are finding customers and seasonal clientele.
Francis is applying for a loan of 26,300 Kenya shillings to buy more materials to make clothes and a few ready-made clothes to sell. His extra income will be added to his savings to start a boutique.

loans.use: To buy more materials to make clothes and ready-made clothes for sale.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene lives in the Kongowea area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is a widowed mother of two school children. 

She owns a grocery shop, a business which has been running for five years. In the business, she sells foodstuffs, household goods etc.

She learnt about Milango through friends who invited her to the group and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. 
 
Irene is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenyan shillings to buy grocery stocks, e.g. maize, beans, rice and cooking fat. 

The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve on the living standards of her family and pay school fees for her children. She aspires to open a mini wholesale business.

loans.use: To buy grocery stocks, e.g. maize, beans, rice and cooking fat.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is 55 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. He is married and has eight children. 

For the past 10 years, Vincent has been working hard to manage his small milling business, which has a milling machine. 

To help expand his business, Vincent has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase maize and rice millet for milling and will help Vincent to generate greater profits and improve his family's standard of living. 

Vincent hopes that in the future he will be able to buy a cow and start up a milk business. 

Vincent is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Vincent who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase maize and rice millet for milling.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is a 40-year-old lady from Migori, married to Joe. They have no children, but support 10 people from their extended family.

She sells vegetables and dried fish. She has had this business for the past six years with an monthly income of KES 11,000. 

She is now borrowing her second loan of KES 45,000 from KADET LTD, which she wants to use to expand her business by buying more sacks of vegetables and dried fish. She will use her profits to repay the loan and add stock to her business.

Her dream is to buy a plot and build her own home.

loans.use: To buy sacks of vegetales to sell to the customers

loans.name: Mouthanna

texts.en:
Mouthanna is an Iraqi youth client, who is 29 years old, married and has a single child. 

Mouthanna owns a small grocery shop and sells canned food, juice, soft drinks, dairy products, detergents and shampoos. He used to work in this field as an employee at a grocery shop, where he gained his experience. In 2008, after gaining all the needed experience, Mouthanna established his own business and gained the respect of his neighbourhood.

Mouthanna is requesting a $2,400 youth loan to buy two new refrigerators. He aims to grow his business and increase his profits, so he may be able to provide better living standards for his family.

loans.use: to buy two new refrigerators

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a 39-year-old man from Rulindo District in the Northern Province of Rwanda. 

He is seeking a loan of $50 to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. 

Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just $0.20. Paul started selling lights in September 2012 and he has sold 30 lights to date, providing clean energy to 150 people. 

He is also a farmer and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself, his wife Leonie and their four children.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Willys

texts.en:
Willys is a resident of Kongowea, Kenya. He is single and runs a second hand clothing business which has been in operation for the last two years. He also runs a grocery stall.
Willys was introduced to Milango by his friends and is asking for a loan of 21,050 Kenya Shillings to purchase additional stock of clothes such as skirts, trousers, dresses, and handbags. He looks forward to owning a boutique in the future despite the challenge of fluctuating prices.

loans.use: to buy stocks of skirts, trousers, dresses, and handbags.

loans.name: Kuturob

texts.en: Kuturob is 36 years old, and lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest free-port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is married with a six-year-old child. She is a high school graduate, and for the past 3 years she has been selling used clothes in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her husband. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. Her plans are to build a house and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James has operated a greengrocer shop, selling to his neighbours and passersby, for a long time. He faces a major challenge of high competition from other greengrocers. He dreams of establishing a fruit parlour in the future.

With the loan that he is requesting he wants to purchase bundles of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve his business and he is very appreciative of the last kiva loan.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions.

loans.name: Alyaa

texts.en:
Alyaa is a married youth client from Iraq. She is 23 years old, married and has two children. Alyaa assists her husband in providing the income of the family.

Alyaa is a tailor and works from home. She has been practicing tailoring since 2006 and specializes in tailoring both children's and women's outfits. She has gained good experience in this field and has gained an excellent reputation.

Alyaa is requesting a youth loan of $2,100 to buy a new sewing machine and to renovate her workplace. She is aiming to grow her business and increase her profits, so she may be able to rent a big workplace and expand her business there.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and to renovate her workplace

loans.name: Aadel

texts.en:
Aadel is from Iraq. He is 43 years old, married and has 6 children. Aadel works hard to provide for his family all by himself.
Aadel owns a small shop and specializes in selling and repairing watches. He has been in this field for over 15 years and established his own business in 2000. He has gained much experience in what he practices and is well-known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation since he has worked in the market for an extended period of time.
Aadel is requesting a sum of 2,400 USD to pay the annual rent for his shop. He aims to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may educate his children and afford to cover their school fees.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his watch shop.

loans.name: Esha

texts.en:
Esha is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya. She is a single mother of one child, who is a grown-up and does not completely depend on her. She runs a clothes shop which has been operating for four years.   

Esha was introduced to Milango by her friends and joined to access credit. She is applying for a loan of 62,650 Kenya Shillings to purchase a new stock of clothes for sale e.g. handbags, shoes, trousers, shirts etc.

Esha believes the income from this loan will help her meet her needs. She is focused on owning a wholesale shop despite the challenge of bad debts and the high cost of stock from the suppliers which makes most of her items beyond reach of the public.

loans.use: To buy a new stock of clothes e.g. handbags, shoes, trousers and shirts.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel operates a charcoal-selling business and his potential clients are neighbours and passers-by. He dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future. 

With the loan of KES 50,000 he wants to purchase sacks of charcoal and firewood for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve his business and again he appreciates the previous Kiva loan which helped him to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal and firewood for resale.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 23 years old and lives Montserrado County which has the largest free-port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is single with a three-year-old child which lives at home. 

She has been selling oil, rice, coal, onions etc. for the past two years. She started this business with help from her boyfriend and she learned this business from her mother. Her favorite part of her business is the profit that she makes every day, and the fact that she has lots of customers. 

She is requesting this loan to purchase more oil, rice, coal, onions etc for her business. She appreciates the supporters of BRAC Liberia, and she promises to pay back her loan on time. In the future, she wants to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, rice, coal and onions for her business.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a resident of Mombasa, Kenya. He is a married father of one child and runs a vehicle repairs workshop that has been operating for five years. He set up the business from capital he got through the help of his family members.

He was introduced to Milango by his friends and is asking for a loan of 83,450 Kenya Shillings to buy sets of spanners, screws and other spare parts for sale. He intends to use the extra income from the business to meet the needs of the family.

loans.use: To buy sets of spanners, screws and other spare parts for sale.

loans.name: Al-Forat Group

texts.en: Al-Forat is a group of four women from Taiz, Yemen. They asked for a loan of 240,000 YER. Ebtsam is a 32-year-old, illiterate married woman with six children. She lives with her husband and children in a rented house. They bought a small piece of land to build their own house. She needs money to pay for construction supplies, so she applied for a loan in the amount of 60,000 YER. She hopes, after completing the building of her house, to start thinking of a small business to help in improving her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to use for her house

loans.name: Amina Group

texts.en:
Amina is 31 years old, a hardworking woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband and one son. Her husband is working in a garment shop. Her son is eight years old and he wants to be a doctor. Amina is working hard to fulfill the dreams of her son. She has been helping her husband by stitching clothes in her house from 2003, as her husband’s income is too low to meet the educational expenses of their son. She has been operating her business very efficiently and honestly and her clients always appreciate her work.

As a member of a two-person lending group, Amina has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan. With the loan amount, she wants to purchase a new sewing machine as her old machine is not working properly and it’s very difficult for her to continue the business. She can increase her production by stitching more dresses in less time and she can work efficiently with a new sewing machine. 

With the profit amount she wants to pay the educational expenses of her son. She is very hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for her and she is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their help.

NOTE:In the picture Amina is raising her hand

loans.use: purchase a new sewing machine to stitch more dresses

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal, who appears in the picture, is an 18-year-old single woman who lives in Haja, Yemen. She  has completed secondary school. 

She is requesting a youth loan of 70,000 YER from AMB, which she will use to help cover the cost of purchasing a computer. This will help her to enhance her computer skills, and to do her reports at home. This will ensure a better future for her and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy computer for personal use.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is 28 years old and lives in Montserrado County. This county has the largest Free-Port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is married with an eight-year-old child who attends school.

She has been selling charcoal, oil, rice etc for the past two years. She started this business with money given to her by her husband, and learned this business from her friends. Her favorite part about her business is that it gives her good profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal, oil, rice etc for her business. In the near future she wants to own a house.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal, oil and rice for her business.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 37 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest free-port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is single with 5 children between 10 and 21 years old, which are attending school and live at home. She has been selling palm oil, rice, pepper, salt, vita, etc. for the past 7 years. She says her main challenge is the transportation cost. She started this business with money given to her by her mother and she learned this business from her friends. Her favorite part about her business is it gives her money. What make her proud is that it enables her to take care of children and herself. She is requesting this loan to purchase more palm oil, rice, pepper, salt, and vita to expand her sales. She plans to build a house for her children in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, rice, pepper, salt, and vita to expand her sales.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with three children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and house consumables.
For over three years, she has operated a vegetable stall, selling from her home to her neighbors and others that pass by. She faces a major challenge of seasonality when selling vegetables. Elizabeth dreams of establishing a grocery store in the future.
With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase stock of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions. 
She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph lives in the Kongowea area of Coast province. He is married and has eight children. He owns a timber shop which he has been operating it for two years now. He started the business with his little savings.
He learnt about Milango through friends with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operation of the business. The challenge he is facing is high cost of transport and scarcity of stock.
Joseph is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenya Shillings to buy timber, nails and other supplies for the workshop. His extra income from the loan will be used to pay for his children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy timber, nails and other supplies for his wood workshop.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is married and together with her husband they have two children. This couple always strives to give their children a good education and to insure that their needs are met.
Margaret has been working for the last 7 years braking up and selling charcoal. She buys the product in various cities in the interior of the country and sells it broken up in various sized bags.
She requests this loan to buy larger amounts of charcoal so that she can acquire it at a better price and earn higher profits to continue helping her family.

loans.use: to buy larger amounts of charcoal so that she can buy it at a better price.

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
Salim is a resident of Mombasa, Kenya. He is a married businessman, who runs a carpentry shop. Salim is also a farmer. 

He has been in the carpentry trade for the last six years. He obtained the start up capital from a micro finance institution. 

Salim was introduced to Milango by his friends and joined to access credit. He is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenyan Shillings to purchase timber, a planing machine and varnish etc. 

He believes this will help him educate his four children, despite the slight challenge of bad debts and inflation.

loans.use: To purchase timber, a planing machine and varnish etc.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is from Kisauni. She is married and together they have two small children, who are the couple's reason to struggle for success.

Gladys has a business selling fruit and vegetables at the town market. She occupies two stands. She has a fixed customer base, good income and good business and personal references. She is a hard-working woman and an excellent client.

She is asking for this loan to purchase fruit and vegetables to stock her store with products and to be able to continue giving her customers the quality they expect from her.

loans.use: to purchase fruit and vegetables to stock her store

loans.name: Eppian

texts.en:
Eppian is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya. He is a married businessman who runs a clothes shop, which has been operating for ten years.

He started the shop through the savings from a casual job in a barber shop. In the current shop, he sells men's clothing, dresses and shoes etc.

He was introduced to Milango by his friends and joined to access credit. He is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenyan shillings to purchase new clothing for sale. 

Eppian believes the income from this loan will help him educate his children and is focused on owning a wholesale shop despite the challenge of bad debts.

loans.use: To purchase new stocks of clothing for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy potatoes, bananas, and tomatoes.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Today Peter is happy working in his own salon with a fixed customer base.
He is requesting a loan to buy furniture, such as a chair, mirror and other items, for his shop, which will help him continue to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy furniture, such as a chair, mirror and other items, for his barber shop.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is a married woman, who has 8 kids that attend school. Her husband is a farmer and together they own a house that neither has electricity nor piped water.
Mwaka has operated a kiosk for the past 6 years. Her clients are ladies and gents in the area. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.
With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, beans, and sugar. 
She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, beans, and sugar for her kiosk.

loans.name: Rajwa

texts.en:
For the past years, Rajwah has had a sewing workshop, sewing clothes for customers, which has been a profitable project.

Rajwah is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the cost of purchasing an additional sewing machine and textiles to provide better quality to her loyal customers. This will increase sales and improve Rajwah's income.

The business has been a profitable project, but does not yet bring in enough money to cover the family's expenses and cover the costs of work.

Rajwah appears in her sewing workshop.

loans.use: To purchase an additional sewing machine and textiles

loans.name: Syeeda

texts.en:
Syeeda is 32 years old. She is a responsible and diligent mother of three children. Her husband died last year and one of her sons is currently studying in school. Her elder son is working as an auto mechanic in a workshop and this is the only source of income for her family. He is working hard to educate his younger brother and to meet the household expenses.

Syeeda has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan. Her son wants to open his own workshop. He is a skilled auto mechanic and their monthly income and savings would be increased if he has his own workshop. With the loan amount, he would also purchase some new tools and equipment for vehicle repairing and tuning. 

Syeeda is very hopeful for this loan and she is thankful to Kiva and BRAC for helping her.

loans.use: to open a new workshop and purchase repairing tools.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a resident of Mombasa, Kenya. She is a married mother of one child and runs a food cafe, which has been in operation for four years. The family also obtains some income from the husband's employment. She employs three other people in the business.

Elizabeth was introduced to Milango by her friends and is asking for a loan of 21,050 Kenyan shillings to buy sugar, baking flour, frying oil and cereals etc. The current challenge is the overall inflation.

Despite the high level of bad debts, Elizabeth believes she can save the extra income for the education of her children, provide a means of income to the other employees and also use part of the money to open a larger cafe/restaurant.

loans.use: To buy sugar, baking flour, frying oil and cereals etc.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a very hard-working person, who explains that thanks to his effort he has been able to get ahead. The previous Kiva loan has been a big help to him and he is very grateful for it. 

Today, he is requesting another loan, to be able to purchase poultry chicks and chicken feed with which he will be able to continue offering a wide variety and good prices to his clients. 

He is again grateful for the opportunity he is receiving because it will help him a lot.

loans.use: to purchase poultry chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Tseko

texts.en:
He is a very hard-working person who, thanks to his efforts, is getting ahead and helping his family day by day. He tells us that things are very difficult, but in spite of that he makes an effort to move forward.

He is asking for this loan in order to purchase clothing of all types to supply his business. In this way, he will be able to continue working and having sales that will give him the income to maintain his home.

loans.use: to purchase clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a stock of groceries such as maize, beans, rice and cooking fat.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul lives in the Mombasa area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is a married business man and runs a service shop mainly offering electrical repairs for motor vehicles.

Paul learnt about Milango through advertisements and joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are competition and bad debts, and the presence of fake products in the market.

Paul is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya Shillings to buy spare parts and kits. He believes that the business has improved enough to meet the required repayments and to be able to open another business to be run by his wife.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and kits.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is a single mother of three children; all of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (mother, niece, and nephew). She has a business of making envelopes for photographs and drugs. She has been in this business for 13 years. She doesn’t have any other income generating activities. She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more paper and glue. She works from her home seven days-a-week and sells on both a wholesale and retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She is aspiring to acquire a shop where she can sell her products and also to educate her children up to university. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more paper and glue.

loans.name: Yet

texts.en:
Yet is a villager from Kampong Cham province, age 32 and married. For Yet, rice and cassava cultivation is the main source of family income. This is the business that she has been with for 14 years.

Yet is a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In need of working capital, she is seeking a loan in order to buy an additional plot of farmland. She will use it for growing more cash crops. She hopes to gain a high yield, with more income for her family.

loans.use: To buy an additional plot of farmland for growing more cash crops

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Raksmey

texts.en:
Living in Kampong Cham province’s Prey Chhor district, Raksmey is 33 years old and blessed with two little boys. For her family, rice-cropping and bean-growing are the main sources of income; this is the business that she has been with for 11 years. 

Raksmey is a third-time client with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her past loan with success, and it has helped her to upgrade her lifestyle in good shape. Since she wants to expand her cash-crop growing business, she is seeking a loan to buy a plot of farmland for the upcoming replanting reason for this cycle. 

She hopes that she can grow her crops timely and fruitfully, so that she can earn more income to stabilize her living, and also buy more cows for raising.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland for the upcoming replanting reason for this cycle.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is from Balug province of Isabela. She is 53, married, and has two children. For 15 years, she has owned and operated a specialized home products sales where she earns PHP 5,000 a month. 

Josefina is now requesting a new loan of PHP 5,000, which will be used to purchase new items, such as detergent soap, bar soap, shampoo, and liquid soap, for her business . She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy detergent soap, bar soap, shampoo, and liquid soap, for her business.

loans.name: Cristo Es La Esperanza 4, 5 & 6 Group

texts.en:
Margarita is the coordinator of Cristo es la Esperanza (Christ is the hope) 4, 5 & 6. She lives with her long-term partner and their three children in a simple structure, located in a rural community in the city of La Romana. Specifically, the community is a batey (company town) founded for sugarcane workers.

Margarita says that her most important challenge is to have her own house and to raise her children providing their own safe home and all their needs. She operates a fruits and vegetables stall, a place where she sells goods to make daily income for food. This is a small stall in front of her house selling the most favored vegetables like plantains, cassava, potatoes, and veggies for salad. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business to buy vegetables, fruits, meats, charcoal, etc. 

Margarita is excited to receive her second loan with Esperanza, each one helping her to improve her business. With her profits, she will reinvest in her business and save. Margarita thanks all of you for your support of her business and her group.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruits, charcoal, etc.

loans.name: Naite

texts.en:
"Naite is a 70-year-old, married woman, who has four children. She has a small plantation, and she grows taro, taamu, bananas and yams, to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years.
Naite has requested a loan, which she will use to purchase farming tools and supplies, including fertilizers, chemicals, bush knives, weed killer, axes and rakes. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. With her profits, Naite hopes to improve her plantation and support her family, as well as her grand children's education."

loans.use: to purchase farming tools and supplies, including fertilizers, chemicals, bush knives, weed killer, axes and rakes.

loans.name: Chito

texts.en:
Chito is 35 years old and married with 5 children. He lives in Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. He owns and operates an agriculture business which is selling crabs in the local community to earn a living. He has been in his business for over 5 years and earns 20,000 PHP every month.

He joined GDMPC in the year 2011 and now he has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase additional crabs to sell. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional crabs to sell

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan is 30 years old and single. He lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. 

To earn a living, he owns and operates a transportation service in the local community. He has been in his business for over three years and earns PHP 8,000 every month. 

He joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) in 2012 and now he has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase spare parts and  new tires. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and new tires.

loans.name: Benito

texts.en: Benito, a 60-year-old fisherman and seaweed farmer from the town of Ubay, Bohol, is a married father of 13. Benito is requesting a loan to buy seaweed seedlings, rope, etc., purchases that will enable him to improve his seaweed farming business and augment his income. Moreover, he wants to save money to reinvest in the same business and to repay his loan on time.

loans.use: to buy seaweed seedlings, rope, etc.

loans.name: Inocencio

texts.en:
Inocencio earns a living through his motorcycle transport business. 

He is a married man and a father of three children from Ubay, Bohol. 

Inocencio is asking for a loan to pay for the repair and maintenance of the motorcycle. With this, he will be able to maintain the good working condition of his motorcycle.

loans.use: to pay for the repair and maintenance of the motorcycle.

loans.name: Jess

texts.en:
Jess is a 29-year-old married man and a father of three children from CPG, Bohol. 

He is engaged in a motorcycle transport business. He is also in a rice farming venture.

Jess is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm and fuel for the motorcycle. With this, he will be able to improve his businesses and income. In the future, Jess hopes to make his businesses successful.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm and fuel for the motorcycle.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia works hard to support her family. Ofelia is widowed and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Ofelia is requesting a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like soap, noodles, bread, spices, canned goods, etc., to sell in her store.

Ofelia has been in this business for 21 years now, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting for an additional loan build her general store and pig fattening business.

In the future, Ofelia would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy additional items like soap, noodles, bread, spices, canned goods, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Makerita

texts.en: Makerita is a 46-year-old married woman with three children. She has a small plantation that grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years. Makerita has requested a loan to buy more equipment to expand her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. With her profits, Makerita hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: buy a grass cutter, bush knives and fertilizer

loans.name: Japeth

texts.en: Japeth is 20 years old and single. He lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. He owns and operates a transportation service business to earn a living. He has been in his business  for over two years and earns 5,000 PHP every month. He joined GDMPC in the year 2011, and now he has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase spare parts and tires.  He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tires

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto is a 40-year-old, married man from Ubay, Bohol. He is a father of two children. The youngest is 10, while the oldest is 11 years old. Roberto is providing motorcycle services to the people in his community.  He transports passengers from one place to remote places.

He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy tires, fuel, and spare parts for the motorcycle. These purchases will enable him to continue to serve his customers and to avoid hassle and delays while transporting customers. In the future, Roberto would like to invest in other business ventures, to support his family as well as the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy tires, fuel, and spare parts for the motorcycle

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en: Rogelio is a 36-year-old married man from Carlos P.Garcia, Bohol. He is engaged in fishing; he catches fish, sea shells, and shrimp. He has been in this fishing business for 8 years. He requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy fish nets, nylons, and fish floaters to increase his volume of catch, as well as increase his sales. In the future, Rogelio would like to expand his business to improve his status of livelihood.

loans.use: to buy fish nets, nylons, and fish floaters for his fishing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase calling cards.

loans.name: La Buena Nueva 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Marcelina is the coordinator of the group La Buena Nueva (Good New) 1, 2 & 3, located in the city of Samana, in one of the rural areas surrounded by the waters of the Atlantic ocean. Many of the members are selling goods like clothing, shoes or cosmetics. Others sell seafood, run fried food stalls and other businesses. 

Marcelina is a married woman and a mother of eight children, five of whom live together with her and their father. She said that her most difficult challenge has been to built her house, which she started and still needs to finish. She is saving her business profits to produce capital and start investing it to grow her business. 

She sells clothing, shoes and cosmetics, and this loan, her 11th, will be used to buy these products to expand her inventory. She is hoping to make her dreams come true, have a prosperous life and a good business. She thanks all of you for your support!

loans.use: To buy clothing, shoes and cosmetics.

loans.name: La Buena Nueva 3 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Janira is the coordinator of the group La Buena Nueva (Good New) 3 & 5, located in the city of Samana, in one of the rural areas surrounded by the waters of the Atlantic ocean. Many of the members are selling goods like bread, clothing, shoes or cosmetics. Others sell seafood, run fried food stalls and other businesses.

Janira lives together with her long-term partner and her child. She is running a bakery where she sells bread. She started her business around seven years ago. She has been investing every loan to increase her sales and to buy different gadgets. This is her 12th loan. She said that her most difficult challenge has been to establish her business, but she has made it possible to sell bread to her community and others nearby. She will use this loan to buy ingredients for the bakery like flour, yeast, butter, salt and other products.

Janira is hoping to make her dreams come true: to have a successful business and provide for her family's needs. She thanks all of you for your support!

loans.use: To buy flour, yeast, butter, salt and other products.

loans.name: Muhamadjon

texts.ru: Мухамадчону 38 лет. Он с женой и четырьмя детьми проживает в районе Кубадиён в юго-западной части Хатлонской области Таджикистана. Жена Мухамадчон занимается сельским хозяйством, а дети учатся в школе. Сам Мухамадчон занимается растениеводством более 10 лет. Он в основном выращивает пшеницу и бахчевые культуры. Мухамадчон запрашивает кредит для закупа семян арбуза, минеральных удобрений и за оплату тракториста. Летом он надеется получить хорошую прибыль с урожая арбуза.
texts.en:
Forty-eight-year-old Muhmadjon lives together with his wife and four children in the southwestern part of Tajikistan's Khatlon province. His wife works in farming and his children go to school. Muhmadjon has been working in horticulture for more than ten years. He mainly grows wheat and melons. 

Muhmadjon is requesting a loan to purchase watermelon seeds and mineral fertilizer as well as to pay a tractor driver. In the summer he hopes to make a good profit off of his watermelon crop.

loans.use: to purchase watermelon seeds and mineral fertilizers and to pay a tractor driver

loans.name: Gavharoi

texts.ru: Гавхарой - женщина пастух. Она отлично умеет разводить крупно рогатый скот и мелко рогатый скот. Так как в семье не было сыновей, Гавхарой с детство помогала отцу в скотоводстве. Теперь приобретённые навыки и занятия отца стали источником дохода Гавхарой. Также она занимается дехканским хозяйством, от которого получает овощи, зелень и фрукты для ежедневного питания семьи. Вот уже тридцать лет она приносит "хлеб" в семью занятием скотоводство. В связи с временными трудностями связанное с финансами, Гавхарой решила обратиться за кредитом и доверила МДО "Арванд" свой будущий доход и благополучие. На приобретенный кредит хочет купить корм и крупный рогатый скот.  Заранее благодарит МДО "Арванд" за помощь и поддержку.
texts.en: Gavharoi is a female shepherd. She is great at raising cattle, sheep, and goats. As there was no son in her family, Gavharoi helped her father raise livestock as a child. Now the skills that she gained and her father's lessons have become Gavharoi's main source of income. Additionally, she works on a dehkan farm, where she gets her family's daily vegetables, greens, and fruit. Hence, her animal husbandry work has been bringing in her family's "daily bread" for 30 years. Due to time constraints associated with her finances, Gavharoi decided to turn to a loan. She has entrusted her future income and material well-being to MDO "Arvand". She wants to purchase cattle and cattle feed with the loan. She thanks MDO "Arvand" in advance for the assistance.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and cattle feed

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru: Назира трудолюбивая женщина, которая живет среди гор северного Таджикистана. Она выросла в сельской местности и с детства очень упорно трудилась. Ей не удалось получить высшее образование и таким образом, она осталась без высшего образования и без какой- либо ремесла. После замужества ей очень было трудно жить, так как пошли дети, а ее муж получал маленькую зарплату. Были и такие дни, что ей и ее детям нечего было есть. Она узнала о курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она имеет знания о бизнесе. Она планирует организовать бизнес купле продажей скота. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 долларов США для покупки скота. Она очень нуждается и ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Nazira is a hard-working woman, who lives in the northern Tajikistan mountains. She grew up in a rural area and has worked tirelessly since childhood. She wasn't able to get a university education. Hence, she was left without a trade. 

After marrying, Nazira's life became very difficult. She had children and her husband had a very small salary. Some days there was nothing for her and her children to eat. 

Then, she found out about a course called "Bring It On", organized by the Business Women's Association. She got a certificate from the course and now has the skills to work in business. She is planning to start her own animal trade business. She is requesting a loan of 1500 American dollars to purchase cattle. She sincerely needs your help and is waiting on your kindness!

loans.use: To buy cattle for starting a new business

loans.name: Shahlo

texts.ru: Шахло  очень скромная, трудолюбивая и целеустремлённая женщина. Она родилась в сельской местности, и имеет достаточный опыт по животноводству и выращивания сельхоз культуры. Детства Шахло прошла очень тяжело, то есть отец не имел постоянной место работы. Муж Шахло уехал на заработки в Россию, а сама работает уборщицей в школе. Уже более 5 месяцев она самостоятельно занимается животноводством. В целях повышения своей навыки Шахло, приняла участие на курсе «Добейся успеха» проведённого Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и «Имон Интернешнл». Она изучила много интересного, научилась составить бизнес планы, но у нее проблемы с деньгами. В семье в данный момент финансовые проблемы. Шахло планирует, чтобы её дочь поступила в университет, но на учёбу у нее не хватает денег.  Она должна зарабатывать деньги на учёбу дочери и  содержание семьи. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки скота, чтобы расширить свой новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Shahlo is a humble, hard-working, and determined woman. She was born in a rural area and has significant experience in animal husbandry and crop farming. She had a difficult childhood because her father never had permanent work. 

Shahlo's husband went to Russia to find work and she works as a cleaning lady in a school. Additionally, she started working in animal husbandry five months ago. 

With the goal of improving her skill set, Shahlo took the course "Bring It On", led by the Business Women's Association and IMON International. She learned many interesting things including how to make her own business plan. However, her family currently has financial problems. 

Shahlo is planning for her daughter to go to university, but she doesn't have enough money. She has to earn the money for her daughter's education and still support her family. She is requesting a 5000 som loan for purchasing cattle to start her new business. She is waiting on your kindness!

loans.use: To buy cattle for starting a new business

loans.name: Gulnoza

texts.ru: Гулноза очень трудолюбивая и целеустремлённая женщина. Она родилась в сельской местности, и имеет достаточный опыт по животноводству. Детства Гулнозы было очень тяжело, то есть отец уехал на заработки в Россию, а мама работала уборщицей в школе. После окончания средней школы она поступила в институт в заочное отделение. В свободное время от занятий она занимается шитьём, чтобы заработать деньги для  содержания семьи и помогать родителям. Уже более 2 месяцев она самостоятельно занимается этим бизнесом. Мать помогает ей в ведении бизнеса.  В целях повышения своей навыки Гулноза, приняла участие на тренинге «Добейся успеха» проведённого Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и «Имон Интернешнл». Она изучила много интересного, научилась составить бизнес планы, но у нее проблемы с деньгами. Она должна сама зарабатывать деньги на учёбу в институте и на своё содержание. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки швейной машинки, чтобы развевать свой новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Gulnoza is a very hardworking and determined woman. She was born in a rural area and has significant experience in animal husbandry. Her childhood was difficult because her father left to find work in Russia and her mother worked as a cleaning lady in a school. 

After completing high school, Gulnoza was accepted to the correspondence program at the institute. In her free time, she sews to make money for her family. She has been working like this for two months now. Her mother helps her with running this business. 

In order to improve her skill set, Gulnoza participated in the training "Bring It On", organized by the Business Women's Association and IMON International. She learned many interesting things including how to make her own business plan. 

Unfortunately, Gulnoza has money problems. She needs to earn money to pay for her school and to support herself. She is requesting a 3000 som loan to purchase a sewing machine so that she can develop her new business. She is waiting on your kindness!

loans.use: To buy sewing machine for developing her new business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction tools and office supplies.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
At the age of 24, John’s successful retail clothing store had grown from just one location to 22 in only three years time. With the success came the pressure to sustain a certain lifestyle. This inadvertently led to his role in an insurance fraud scheme that resulted in a 25-years-to-life sentence. 

John’s second chance came after working directly with the CROP (Convicts Reaching Out to People) program in his prison. This program brought teenagers in from alternative and delinquent schools to hear the stories of convicts and how their decisions as teenagers ultimately led to their incarcerations. Teachers and administrators were deeply impressed with John, in particular, and saw how his words drastically affected the students.  Many students wrote letters to John to thank him for turning their lives around.

When John had worked for five years with the CROP program, teachers and administrators traveled from San Diego to San Francisco to lead a campaign to release him from prison. After 20 years of incarceration, John was released into society on March 23, 2012. With just $600, John started his new life and career as a motivational speaker and author.

Today John travels through San Diego speaking at schools and counseling troubled youth. He is also the author of three books, including "The Dirty Nasty Truth: 18 True Crime Stories & 10 Life in Prison Stories to Stop Juvenile Delinquency." He hopes that, through his commitment to reaching out to juvenile delinquents, he can stop the cycle of crime and help them discover their goals and dreams.

A loan through Kiva will enable John to purchase more books to be sent to schools. His new book will be a resource that can be given to students that don’t have the opportunity to see him speak. With your help, John can reach students through San Diego and the nation.

For more information on John and his work as a speaker and author, visit www.stopdelinquency.org.

video.title: Kiva Borrower John from United States

loans.use: To provide books to at-risk youth.

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en: A citizen from Kampong Cham province’s Thbaung Khmum district, Pov, is 41 years old and blessed with five children. Out of her five children, only two kids still rely on her as they are still in school. Her 23 years of experience in rice farming and cassava growing has returned her about 16,400 KHR per day, and she saves about 4,400 KHR per day after deducting other expenses. She has never been with VisionFund before, and she is now forming a group of three to apply for a new loan.  All of them are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each. As the group leader, Pov will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor costs. She hopes to grow her cash-crop on time and double her income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay for labor costs

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Sothy's Group

texts.en: Sothy is 33 years old and married.  In her family, there are five members including her three children who are still in school. The rest of her family is living in Sampov Meas district of Pursat province. To deal with the daily cost of living, she grows cassava and sells grocery items as the main source of income. Her 10 years of experience in the current business has returned her about 41,600 KHR per day. This cycle, she is a fifth-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid back her past loans, which have supported her business with good growth. Now, she is in a group of five to apply for a new loan. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to plow her cassava crop and to buy more grocery items for resale. She hopes that this loan will support her business at a good pace and sustain her living.

loans.use: To plow her cassava crop and to buy more grocery items for resale

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert’s parents, Rob and Betty, were getting tired and older and couldn't agree: Do we expand or drop the 7-year-old catering business, R&B Kitchens? Weary of working as a cook at other restaurants, Robert seized the opportunity and took charge of the family business.
  
In addition to his mother’s teaching, Robert had honed his skills by attending culinary school. As a former chef for different restaurants, Robert said he wanted to be in charge and create food his way, but he always deferred to the head chefs, so he didn’t have the freedom he sought. So, his taking over the family business was a win for both his parents and Robert.
 
Now in charge of the El Paso business, R&B Kitchens, Robert says his plan is to expand the catering business by adding soul food to the Cajun menu, as well as adding a restaurant. His mother, whom he credits as the foundation for the family’s cooking talents, will cook alongside his father and sister at the restaurant.
 
While out shopping for restaurant equipment, Robert ran into an Accion Texas Inc. loan officer, who invited him to her office. After getting approved, Robert used his loan to buy supplies, as well as tables, chairs and shelves to remodel an older restaurant. Robert says with the loan, he was able to replace old wall tiles and repair mirrors.
 
Had he not received his Accion loan, Robert said he and his family would have had to have waited at least another month to open, since all they had to invest in the new restaurant was $500.
 
Within the next four months, Robert plans to hire more employees and establish a website.

loans.use: To renovate a restaurant.

loans.name: Bopha

texts.en:
Originally from the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Bopha is 54 years old and a married mother with eight children. 

To earn a living, she and her husband grow corn on two hectares of land. They have been doing this for 30 years. Her husband uses his spare time to earn extra income by driving a taxi.

Bopha is a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is seeking a loan to buy a decent car for husband to drive to earn extra income in his taxi business. She hopes to earn a high yield and relieve her family’s burden.

loans.use: To buy a car for her husband's taxi service.

loans.name: Khom

texts.en: A father of four children living in Kampong Cham province, Khom, is 47 years old and a farmer. He works in rice farming and cassava growing on two and three hectare areas, respectively, with the support from his wife. He has been involved in the current business for 27 years. Khom is not a first time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He has used his past loan to sustain his business with a good output. Now, he is seeking a new loan to buy fertilizer and to pay the labor fees for his farmland. He hopes to gain a high income for his family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay the labor fees for his farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy secondhand clothes, secondhand shoes and secondhand bags.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is 32 years old and married. She lives in Oroqueta City, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates an agriculture business where she plants and harvests mangos for sale to earn a living. She has been in her business for over 8 years and earns 20,000 PHP every month. 

She joined GDMPC this year, and she has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Her hopes and dreams are to have a better future and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 48 years old, married with two children. She lives in Oroqueta City, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a food-vending business in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over eight years and earns 20,000 PHP every month. 

She joined GDMPC in the year 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell such as viands, rice, softdrinks and snacks. Her hopes and dreams are to improve her business and living situation.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell such as viands, rice, softdrinks and snacks.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is a 46-year-old from Mabini, Bohol. She has six children. The oldest is 26 and the youngest is three years old. She is engaged in a food-vending business. She has been in this business for 15 years now. This is the source of her income. She earns 4000 PHP a month. Her husband is a farmer.

Marieta is requesting a loan to buy cellophane wrappers and sugar and also to pay to process her working child's documents. With the help of this loan, she can buy what she needs for her business and in addition there will be no more problems for the processing of the documents of her child.

In the future, Marieta hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy cellophane wrappers and sugar and pay to process some documents.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Anita works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables. Anita is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of meat and other ingredients for her food-vending business.

Anita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of meat and other ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes, shoes and bags.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila, a 42-year-old married mother of six, works hard to provide for her family. For the past two years she has run a general store in the Philippines, and earns additional income from buying and selling rice.

Having borrowed and repaid three previous loans from NWTF, Leonila is requesting a new one for PHP 15000 to buy additional items to sell such as canned goods, eggs, soap, shampoo, etc. She aspires to save money to expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell such as canned goods, eggs, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Daylil

texts.en:
Daylil is from Migpange, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old and married with five children. To make a living, she sells fish while her husband does the fishing. She has been in her business for five years and earns about PHP 5,000 a month from this activity. She joined GDMPC last year. 

She is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000, which will be used to repair her husband's fishing boat. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair her husband's fishing boat.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 62 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She has been farming rice for 37 years and earns additional income from a general store.

She is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF to pay laborers' salaries and buy additional equipment for her farm. Maria is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to pay laborers' salaries and buy additional equipment for her farm.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is a hardworking entreprenuer who cooks and sells food for meals and snacks to the people in her village. She also manages a store. She is 53 years old, married and had three children. Her income of about P10,000 each month is used for meals, bills at home and as revolving capital in the business. She would like to increase her sales and continue cooking delicious meals. That is why she is asking for a loan of P50,000 to buy meat, vegetables and soft drinks to sell.

Alejandra hopes to keep improving sales and income for the overall welfare of her family. She is very happy selling delicious foods, good products and services to all her customers. Her photo was taken in her food stall with her grandchild.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 43 years old, married, with two children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Arlene is borrowing PHP 13,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to buy vaccines, vitamins and additional livestock to sell.

Arlene has been raising livestock for 2 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy vaccines, vitamins and additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a 30-year-old married woman from Ubay, Bohol. She has an 11-year-old son. She is engaged in the farming business. She also has a second business, which is fishing, to supplement the other needs of the family. She has been in this business for 12 years now together with her husband. This is the source of her income.

Marilyn is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, seedlings, and a fish net. This will be used in her two businesses. With the help of this loan, she will be able to buy what she needs for the businesses.

In the future, Marilyn hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seedlings, and a fish net

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 57-year-old married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Merlita has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Merlita requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her tailoring business.

Merlita has been in this business for 23 years. In the future, Merlita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her tailioring business

loans.name: Bebina

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Bebina works hard to support her family.

She has a pig fattening business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Bebina is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs for her pig fattening business.

Bebina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Carla

texts.en:
She is running a business in her house by selling sandals, cigarettes, biscuits and instant noodles. She opened her kiosk 2008 with working capital of $400.

She is living in a town near the main road, so many people come to buy and she sells every day. 

Carla is applying for a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is making a good income and she wants to buy more stocks with the loan.

loans.use: To buy sandals, cigarettes, biscuits, instant noodles and other items.

loans.name: Santina

texts.en:
Santina is living in a town with her family. She opened her kiosk in 2010 with her own working capital of $100. 

Santina is generating a good income from selling her things from the kiosk. She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. A $1,000 loan is offered to Santina to improve her business.  

She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store like oil, detergent, soap, sandals, cigarettes, biscuits, noodles, vinegar, pens and sugar.

loans.use: To buy sandals, cigarettes, biscuits, noodles, vinegar, pens, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Sakhuon

texts.en:
Sakhuon, a mother of five children, is 52 years old and married. She is a local villager from Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. 

To support her living, she farms on a one-hectare area. To earn extra income, her husband also works for others for a fee and makes chicken coops for sale. She has engaged in the current business for 20 years. 

She is a sixth-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has used her past loans with success to support her living in a good manner and has fully repaid them. Now, she is seeking 2,000,000 KHR to buy rice seed and to pay for plowing and labor fees. She hopes that she can gain a high yield and make more income for the family.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and to pay for plowing and labor fees.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a 31-year-old married woman from Ubay, Bohol. She has two children. The oldest is 8 years old and the youngest is 5 years old. She is engaged in a farming business. She grows rice. She has been in this business for 2 years now. This is the source of her income. She earns about 3,000 PHP in a month.

She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and a tarp. A tarp is used to dry the newly harvested rice. Through this loan, she will be able to buy what she  needs for the benefit of her business. In the future, Marilyn hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and a tarp.

loans.name: Janeta

texts.en: Janeta is 32 years old and married with 5 children. She lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a fish vending business in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over 6 years and earns about 5,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in the year 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase materials for a fishing boat. Her hopes and dreams are to improve her living situation and her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials for a fishing boat.

loans.name: Sonia Camerao

texts.en: Sonia is taking a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store, such as sleepers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta) and biscuits. She opened her kiosk in 2009 with her own working capital of $600. She is a hardworking woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future

loans.use: to buy cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta) and biscuits.

loans.name: Juvelyn

texts.en: Juvelyn is 25 years old and married with 2 children. She lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a fish vending business to earn a living. She has been in her business for over 3 years and earns about 5,000PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 8,000PHP to purchase fishing materials such as nets and hooks. Her hopes and dreams are to improve her living situation and her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials such as nets and hooks.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel works hard to support her family. She is 38 years old and has seven children, five of whom are going to school. Maribel has a beauty parlor business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional products for her business.

She has been in this business for 10 years now. In the future, Maribel would like to expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products for her business.

loans.name: Richie

texts.en:
Richie is 32 years old and married with 2 children. She lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a banana production business to earn a living. She has been in her business for over 4 years and earns about 3,000 PHP every month. 

She joined GDMPC in the year 2011, and now she has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase chemicals for banana production. Her hopes and dreams are to improve her living situation and her business.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals for banana production.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 50 years old and widowed with three children. She lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. For the past eight years, she has owned and operated a farm where she plants and harvests vegetables to sell and earn a living. Anecita earns 5,000 PHP each month and she joined GDMPC in 2010.

Anecita is requesting a 7,000 PHP loan to purchase fertilizer such as manure. In the future, she hopes and dreams of improving her living situation and her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Charlyn

texts.en:
Charlyn is 25 years old and married with a child. For the past three years, she has earned a living fattening pigs in the Philippines. Charlyn also earns additional income from buying and selling piglets.

Charlyn is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She works tirelessly to attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Zafar

texts.ru: Зафар житель района Кубадиян, расположенный в юго-западной части Таджикистана. У него жена и двое маленьких детей. Ему 30 лет. Зафар вместе с женой занимается растениеводством. Он в этой области уже 5 лет. У него есть 1 га орошаемой земли, на которой он выращивает бахчевые культуры. Зафар запрашивает кредит для закупа минеральных удобрений, семян арбуза и за оплату тракториста. Он хочет получить хороший уржай арбуза для продажи.
texts.en: Zafar lives in the south-western part of Tajikistan in the Qubadiyon region. He is 30 years old, married, and has 2 young children. He and his wife grow crops. He has been working in this area for 5 years now. He has 1 hectare of irrigated land where he grows melons. Zafar is seeking a loan to purchase mineral fertilizers and watermelon seeds, and to pay for the services of a tractor driver. He wants to get a good harvest of watermelons to sell.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizer and watermelon seeds, and to pay for the services of a tractor driver

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is 49 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for her family. For the past four years, Nena has been running a general store in the Philippines.

Nena is requesting a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, canned goods, soap, noodles, and other products. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, canned goods, soap, noodles, and other items

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a livestock business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years and also earns an income from running a general store. Corazon has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. 

Corazon is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell. In the future, she dreams of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock to sell

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 30 years and also earns an income as a vegetable farmer. Rosie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF.

Rosie is requesting a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of vegetables to sell. In the future, she dreams of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda is married and lives in Ubay, Bohol. She raises hogs, which she has been doing for three years. Her husband is a baker.

Rosenda is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy feeds and vitamins so that her hogs grow healthy and free from sickness.  In the future, Rosenda hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins.

loans.name: Russel

texts.en:
Russel is 42 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She grows bananas in the local community, which she has been doing for more than five years. She earns 3,000 PHP a month. 

Russel is requesting a loan from GDMPC, which she joined in 2011, for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase chemicals for banana production. Her  dream is to improve her living situation.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals for banana productions

loans.name: Rosalia Da C. Fatima

texts.en:
Rosalia is applying for a loan of $ 1,000 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is running a kiosk in front of her house and she will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as fish in cans, oil, sugar, biscuits and other products. She is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future. 

Her kiosk is located in strategic place where many people come to buy including students.

loans.use: to buy fish in cans, oil, sugar, biscuits and other products.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 39 years old, married with one child. She lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates an agricultural business, raising bananas to earn a living. She has been in her business for over six years and earns 5,000 PHP every month. 

She joined GDMPC in the year 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase chemicals for banana production. Her hopes and dreams are to have a better future and improve her living situation and her business.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals for banana production.

loans.name: Demetria

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Demetria works hard to support her family.

She has a boneless dried fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig-fattening. Demetria is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to purchase more fish to make dried fish for her boneless dried fish vending business.
